Job Title: Product Owner – Store Systems (Planning, Warehouse & Inventory Management, POS)
Job Description:
WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU


We believe you share our IKEA values and that you are excited to join us in our journey to become the world’s leading omnichannel home furnishing retailer. You enjoy a real challenge, in an environment where everything is changing. We want you to join our journey to become a fully digital busines.

Our ideal product owner has managed complex products or large-scale platforms and is obsessed with solving for user needs
They are very technical, able to put themselves in the shoes of both our developers and end users, but also have an extreme attention to detail and user experiences.
They operate well in close partnership with their engineering teams, as well as drive initially ambiguously defined projects across the broader company.They have a passion for working agile and can think abstractly to incorporate taking in wider elements than their own area or product.
They thrive in navigating complex organisations, with multiple stakeholders in many countries
We are looking for a background or strong interest in managing Retail environments and creating platforms that form a core part of a Retail Operations chain, serving millions of IKEA customers every day.


A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US


Are you a passionate customer-focused product owner, who gets a kick out of creating, building and deploying products rapidly that make a meaningful difference?

We are looking for individuals who can become a trusted partner for technical and business focused stakeholders. We have a huge vision to deliver and we are looking for someone who can come into the role, establish themselves rapidly and start building new products to augment and replace multiple processes & systems.


Your Will:

Have responsibility over a large part of our in-store operations system estate, which is undergoing a sizable strategic change.
Maximize the business results and customer value resulting from the development and deployment of digital products by making trade-off decisions as neededSupport the Product Manager in developing the product roadmap
Ensure you have a good understanding of the product roadmap and vision as defined by the Product Manager to inform the creation and prioritization of the backlogActively manage the digital product backlog including clearly expressing product backlog items and prioritizing items based on business goals and optimization of work in the agile team
Involvement in sprint planning meetings to help provide clarity and elaborate features and user stories to help the team better understand the requirements and how success will be measuredDefine and deliver acceptance criteria and the ‘Definition of Done’ working collaboratively with the rest of the team
Work in-depth with our customers to understand and qualify their needs and requirements, ensuring they are included and integrated into the product as needed
Act as a subject matter expert for other Product teams, providing insight, context and additional information as needed to help understanding of what is required of the systems and capabilities.Working collaboratively with other Product Owners & Managers across INGKA Digital to refine the backlog and identify cross dependencies
Work cross-functionally to ensure that the agile team has what it needs and remove blockers that prevent the agile team to maximize the delivery of digital products
Work across initiatives within IKEA Group, contributing to a successful combined digital product deployments
We’re looking for candidates with the following background:

Strong Stakeholder Managers, whom have experience working in complex and/or international organisationsProven Product Owner experience, owning developing and deploying software products in an agile environmentApproaches product management from a view of the customer/user and is motivated by the chance to improve the experiences of our customersExperience of Retail either eCommerce/Physical or in Supply Chain/Fulfillment activities is not essential but a big plusExperience of POS, Warehouse Management, Inventory Management & Supply Chain Management systems is also a big plus
Has experience launching digital products across multiple countries with high stakeholder influence and multi-national complexitiesExperience with Agile Product Management Tools & Processes (JIRA, MIRO, Confluence, Roadmunk etc)Experience of working with iterative, agile product development and deployment teams, including key events and objects.
Ability to build strong and meaningful interpersonal relationships. Enabling you to collaborate with and advise stakeholders. Experience within a large multi-national organization is desired.Fluency in English is a must
This role is for an indefinite contract and is located in Amsterdam.


TOGETHER AS A TEAM


At IKEA we believe in people and that we are always better together. Within Group Digital we set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast-moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace. At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.


QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


You might have some questions about the position of Digital Rollout and Planning Leader or the recruitment process and that's a good thing! If you have job specific questions please contact lee.everitt@ingka.ikea.com

If you have questions regarding the recruitment process or other practicalities, please get in touch with Catharina Platoff recruiter at catharina.platoff1@ingka.com

We are looking forward to receiving your application and will review candidates continuously, so please submit your application as soon as possible.




We like to kindly ask you to expect some delays in response to your application, due to the Christmas and New Year Holidays

Product Owner Web
(Fulltime 38h)
For our growing team in Zwaagdijk-Oost (only a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam!) we are looking for a passionate and experienced Product Owner Web. Do you want to work for a successful international retailer? Action is currently in a very exciting phase with great digital growth, so join our team!
Meet your Team
As Product Owner Consumer Web you will be part of our Customer Experience & Insights team. At Customer Experience & Insights it’s all about our ‘digital customer touchpoints’ and how we can extract relevant data in order to further drive ROPO (Research Online, Purchase Offline) and increase turnover in our stores. Our Product Owners, UX, SEO, CRO, Loyalty Marketing specialists and Data Analysts work together agilely to map and influence the customer journey using tailormade content. Through our website, newsletter, social channels and soon also the Action Consumer Apps, we are building an omnichannel customer experience platform that will impact the entire Action organization. Do you want to work at the forefront of digital marketing at a rapidly expanding, internationally successful enterprise? Get into the digital Action!
This is your daily action
As a Product Owner Web you are responsible for carrying out a customer centered roadmap for our Action website. You will be involved in initiating, coordinating and implementing cross channel related initiatives. Your skills provide you with a helicopter view, commercial mindset and customer centered focus. You handle all different stakeholder demands that cross your path. You combine their wishes and ideas and guard the realization of new functionalities. You are able to handle any challenge and to translate the wishes of the stakeholders into executable user stories, which you will prioritize in the product backlog. You will make essential trade-offs in each sprint and guard the Agile mindset within the development teams.
In this role you will work closely with the other Product Owners headed by a Lead Product Owner. Besides that, you will work in an immediate collaboration with an external development agency which is located in Amsterdam.
As Product Owner Web you will be responsible for:
Prioritizing user stories based on customer need, insights of the business and requirements on development
Transparently communicating and managing the Web roadmap in close cooperation with internal and external stakeholders
Managing costs, time (progress) and scope of the Web development (including approving the completed functionalities and making the required trade-offs) to maximize budget effectiveness
Estimating required time, costs, and impact of implementing stories from the backlog
In collaboration with the Agile Coach you’ll be coordinating and facilitating sprint/release planning meetings, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, retrospectives and demos
Fostering and coaching the team for adoption of Agile tools and practices
Coordinating progress of the outsourced IT team and vendors

This is you
You combine a pro-active, innovative and positive attitude with a customer centered focus and commercial mindset. You abilitize strong people management, product leadership skills and with your analytical, pragmatic and can-do mentality you get things done in the right way. You understand how to drive a high impacted customer experience. You are an effective communicator, comfortable in aligning and working closely together with your key stakeholders from the Digital and Marketing departments within Action. With your Agile mindset you are able and willing to constantly adapt to changing realities.
Beside that we require:
Completed Bachelor or Master degree, preferably in Marketing, Communications or Technical Business Management with a strong and demonstrable IT component.
3-5 years of experience as a Product Owner, preferably within an omnichannel retail environment
Proven track record in (native apps) product development
Professional Scrum Product Owner I certified
Fluent in written and spoken Dutch and English
What we offer
We open stores internationally on a weekly basis. The rapid growth makes Action a successful organization and requires the organization to continuously adapt. It is expected that the department will expand further, so that there are plenty of opportunities for growth. In addition, the expansion of Action brings challenges in the online field. With an enterprising and proactive attitude, you can contribute to the further professionalization of our Digital department. Beside this we offer you:
Market-based salary based on a 38-hour working week
Pension
A laptop and a telephone
15% staff discount on your purchases from Action
24 holiday days and the option to buy 5 extra days a year (based on 38 hours)
Furthermore, Action was crowned best retailer of the year in 2019 and achieved this through the revolutionary way in which we expand and continue to focus on our customers. Our marketing is all about understanding the motivation and needs of our customers and our desire to keep surprising them.
Personal growth
The Action Academy offers various training modules with which you can further develop. Programs in areas such as leadership, communication, Excel and project management are offered in-house. In addition, external development and / or training opportunities are negotiable.
Interested?
Are you ready to take Action? Apply now!
Curious what’s next?
Our recruiter will review your application and will get back to you asap.
We’ll invite you for a first job interview.
We’d like to get to know you better. Depending on the position, we might ask you to take an online assessment.
We’ll invite you for a second interview to discuss your assessment and you will meet with perhaps one of your future colleagues.
Are we still a great match? Then we’ll make you an offer you can’t refuse!

ABOUT TEMENOS
We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.
We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.
Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!


THE ROLE
The Senior Consultant is responsible for providing high level support and expertise in one or more implementation areas of the product throughout the stages of TEMENOS products implementation projects. The Senior Consultant focuses especially on more complex issues, and provides guidance and coaching to less experienced Consultants.
The Senior Consultant is capable of working with clients or partners in leading the implementation of a specific product as part of the overall project delivery. Able to handle day to day challenges and owning the resolution of issues as they arise. The Senior Consultant will have a detailed level knowledge on a minimum of one particular product area, whilst also displaying similar awareness of industry and market trends/behaviours. A strong information sharing contribution to their aligned Centre of Excellence and input on Product and Process Improvement is also expected.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Focus on more complex functional problems, generally without day-to-day supervision or direction.

Provide guidance and advice to less experienced consultants in case of complex functional issues during the implementation and client relationships development.

Has strong proficiency in the tools, systems, procedures that are used to accomplish the job.

Demonstrate strong Stakeholder Management Skills with all contacts.

Successfully implement respective Product specialism.

Take a lead role in ensuring the contribution of others adds value.

Coordinate with the TEMENOS maintenance groups to ensure that the product problems identified are understood and resolved.

The Senior Business Consultant is expected to specialize in Internal, Domestic and International payments processes. Specific knowledge of the following: SWIFT, PSD2, SEPA / SEPA faster payments/SEPA DD, Domestic Clearing, CAMT / MT messages, ISO 20022.

Analyze client business requirements and relate them to TEMENOS products capability.

Identify and validate any gaps together with proposals for their resolution (e.g. workarounds or changes in processes) and ensure any solutions proposed are realistic and within the agreed scope of the project.

Define and validate customization needs for TEMENOS products as per agreed business definitions.

Writing of specifications, if and when needed, for local development and ensure Technical Consultants have a clear understanding of these specifications.

Prepare and perform the configuration of TEMENOS products through the definition of static and semi-static data for the installation of the core system.

Prepare and perform the functional testing to support User Acceptance Testing.

Review client organization, processes and workflows and propose of a ‘post-picture’ to maximize the benefit from TEMENOS’ products.

Make recommendations on best banking practices to the Project Manager and alert him on practices that might damage the client’s business or contradict legal requirements, before recognition as a problem by the client.

Conduct parts or all of the User training in a subject, which includes design, customization and update of Training Materials and Handouts.

Perform such other duties, functions and services, consistent with status or vocational ability, as may from time to time be required.

The role requires substantial travel – normally on client site Monday to Friday and back at weekends, however there may be periods where they will be expected to extend the periods away from home with TOIL given to compensate.


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Professional with a minimum of five years of experience in Finance or in banking software consultancy.

Must be fluent in English – verbal and written. Additional language skills would be of benefit.

Good understanding of financial and banking processes around one or more of the following: Payments Credits, Accounting, Treasury, MI, Asset Management,
Securities, Private Wealth Management, Trade Finance, Retail and Corporate Banking.

IT oriented: knowledge of a banking software applications, excellent knowledge in PowerPoint, Excel as well as other MS Office environment applications.

Temenos portfolio with expert knowledge in one specific product.

Strong awareness of Industry and market developments, good overall company knowledge.

Fully understand and be able to deploy the TEMENOS Implementation Methodology.

This job involves complex activities demanding considerable co-ordination to effectively achieve the jobs end results.

Awareness of other jobs in the project team is necessary as the job activities either influence or are influenced by these.


WHY TEMENOS

You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day.

You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best.

You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises.

You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity.

You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients.

You will experience what we call – Temenosity!
We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Marketing Analytics, Group Digital, Ingka Group
Job Description:
WHO YOU ARE


We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join us in developing new revolutionizing ways for IKEA to interact with our customers. We are using cutting edge methodologies within cross-functional teams, to improve customer experience – from marketing to customer support.

Our diverse team within Data & Analytics is growing even more and we would love to talk with you, if you recognize yourself in some of the following:

consider data to be the starting point for solving (almost) any business problem
enjoy figuring out how to use your extensive knowledge of SQL and code to derive insights from large datasets in order to solve real-life, fast-paced business problems
have an extensive background in analytics, computer science, engineering or equivalent (at least MS or equivalent)
loves to visualize data through advanced BI-tools and to tell compelling data stories to senior non-technical stakeholders
able to work with a balanced trade-off between care and speed, and understands that rapid insights may come at an initial cost of rigorousness
have extensive experience working in some of the areas of: customer analytics, personalization, recommender systems, marketing, promotional effectiveness or insight analytics. (ideally in a retail setting)
are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships with senior peers and loves sharing knowledge with more junior Data Analysts

after understanding a business problem, you are passionate about applying Data & Analytics to try and solve them
are a curious problem solver who wants to keep learning!
This is our wish list! If you don’t recognize yourself in all these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We like to think long-term and invest in people’s development together with us.

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values!


You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING DAY TO DAY


IKEA is taking huge steps in its digital transformation and our Data Analysts are working in cross-functional teams, building intelligent systems for data-driven business decisions. For example, we are developing models, dashboards and tools to answer questions like:

which marketing activities are effective and relevant?
can we predict individual customers’ interest and behavior?
how can we build a global visualization tool to measure the incremental impact of our loyalty program?
how do we build a global marketing framework for automating accurate predictions in real-time, while at the same time personalizing inspirational content and communicating to the customer in the right channel at the right time?
how can we design loyalty club member rewards to nurture a sustainable customer relationship?
can we quickly derive insights on why some customer segments respond particularly well to a marketing campaign?
how much should and will we be selling of each article over time and which commercial levers should we pull to influence this?
Perhaps you have your own questions to ask? Our goal is to create a better everyday life for the many people by creating a unique partnership with each customer. To do so, we want to give customers the most beneficial offer for them, exactly when they need it, and support them throughout their journey with IKEA in the best way possible.


OUR TEAM WITHIN IKEA


You will work in Data & Analytics together with other Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Stewards and Data Architects. Together you will be joining cross-functional teams consisting of colleagues from Technology, Product, Design, that designs, implements and deploys products that help to solve these kinds of problems. It will be a mix of product insights, data visualization and writing code – as well as talking with product owners and business stakeholders.

IKEA has long been a global leader in home furnishing. We are proud of our vision to improve the everyday life of the many people. But our industry is quickly changing and we need to adapt to stay competitive.

As part of IKEA’s journey to strengthen our digital capabilities, we are building a Data & Analytics function. This team is working on problems across the company, ranging from customer modeling, pricing, online shopping, visual intelligence to logistics optimization.

We can offer you:

Work on some very interesting problems as described above, and you are encouraged to spot new opportunities or to collaborate with Data & Analytics colleagues in other specialist teams
Opportunities to have global impact with your work
Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform and we use a lot of open source tools across the board
Hardware and OS of your choice
A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with outstanding experience across all aspects of Data & Analytics)
Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning)
Flexible and friendly working environment

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


Does this sound like your next challenge? IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global workplace. And as the world’s leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.


If you have questions regarding the recruitment process please reach out to our recruiter Annette Björkquist-Åhstedt at annette.bjorkquist-ahstedt@ingka.com.


Please apply with your application in English. Note that we can’t process any applications through email. Thank you!

Job Title: International Key Account Manager eCommerce (online accounts)
Job Description:
About Our Client
Fashion company with premium lingerie brands

Job Description
As the International Key Account Manager eCommerce (Online accounts) you will be reporting into the Head of Wholesales
Your responsibilities will be to:

Identify and follow relevant KPI's, track the necessary data and manage the weekly follow-up against the targets
Provide recommendations to drive shopper experience and market share, by utilizing data, keyword search and customer insights
Monitor and improve brand distribution, representation and discoverability
Engage and collaborate with multifunctional teams (marketing, trade marketing, B2B, sales, operations,…) to drive the execution of the business strategy
Support and coach the sales teams in digitalization
Partner with supply chain and the customers to ensure sales forecasting, product availability and customer service levels

Your profile
You have a Master's degree (ex. Commercial Engineering, Business, Economics, Marketing) with a passion for fashion

You have an advanced knowledge of web analytics, and knowledge of creative web design, site functionality, usability and marketing

A competitive compensation and benefits package
You will get the opportunity to learn, develop and grow

Het doel van de functie is het merk Summum Woman nationaal en internationaal verder te laten groeien. Je werkt aan het versterken van het merk en naamsbekendheid bij zowel consument als retailer.Binnen de functie leg je verantwoording af aan de Head of Marketing en werk je nauw samen met de sales-, retail-, e-commerce- en stylingafdeling.Werkzaamheden en verantwoordelijkheden: Marketing B2C: vertalen van collectieconcept naar marketing- en communicatieplan gericht op meerdere distributiekanaleninitiëren en organiseren van de marketingcommunicatie activiteiten op een dusdanige wijze zodat er optimaal aansluiting bij de merkbeleving en marketingdoelstellingen wordt gerealiseerdzorgen voor overzicht van de te verrichten marketingcommunicatie projecten die gekoppeld zijn aan de seizoenenopstellen en beheren van marketing- en campagnebudgettenhet fysiek tot uitvoering brengen van de concepten, zodanig dat de processen om het concept-to-market te brengen, optimaal verlopenaansturen van en nauw samenwerken met regionale PR bureaus, wat betreft het concept en uitvoeren van regionale PR plannenhet onderhouden van persrelaties, influencers (i.s.m. e-commerce) en het opstarten en organiseren van activiteiten, zoals persevents en product placement.het opstellen van persberichten en pr-documentatiesturing geven aan externe leveranciers. Naast PR o.a. fotografie, copywriting, print- en reclamebureausje bent (mede-)verantwoordelijk voor de media-inkoop binnen de gestelde budgetten behalve voor online en e-commerce. Dit gaat in samenwerking met de e-commerce managerRetail Marketing initiëren, plannen en coördineren van toegewezen marketingactiviteiten voor de Summum mono-brandstoresje denkt vanuit een omni-channel perspectief en weet dit te vertalen naar concrete marketingvoorstellen op basis van creativiteit en cijfers. Dit in samenspraak met de retail- en e-commerceafdelingbewaken van de communicatiekalender en zorgen voor complete en tijdige uitrol van de marketing activiteiteninstore materiaal: medeverantwoordelijk voor de inkoop, ontwikkeling en bevoorrading van POS-, etalage- en verpakkingsmateriaal zoals tassen, vloeipapier, stickers, cadeaupapier, klantenkaarten, ect.Marketing B2Bde planning en activering van alle wholesale/trade-marketing activiteitenje bent het directe aanspreekpunt voor alle marketing gerelateerde vragen van de wholesale klantenhet coördineren van de key-accounts, bepalen en uiteenzetten van individuele marketingondersteuning en actieshet voorbereiden en uitvoeren van diverse deelprojecten - klantenacties, introducties nieuwe producten - en projecten voor cross channel campagnesje ontwikkelt en activeert key-accountplannen, hierbij zorg je voor de bewaking van business goals, budget en merkstrategie. Je evalueert en optimaliseert key account marketingprogramma'sje bent (mede-)verantwoordelijk voor de organisatie van de collectiepresentaties (B2B) die vier keer per jaar worden gehouden.je bent (mede-)verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling, coördinatie en uitrol van diverse beurzenWij zoeken iemand met: een afgeronde HBO marketing, communicatie, modecommercie en/of mediaopleidingminimaal vijf jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functieervaring binnen een Retail gestuurde organisatieervaring met het werken binnen teamskennis van de Nederlandse – en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) has a client base of approximately 3,000. In the Netherlands, we serve clients with revenues exceeding EUR 250 million. In Northwest Europe (France, Germany, United Kingdom and Belgium), we serve clients in a variety of sectors with revenues exceeding EUR 100 million. We are globally active in 13 countries. We are sector-led, offering a wide range of services and products in global markets and lending and have specialized departments in Clearing and Trade & Commodity Finance.
Structured Finance & Portfolio Management (SF&PM) is the Lending product unit of CIB. All Lending products and expertise are clustered in SF&PM, with the exception of the specialties Trade & Commodity Finance and Clearing. SF&PM is responsible for the structuring of a variety of lending products for all sectors and segments. These activities are executed in the following departments: Lending, Structured Finance Origination, Central Portfolio Management, Infrastructure & Fund Management, and PE activities.
Lending provides (structured) lending products to new and existing large corporate clients domestically and internationally. Lending can be split into (i) Corporate Lending Europe, (ii) Lending NR/GTL including APAC and US and (iii) Specialised Lending. Corporate Lending Europe consists of specific Sector Teams including (i) Food, Retail, TMT, Leisure and Business Services (ii) Industries, Automotive, Logistics EU, Utilities, Construction and Real Estate, and the multi sector Execution Team.
In close collaboration with other product-teams of SF&PM and Risk Management, Lending is responsible for resolving complex tailor-made and bilateral- and syndicated financing issues of clients and is the ‘first-line of defence’ in the assessment credit risk based on (credit) experience and specific client- and sector knowledge. After obtaining credit risk approval from Risk Management, Lending negotiates the credit documentation with the client. In addition, Lending is responsible for monitoring the existing portfolio of (debt) transactions and the execution of imminent deals, including coordination with external advisors (legal, technical, insurance, markets).

Your job
Within Lending, two types of teams can be distinguished: (i) Sector Teams and (ii) the Execution Team. As a Lender in the Execution Team you will work closely with Lenders in the Sector Teams on a flexible and pre-dominantly sector agnostic basis. Collectively all Lenders have a shared responsibility for the credit relationship and management of the portfolio of European clients within SF & PM. This includes the structuring of complex tailor-made and bilateral financing solutions, advising, selling various lending products to new- and existing clients also in close collaboration with Client Coverage, Structured Finance, Global Markets, Risk Management etc.
As a Associate in the Execution Team you will work in close cooperation with Sector Lenders and your Execution Team members in managing the portfolio of Corporate Lending Europe. You can be part of Client Service Teams (CST) which are multiple product teams that are managed by the coverage banker to tackle client questions and develop commercial propositions. Together with Lenders from the Sector Lending teams, you will be involved in the origination and execution of deals including pitching to clients, writing credit applications, structuring transactions, reviewing and negotiating credit documentation, and coordination with external advisors (legal, technical, insurance, markets). In addition, the function includes the monitoring of the existing portfolio of (debt) transactions and contribution to internal projects in the areas of process optimization and innovation of the credit chain, regulatory developments and requests, sector deep dives, risk management projects, and organisation wide initiatives.

Working environment
You will be working with ~25 professionals working within Corporate Lending Europe covering ~250 clients. We work closely together ensuring that our portfolio has a balanced credit profile and grows in a sustainable way. We ensure our clients are serviced optimally within set internal/external parameters. Part of your job is to coach and develop Team members including trainees and interns.
You shall be working in Amsterdam. We work in an open floor space on the Gustav Mahlerlaan, where we have all stakeholders in our vicinity (Coverage, Risk, Products, Sustainability etc).
Your profile
We are looking for an finance specialist with former client facing, risk management experience, or credit structuring experience. Check your profile:
Educated university level.
Up to 3 years of experience in a client facing or risk management type of role.
Strong knowledge of international credit process (incl. credit application/processing/ monitoring).
Strong knowledge of specific market(s) and general credit market in which he/she is active.
Solid knowledge of ICT applications which support the commercial process.
Solid knowledge and experience of project /stakeholder management processes.
Good understanding of bilateral loans and documentation, average understanding of syndicated loan
Experienced with medium- to high intensity clients and prospects, preferably with (international) large corporates and/or international clients.
Basic knowledge of financial statements/tax/legal/documentation/insurance/technical.
Excellent in speaking, writing and reading of English and preferably control multiple other languages.
We are offering
The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits
A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
An annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on the function
A solid pension plan.
Interested?
Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible. To find out more, contact Bob Vogelzang, e-mail: bob.vogelzang@nl.abnamro.com. We very much look forward meeting you.

KARL LAGERFELD COMPANY PROFILE

At Karl Lagerfeld, we are driven by Karl’s mantra: “Embrace the present and invent the future”

The House of KARL LAGERFELD shares the creative vision and design aesthetic of its iconic founder, Karl Lagerfeld. Always contemporary and forward-looking. We are the only fashion house that carries Karl’s name at its doorbell and we’re thriving to live up to this responsibility in everything we do, every day with lots of joy and passion.
Our headquarters in Paris and in Amsterdam are home to a very diverse and driven Karl family from more than 25 countries creating meaningful stories and product concepts that connect to Karl’s world and iconic attributes.
Women’s ready to wear, bags, small leather goods and underwear are managed directly from our Amsterdam HQ other categories including men’s wear, footwear, fragrances, eyewear and more are developed together with best in class license partners.
We connect with our consumers at multiple levels – online and offline hand in hand. We thrive to maximize consumer engagement via more than 200 KL stores worldwide, our premium wholesale partners and our strong digital footprint, spearheaded by our KARL.COM flagship store which reaches 96 countries. With digital channels representing already more than 30% of our overall full price business.
We are a dynamic, fast growing and inclusive company built on professionalism and strong values. Across all areas of our business, at KARL LAGERFELD we commit working toward highest standards of sustainability and integrity. In 2019, KARL LAGERFELD joined as a founding member the Fashion Pact, a global sustainability initiative seeking to transform the fashion industry through objectives in three areas: climate, biodiversity and ocean protection.
JOB SUMMARY / PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

Provide support in day to day tasks within the Retail Department.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE:

Communication: Development of weekly store communications
Reporting, analysis and presentations: Prepare weekly and monthly reports, analysis and presentations in relation to trade, ranking, tax free, commercial activities
Customer Relationship Management: Collect and analyze CRM data
Packaging: Responsible for stock management and development of packaging
Support the Retail department with ad-hoc activities & projects
Store openings: Support the operational preparations of new store openings
Seminars: Support the organization of the bi-annual Store Manager Seminar and other in-season meetings & trainings
Customer Care: Daily follow up and tracking of Retail Customer Care
Administration: Support the Retail Managers with maintaining a structured documentation of key documents
Support Store Managers in operational and administrative tasks
MAIN RELATIONSHIPS:

Karl Lagerfeld Stores

SKILLS, EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

From 3rd year of Bachelors studies in Management and International business
Language: fluent in English, both verbal and written French or German is a plus
Numerical skills
Familiar with MS Office

PROFILE:

Able to work independently as well as in a team
Able to work in an international work environment
Interest & passion for the fashion industry
Flexibility, adaptability and a positive "can-do" attitude are a must
Ability to prioritize and multitask

Please note that if your application is successful we will contact you within three weeks.

Ben jij in je element als spin-in-het-web tussen marketing en sales? Heb jij relevante marketing ervaring en kun jij onze merkwaarden doorvertalen naar de winkelvloer van onze dealer? Heb je bovenal een proactieve, ondernemende houding en wil je aan de slag in een leuk team binnen een dynamische, jonge organisatie? Dan is Allshoes Safety Footwear op zoek naar jou!

Vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Amsterdam bouwt de TM aan de merken van Allshoes op retailniveau, o.a. door het doorvertalen van onze merkwaarden naar de winkelvloer van onze dealers. Innovatie is een belangrijk onderdeel van de Allshoes marktbewerking. Van de TM wordt verwacht dat alle benodigdheden ter ondersteuning van deze innovaties ontwikkeld worden. Hiermee zorg je ervoor dat de vertaalslag naar onze B2B klanten gemaakt wordt. Verder ondersteunt de TM ons sales team bij het managen van digitale salesfunnels, met name om nieuwe partners buiten Nederland aan ons te binden. Daarmee draag je bij aan het sales doel om deze prospects uit te bouwen naar klanten.
De taken en verantwoordelijkheden van de Trade Marketeer:
- Jij bent een rots in de branding voor de marketing- en salesafdeling. Met deze collega's werk jij nauw samen om de behoeftes van onze klant in beeld te brengen;Jij zorgt ervoor dat relevante Point-Of-Sale materiaal beschikbaar is. Jij weet waar onze klanten behoefte aan hebben en je maakt hiervan de vertaling van onze merken naar materialen. Deze regel jij van a tot z. Het ondersteunende reclame materiaal wordt nationaal én internationaal gebruikt. Je bent hierbij verantwoordelijk voor de vormgeving en productie van vrijwel iedere uiting en houdt deze up-to-date. Je werkt hiervoor samen met ons reclamebureau;Jij stelt B2B sales materialen op ter ondersteuning van lanceringen (digitaal dan wel geprint), waaronder de doorvertaling van het Allshoes businessplan naar een salesplan presentatie;Jij ondersteunt onze business development managers middels het managen van digitale automated sales funnels;Jij zorgt samen met de Marketing Communicatie Manager voor B2B digitale nieuwsbrieven;Jij optimaliseert onze B2B webshop, op basis van interne & externe input;Jij zorgt ervoor dat klanten altijd digitale productinformatie ter beschikking hebben;Jij zorgt voor afhandeling van ad-hoc verzoeken van klanten m.b.t. marketing materialen en advertenties.
Wat verwachten wij van jou?
Wij zijn vooral op zoek naar een teamplayer met de juiste mentaliteit en drive die past bij onze cultuur. De onderstaande punten helpen jou om van deze nieuwe TM-rol een succes te maken:Een afgeronde hbo studie in de richting van marketing/communicatie;Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse én Engelse taal, in woord en geschrift;Beginnende relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol. Dit mag ook aan bureauzijde geweest zijn;Affiniteit met merkartikelen en ervaring met concept selling;Aantoonbare ervaring in het opstellen van sales materialen en klant presentaties;Soft skills: proactief, ondernemend, interpersoonlijke vaardigheden, analytisch, open mind-set, conceptmatig sterk en creatief;Jouw manier van werken sluit goed aan bij de kernwaarden van Allshoes: teamgeest, volharding en durf;Ervaring met Photoshop en InDesign is een pré.
Meer informatie over Allshoes
Allshoes – onderdeel van multinational Bunzl – is een van de grootste spelers in de Benelux als het gaat om veiligheidsschoenen. Schoenen waarbij veiligheid en de laatste modetrends hand in hand gingen en nog steeds gaan. Wij bedienen zowel de B2C als de B2B markt.
Allshoes zit momenteel midden in een transformatie van een klassieke groothandel naar een ondernemende marketing-, sales- en data-gedreven organisatie. Onze strategie is om vol in te zetten op de pijlers innovatie, internationalisatie, klantgerichtheid en het zijn van een Great Place to Work. Ook willen wij graag vooruitstrevend zijn op het gebied van duurzaamheid en hebben we de ambitie om in 2025 volledig circulair te zijn. Daarnaast heeft Allshoes een prachtig nieuw kantoor in de Houthavens te Amsterdam, dat uitkijkt op het IJ.
Onze ambitie is echter nog groter; wij willen met Allshoes verder groeien op de Europese markt van veiligheidsschoenen. Hier richt onze strategie voor de komende jaren zich dan ook op; samen veroveren we eerst Europa en dan daarna de rest van de wereld, paar voor paar. Ga jij als nieuwe Trade Marketeer samen met ons deze grenzen verleggen?
Meer informatie over Marketing & Sales
Marketing is verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van campagnes, media beleid, b2c e-commerce en product ontwikkeling. Daarnaast is het team voortdurend in de weer met het optimaliseren van onze digitale saleskanalen, met behulp van inzichten uit data, en het digitaal onderhouden van relaties met voornamelijk ZZP eindgebruikers.
Sales is verantwoordelijk voor alle commerciële activiteiten rondom het behoud en uitbouwen van de reeds sterke positie in de diverse kanalen. Deze klanten worden via diverse kanalen bewerkt; e-commerce, retail, groothandel, dealers en direct. Binnen deze kanalen wordt samengewerkt met puur technische partners en met specialisten op het gebied van persoonlijke beschermingsmiddelen (PBM).
Wat staat er voor jou tegenover?
Als Trade Marketeer bij Allshoes krijg jij een goed salaris. Naast je salaris werk je ook met een bonusprogramma dat opgebouwd is uit bedrijfsdoelstellingen en jouw persoonlijke doelstellingen. Wanneer je fulltime werkt, krijg jij van ons 26 vakantiedagen om heerlijk op te laden. Je bouwt pensioen op via LifeSight. Jaarlijks mag je zelfs 3 (betaalde) werkdagen besteden aan duurzaam vrijwilligerswerk. Uiteraard is er voldoende mogelijkheid om je te ontwikkelen. Jouw nieuwe collega’s werken met plezier en zijn trots op elkaar en de resultaten die we samen behalen. We hebben iedere dag een gezamenlijke lunch en zorgen voor voldoende fruit op kantoor, zodat jij gezond je dag doorkomt! We organiseren vele leuke (sportieve) uitjes en activiteiten en natuurlijk de vrijdagmiddagborrels.
Is dit jouw baan?
Ben jij enthousiast geworden en denk je dat je goed in ons team past? We ontvangen graag je cv, maar belangrijker nog, een korte motivatie waarin je jouw toegevoegde waarde uiteenzet!
Heb je vragen? Neem dan contact op met Sophie Heering (Talent Manager Allshoes) via 06-22870967.

New Markets Lead, EMEA
The Role
The EMEA New Market Leader owns the expansion roadmap and its successful implementation across all new markets in EMEA. He/ She collaborates with relevant teams and stakeholders across the entire project value chain from planning to realization on the ground for all projects related to expansion into new markets. Key stakeholders are real estate, market leaders and various HQ-functions to make sure we are staying on track to plan and proactively following up on our expansion plans. This role requires a strong leader that is familiar with business operations, has acute attention to detail, executes at a high caliber, and successfully drives projects through to completion. The EMEA New Market Lead is a member of the EMEA Leadership Team. .
Responsibilities:
Define the growth strategy and market entry plan for new markets in EMEA
Lead the necessary research and analysis required to create holistic business plans for new market entries. Including risk/opportunity analysis, Financial analysis, end to end requirements gathering, and timeline definition.
Lead the search and negotiation to open new markets and “un-chartered” territories – consolidating, aligning and driving the various stakeholders and parties that contribute to a market opening and ensuring its success
Coordinate the launch efforts for new markets across the various supporting functions ensuring all aspects of launch are managed in a timely manner, including website readiness, tax/trade, entity creation, communications, product readiness, homologation, Sales operations, Financing products
Work closely with Retail Development and Charging teams to ensure the necessary infrastructure is in place to support new market entries.
Where necessary, develop and nurture partnerships with third parties
Support in hiring first Tesla team members in new markets
Work with various teams to coordinate input of critical supplementary teams such as EHS, Security (physical security on site), HR (for workplace experience) and other to ensure our expansion efforts are supported and our physical footprint his healthy.
Work directly with key stakeholders to develop and execute against each new market’s growth plans. Be the conduit of information for all supporting functions involved in launching new markets.
Collaborate closely and build strong relationships with corresponding teams, contributors and stakeholders in other regions.

RequirementsStrategic thinkerSolid management experience, including managing Managers, hiring and developing high-performing teamsAble to influence at all levels internally and externally to drive decision making
Ability to deal with change and ambiguity, thriving in a fast-paced/ high-intensity environmentInnovation / re-writing the rules, challenging status quo,Demonstrated success in setting goals and priorities and driving for resultsHands-on approachExcellent analytical and communication skillsRelentless energy, and a strong drive for excellenceFlexibility in travel as required in roleFluent in EnglishPassion for Tesla’s mission to accelerate the transition to sustainable transportationAny additional European language is a plus.

Job Title: Sales Support Manager EU | TP Vision
Job Description:
About Tpv Technology
TPV Technology is an internationally-renowned PC monitor, TV and Digital Signage Displays manufacturer. TPV serves as an original design manufacturer for some of the best-known TV , PC and Digital Signage Displays brands in the industry and distributes its products worldwide under its own brands AOC and Envision. In addition, the company designs, produces and sells Philips-branded monitors, TV's and AVA products, Digital Signage Displays and mobile phones through a license agreement with Philips via its subsidiaries TP Vision and MMD. As an example, the company brings high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. TPV believes in creating products that touch the human senses and are within reach of all consumers in the markets they operate in. As a leader in the hotel industry, their hospitality TV division serves most the world's major international and national hotel groups, as well as individual hotels, hospitals, cruises and other professional facilities.

About Tp Vision
TP Vision is a consumer electronics key player in the world of audio visual digital entertainment. TP Vision concentrates on developing, manufacturing and marketing Philips branded TV sets (Europe, Russia, Middle East, South America, India and selected countries in Asia-Pacific) and audio products (all around the Globe). We do this by combining the innovative Philips brand heritage with our design expertise, operational excellence, flexibility and speed of TPV Technology. With these combined strengths, we bring high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. We believe in creating products that offer a superior audio and visual experience for consumers. With Philips TVs, TP Vision is a global leader in the hospitality market. TP Vision is the exclusive brand licensee of Philips TVs for the above listed countries and, on the global stage for the Philips audio products.TP Vision employs close to 2,000 people in several locations around the globe and is 100% owned by TPV, one of the world’s leading monitor and LCD TV manufacturers, selling and marketing Philips branded TVs in China. TPV has been able to drive its growth over the years by leveraging its economies of scale and core competencies in R&D, manufacturing, logistic efficiency and quality.

Scope
Amsterdam (The Netherlands) – The Sales Support Manager is part of the European Sales Support Team. The Sales Support Manager is responsible for Europe and will report directly to the Head of Global Sales Support. For this role the Sales Support Manager is the linking pin between customer needs and operations and responsible to manage the CX for all products. In this role the Sales Support Manager has a good knowledge of all the products and knows how to translate the problems that occurs, to the back end of customer service. The Sales Support Manager will focus on improving customer service on diverse projects, makes sure that the service policies are up to par and reports/communicates on diverse levels of the organisation.

Responsibility
Co-develop Consumer Care Policies and new service scenarios and responsible for the implementation and alignment with the respective CS teams
To execute country/SO Service policies which support the global consumer care ways of working
To provide leadership and expertise to support the country/SO team in executing Marketing strategies, i.e., warranty policies, return policies, concession policies, service scenarios, etc. and align with the respective BE teams for implementation and execution
Contact window for Sales team for escalations, coordinate with CS teams for customer solution, communicate and update Sales
To maintain and distribute warranty policy documentation for the respective business and markets


What Do We Offer You
Fulltime position and competitive rewards , based in Amsterdam
An interesting, dynamic, challenging, and fast-moving international working environment
Opportunity to grow true business sense


Education And Related Experience
Min. 8 years business experience (consumer care experience is preferred)
Academic / Higher Business School or via experience
Knowledge of Consumer Care (or related areas) processes
Insight and knowledge of Market developments
Trade & Retail knowledge
Knowledge of Net Promoter Score Management


More Info
If you enjoy working with knowledgeable, success oriented people, for a company that both challenges and respects its professionals, and you've got what it takes to be a great Sales Support Manager, then apply today. Please contact Chelsea Nguyen (Corporate Recruiter) at Chelsea.nguyen@tpv-tech.com (please include your CV and a short motivation).

We’re looking for a Senior Strategy Associate to join Booking.com’s Flights Strategy & Operations team. As a Senior Strategy Associate, you will be responsible for helping shape the future of Booking.com, the leading global player in the $2 trillion online travel industry. In this unique role you will be working on high-impact, challenging and cross-functional flights projects, with frequent direct exposure to senior leadership. You will be a key contributor to growth of the flights business, driving the overall strategy development, leading strategic initiatives, and forging new paths to optimize business performance while collaborating across multiple internal teams and external partners.

The Booking.com Flights Strategy & Operations team is a growing team that drives the long-term strategy and business planning for the flights vertical, supports strategic decision-making, leads initiatives to optimize business / financial / marketing performance, co-develops our supply growth strategy, and leads backoffice operations workstreams. The Sr. Strategy Associate will be instrumental in laying the strategic commercial foundations for a rapidly growing business as we are focused on becoming a globally competitive flights OTA, requiring ongoing evolution of our business growth strategy and optimization of short-term performance while supporting long-term decision-making. In addition to supporting our long-term growth, there will be ample opportunity to make a significant and measurable short-term impact on the business through analysis of our sales performance, revenue optimization, and supporting ongoing business operations workstreams.

Booking.com is the world’s leading online accommodation site, and a global top-5 e-commerce company, and boasts a dynamic culture and diverse workforce. The ideal candidate is someone who is keen to develop and grow within the role and be challenged to take on additional projects and responsibilities as they present themselves, while remaining agile and focused on the key priorities. We are looking for a results-driven, rigorous problem-solver with a sharp analytical mind, with high attention to detail and customer obsession, who is able to think creatively and has excellent communication skills. Most importantly, we are looking for someone who is excited about the opportunity to help drive the flights business forward, enabling Booking.com to achieve our mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

B.Responsible

Support development of both short-term and long-term flights strategies to drive business growth by using external and internal analysis, developing a compelling storyline to drive alignment, presenting to stakeholders across the business, and driving resulting initiatives
Support strategic decision-making amongst flights product and business leaders by providing key commercial guidance and driving alignment with the overarching flights strategy
Partner with our FP&A and flights data teams to lead regular analysis of sales and financial performance, communicate trends and performance drivers, identify opportunities, and recommend strategies and tactics to achieve business goals
Collaborate across the flights team to optimize our cross-channel revenue strategy, drive alignment on long-term objectives, identify and communicate strategic trade-offs generated by various activities across the business
Lead expansion of our price benchmarking capabilities, own the flights price benchmark measurement and drive analyses with our data team and supply partners to improve price competitiveness
Develop the foundations for flights pricing strategy, utilizing sales performance analysis and price competitiveness data to drive achievement of financial and business objectives while also identifying areas of knowledge to build through experimentation in support of future flights pricing capabilities
Work closely with the flights product marketing manager to ensure our pricing/revenue strategy is driving achievement of performance marketing objectives and financial targets
Support and/or lead elements of the annual / quarterly strategic planning process including linking the annual budgeting process with the long range strategic planning process
Support strategic initiatives within Product Marketing, Supply Business Development and Backoffice Operations areas of the Strategy & Operations team as needed

B.Skilled

Ideally the candidate would bring 5+ years work experience, including several years of commercial experience in the flights industry, specifically in revenue management, competitive analysis, and/or strategy development is highly desirable
Significant experience required in analyzing performance data to identify opportunity drivers, prioritizing across multiple quantitative and/or qualitative attributes, and working collaboratively to develop strategic plans to capitalize on the identified opportunities
Strong data analysis skills using Excel and/or Google Sheets is required, including the ability to handle large data sets, utilize various methods to uncover and communicate key findings, and utilize to develop various sales & financial models in support of flights strategy development
Knowledge of SQL and other data gathering and analysis techniques is a plus
Experience working with a data analytics team to drive visibility on key business performance indicators through reporting and/or dashboard development and coordinating deeper performance analyses is a plus
Significant experience in influencing stakeholders at multiple levels of the organization
Ability to distill complex business issues and strategies to highlight insights and actionable recommendations in a concise and persuasive manner
Ability and preference to take ownership, entrepreneurial, proactive with positive attitude, a self-starter who can manage multiple initiatives/priorities
Creativity and “out of the box” thinking that drives innovation
Results driven, pragmatism and ability to learn, test and iterate quickly.
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Data driven personality, with ambition to build a great business.
Expertise in technology, ideally in travel, e-commerce, retail, payments, and/or consumer facing products is a plus

Bedrijfsprofiel
Family owned company, leader in the homecare business for 5 generations, Americain roots. Develops smart, innovative yet practical home cleaning solutions, inspired by real life. Tradition, innovation and passion. Market leader in the States; challenger in Europe. Premium price positioning. Growing fast. Still a lot of potential. Distribution by stores (DIY, food, electronics) and online (brick & mortar). Focus in Europe on Germany, France, UK, Italy and client Amazon. Close cooperation with distributors.
Bedrijfscultuur
Growing fast, rapidly changing environment. Strong ambitions. International team, different nationalities.

you identify omni-channel business opportunities through analysis of market, channel, customer en shopper data

Functie eisen

You want to improve things and you are not afraid for changes. You are full of initiative. Strong in analysing and solving problems. Creative. Decisive, positive and perseverant in reaching your goals.

Become part of the Converse Team
Converse is a place to explore potential, break barriers and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Converse, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving world to make things better as a team.
Without You, We’d Just Be Collectors of Our Own Stuff
Business equals selling stuff. That’s the basic model. The more complex awesome model is creating stuff that people identify with and then you figuring out how to get it to them. We need people like you: creative, dynamic problem solvers who see it as more than business. Who see it as giving people the tools of self-expression and individuality.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We’re looking for an experienced buyer to join our team as Senior Buyer for WE Converse Stores.
This role will provide merchandising excellence in the development of consumer right assortments for our Outlet Stores across the WE value marketplace.
The candidate needs to have a passion for balancing the art and science of assortment building, whilst ensuring profitable growth targets are met in a dynamic trading environment.
This role requires a highly collaborative teammate with strong communication skills who is eager to own and drive the end to end process.

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
If this is you, you’ll demonstrate product aesthetic and apply retail acumen, whilst partnering cross functionally to get the right product in the right place, at the right time.
You’ll obsess the consumer and connect marketplace trends to global and regional product inventory offers, driving the assortment all the way from concept to in-season trade through the go-to-market process.

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
The Converse Stores team is a diverse cross-functional team consisting of Merchandising, Operations, VM/Marketing, Field and Finance. Together this team is driving the business across our WE Store marketplace.
You will collaborate with the cross functional GMM team consisting of Buying, Planning and Allocation. You will align on a market wide assortment strategy, serving at the pace of the consumer through product, speed and local relevancy.
You will be responsible for recruiting and leading our annual Buying Internship.
This position reports into the GMM Director for Converse Stores.
WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Merchandising, Marketing or related field required
+5 years relevant work experience in merchandising, integrated retail and/or product creation
Proven and tested retail experience in a buying, planning and/or merchandising function
Fully proficient in assortment planning, retail acumen, marketplace knowledge, consumer insights and line planning
Consistent record to ideate and apply creative thinking, including retail execution concepts in partnership with VM & Marketing
Fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong multi-tasking, organizational and problem-solving skills
Ambitious, autonomous and information seeking attitude
Approximately 10% travel required (domestic/international)
Converse is more than a company; it’s a worldwide advocate for self-expression. This belief motivates our employees, permeates our working environment and inspires our products. No two of us look or think exactly alike. We are each one-of-a-kind. Individually and as a culture, we have the freedom to create and grow professionally. Generous benefits packages only sweeten the experience. From Boston to Shanghai, from Brand Design to Finance, Converse is a brand that celebrates the unique and creative people of the world. Together, we’re different.

Revenue Growth Manager

At Britvic Tessiere International we're on a journey to become the most dynamic, creative and trusted drinks company in the world - creating a better tomorrow.
As one of the leading players in the FMCG market, we pride ourselves on setting high standards, being courageous and pushing ourselves to think outside of the bottle.
Britvic Teisseire International is responsible for the BeNeFraLux home markets and the global expansion of Britvic owned brands including Teisseire, Mathieu Teisseire, London Essence and Britvic Mixers.
