STUDENT JOBS
Full-time
Graduate Programme - Sales
Amsterdam
Netherlands
As a Graduate at Red Bull The Netherlands 2021, you will have the opportunity to dive headfirst into the Sales Off Premise Team. The Off Premise Team within Red Bull Netherlands is commercially responsible for all activities contributing to the sales of Red Bull Energy Drink. The Team is divided into four different sub-departments: Sales Retail, Sales Out-of-Home, Trade Marketing, and Field Sales. In order to provide you a solid basis for your future commercial career, you will have job rotations within Field Sales, Trade Marketing, and Key Account Management (following that order of rotation).
FIELD SALES
Distribution (availability) in combination with perfect execution of the Red Bull portfolio is a crucial success factor on the way to further double-digit growth. It is the Field Sales Team's daily business is to gain cross channel distribution supported by perfect and distinct execution. Several teams have been lined up to eventually reach 100% distribution in the most efficient and Red Bull-ish way. Joining the Field Sales team for your first rotation is the ultimate opportunity to get to truly know the basics of Sales, but also to contribute to the team strategically. A key project could be to work on the optimization and integration of the cross channel approach while making optimal use of the big bunch of available data - everything to max out the distribution of Red Bull.
TRADE MARKETING
The Trade Marketing Team acts as a bridge between Marketing and Sales, being mainly responsible to translate the Marketing Strategy into the Sales Strategy. The Team drives trade activity proposals with rationale and commercial backing, pushing the brand guidelines to maximize commercial results, whilst protecting the brand equity. To continuously improve results, all activities and campaigns are analyzed by the team. Category Management is an essential part of the Trade Marketing team and your analytical and storytelling skills will be challenged and further developed participating in this subpart of the team being responsible for your own Category Development project(s). Our Category Developers generate relevant shopper insight and research-based upon a clear business or category issue and integrate them into actionable plans to drive Category Management. Furthermore, they focus on the perfect mix of all P's (Product, Price, Place and Presentation to push the development of both Red Bull and the Energy Drinks category.
KEY ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT
Both the Retail and Out-of-Home team focus on maximizing the distribution, visibility, and findability of the products of Red Bull within our Key Accounts (e.g. supermarket chains, gas stations, wholesalers, etc.) in order to drive maximum profitable growth. Negotiating, relationship building, stakeholder management, and goal-setting are the keywords. Continuous identification of business opportunities, which will be unlocked via strong relationships with our customers, solid trade agreements, and driven by excellent shopper insights derived together with the Trade Marketing Team.
EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise
that matter most for this role:
Proven excellence in academic life to date resulting in a Bachelor or Master degree (completed before July 2021)
Proven extra-curricular achievements and a history of pursuing personal passions.
Must have gained international and/or diverse cultural experiences
Minimum of 1 year of professional experience (e.g.internships) in a commercial environment
Proven track record in project management
Strong analytical skills
Open personality and eager to learn
Proven hands-on mentality
The ambition and responsibility to own important project and drive your own development
Your enthusiasm is contagious
Applications close February 12

Junior Insights Analyst
Britvic
Amsterdam

About the Role:

At Britvic we are proud to make, market, and sell soft drinks that help millions of people around the world to enjoy life’s everyday moments. Britvic is a UK based soft drinks company with global presence. Britvic Teisseire International, where this role resides, is responsible for the BeNeFraLux home market and the global expansion of Britvic owned brands including Teisseire, Mathieu Teisseire, London Essence, and Britvic Mixers. Britvic Teisseire International will be a critical driver of growth for Britvic to achieve its ambition of joining the FTSE 100 index on the London Stock Exchange.

Today Britvic Teisseire International generates around £240m in annual revenues and our ambition is to grow significantly in profit and revenue contributing to Britvic’s Mission 2025. Strategic growth priorities are:

1) Grow global premium brands (Mathieu Teisseire and London Essence)
2) Grow core brands in Western Europe with improved margins

The Insights Executive is supports the Insights Manager to provide Britvic Teisseire International with accurate information on the performance of brands in the market. Moreover, the Insights Executive provides consumer/shopper/customer insights around our products. Key tasks are:

Continuous research: setup and maintain reporting – engage with agencies
Ad hoc research: manage ad-hoc research
Translate research into relevant insights.

The insights Executive partners with other insights functions in Britvic and works within the Britvic way of working (reporting, preferred methodologies etc.). The insights team is the first source of information on anything that relates to performance and perception of our brands in the market.

Key Responsibilities:

Continuous Research

Define and maintain reporting setup: topline-reporting, in-depth reporting, self-service reporting. Align approach with the Britvic standard way of working.
Retail performance reporting (Nielsen) – setup reports, provide updates, analyse performance and pro-actively recommend on actions
Promotional analysis with the RGM-manager
Support the trade marketing managers / commercial team on category analysis
Total market / On-trade reporting: ensure up to date reporting on “total market” performance is in place (Global Data; other sources when relevant). Ensure easy to access information for the teams
Ex-factory performance reporting: ensure there is one database from which all details can be accessed: market, brand, package, and SKU-level.
Perform in-depth analysis based on insight needs (e.g. category/brand/market deep dive). If necessary, commission research externally (e.g. Nielsen/Global Data)

Ad Hoc Research

Execute ad hoc research. This may include executing small tests (e.g. taste test) executed with internal resources (you, colleagues) with a limited number of external participants; or alternatively setup short online questionnaires. Coordinate relevant research with agencies. Ensure actionable insights are shared: topline reporting with key insights and actions. Prioritize pragmatism over perfection.
Maintain a Britvic Teisseire International insights library to promote usage of knowledge acquired before, and simultaneously avoid repeating things done before.

Knowledge, Skills & Experience Required:

Proven, strong analytical skills.
Experience and/or affinity with ad-hoc and continuous research. One of both may be stronger developed.
Experience with Nielsen/IRI databases and reporting. Excel expert.
Presentation skills (both writing easy to read reports/PowerPoint presentations, and presenting the results to an audience)
Experience in FMCG, Experience in the drinks industry (non-alcoholic / alcoholic)
Ability to work closely with cross-functional teams (internal and external)
Ability to travel, hold a valid passport (and visa if applicable) to do so
Great communication skills (English; written and verbal) both internally and across the world.
Proven track record to drive implementation with focus on execution
Ability to multi task and act & deliver at pace in fast paced and volatile business environment
Ability to build strong internal relationships and partnerships
Proven track record of influencing across functions
Appreciation of cultural differences and working across different international geographies
Results driven and business oriented

Desirable
Experience with retail and on-trade
Experience of working with International markets a strong advantage
Be willing to challenge the norms both internally and externally to drive performance

Red Bull is één van die producten die je niet snel op je boodschappenlijst zet, maar wat wel jaar na jaar harder groeit dan de markt. Dit succes bereiken we door een onnavolgbare focus op fysieke en mentale beschikbaarheid, zichtbaarheid en sterk teamwork. Het bereiken van de huidige omnichannel consument ziet iedere afdeling als een continue uitdaging en heeft iedereen binnen het bedrijf als #1 prio op het lijstje staan. Waar deze efforts samenkomen, het retaillandschap, is waar jij het verschil weet te maken.
DE JOB
De Category Manager is onderdeel van het Trade Marketing team, dat verantwoordelijk is voor het analyseren, uitdenken en implementeren van futureproof categorie-projecten. Door het ontwikkelen van klantgerichte oplossingen en baanbrekende activaties is Red Bull al jarenlang een zeer belangrijke groeipijler binnen de categorie fris. En dat houden we graag zo.
STRATEGIE
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling van een multichannel strategie en definieert daarbinnen de rol van Red Bull voor ieder kanaal (Retail/Out-of-Home). Hierbij bestaan geen heilige huisjes en sta jij aan het roer van de groeiplannen voor aankomende jaren. Op basis van zowel kwalitatieve als kwantitatieve data bepaal jij de categorievisie op frisdranken inclusief relevant assortiment en bijbehorend schappenplan. Hierbij maak je onderscheid tussen de verschillende shopping missions om in iedere trip zo optimaal mogelijk te kunnen converteren. De voorsprong die we hebben als King of Convenience weet jij verder uit te bouwen door middel van optimale beschikbaarheid, zichtbaarheid en invulling van de 4P's onder alle omstandigheden.
ANALYSE EN PLANNING
Turning data into insights is niet voldoende binnen Red Bull. Turning data into store is meer ‘our cup of tea’. Je laat geen kans onbenut om de door jou verkregen inzichten op een creatieve manier door te vertalen richting winkelvloer. Hiervoor zijn we op zoek naar een ondernemende en overtuigende collega die op basis van intensieve samenwerking en Test, Learn en Improve naar optimale conversie streeft voor zowel de categorie als Red Bull. Daarnaast ben jij als data-expert uiteraard in staat om gedegen analyses te maken waardoor we onze groei nog beter kunnen monitoren.
NUMBER ONE
In vijf jaar tijd is het segment energiedranken van plaats 6 naar plaats 2 opgeklommen binnen de categorie Frisdranken. Het unieke hierbij is dat de promodruk nagenoeg gelijk gebleven is. De sterke basegroei die het segment doormaakt, is een natuurlijk gevolg van onze sterke focus en aanwezigheid op de winkelvloer; shoppers komen in contact met het blikje daar waar zij het verwachten. Jij zorgt ervoor, samen met Marketing en Sales, dat we deze unieke in-store positie de komende vijf jaar verder verankeren binnen een snel veranderend retaillandschap.
ERVARING
Jouw kennis- en expertisegebieden
wat het belangrijkste is voor deze baan:
Minimaal 8 jaar ervaring binnen FMCG, waaronder Category Management, (Trade)Marketing en/of Sale s
Zeer sterk analytisch vermogen; je bent ervaren in het analyseren van zowel externe bronnen (Nielsen, IRI, GfK) als ‘interne’/CRM data (Sis, Seven). T evens ben je bedreven met schap/planningtools als bijv. Spaceman
Denker en doener op zowel strategisch als operationeel niveau, creatief en innovatief
Projectmanagement; initiëren en coördineren van business planning, maar ook zelfstandig uitvoeren van ad hoc (shopper) onderzoeken, pilots en in-store testing
Resultaatgericht; sterke persoonlijke en communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om een idee te ‘verkopen’. Stopt niet voordat het idee ‘staat’ en weet momentum te creëren bij topmanagement en klanten waar nodig
Flexibele en oplossingsgerichte teamspeler, gedijd goed in een enerverende en snel veranderende omgeving
Leidinggevende ervaring
Ervaring binnen Out-of-Home is een pr é.
Je hebt een afgeronde HBO en/of WO opleiding
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels in woord en schrift
Reizen: 10%

Kraft Heinz, The Company
As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love.
Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people.
Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.


Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration


We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage.
As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
Job Description
We have an excellent opportunity available for a Commercial Category Lead to make a difference at Kraft Heinz. The Commercial Category Lead lies within the Category Development Team. You’ll be working in a high performing team, alongside peers always trying to reach the next level. You’ll be reporting into Jesse van der Meij, Head of Category Benelux. Get ready for a lot of exposure to internal senior stakeholders. The delivery of the Category Strategy and owning the P&L will be your primary responsibility.

In brief, you will be responsible for;
Making commercial plan:
Owning P&L for the category
Developing 12-month commercial plan for Retail Netherlands and Belgium and Foodservice
Defining 3-year category strategy
Planning Go-To-Market: portfolio, shelf, activation, promotion, pricing
Coaching and guiding Trade Category Manager and Space Manager on Trade presentations (giving category advice, leading mutation moments, advising on shelf and assortment)
Set promo strategy by category based on 3-year brand strategy and customer strategy
Set promo rules by category, brand and account
Create national and per account promo plan maximizing effectiveness for the Category
Set targets for promo KPI’s, including field sales
Translate Category Strategy to distribution/2nd placement objectives and shelf targets
Create national and per account distribution/2nd placement plan
Setting forecast and ensure right stock levels:
Leading and presenting commitment setting (incl 3-12-month forecasting) to Leadership
Setting volume forecast and align with S&OP to ensure enough volumes for the period
Decide on assortment strategy – what SKU’s to keep, what to delist, how to minimize Supply Chain Losses
Leading Run-in Run-Out meetings with Demand and Supply
Track and analyze results:
Analyzing root causes for category and brand development
Develop action plan with Commercial Triangle to act on root causes
Track vs action plan and evaluate learnings
Leading and presenting Performance Review to Leadership team
Qualifications

Hard Skills

“Please kindly note that you need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to proceed for this position.”
• University Degree
• Proven track record of advanced analytical skills, problem solving as an owner, taking on entrepreneurial challenges and simplifying complex issues
• Excellent communications skills
• Strong Project Management skillset; ability to demonstrate strong influencing and stakeholder development skills
• Technical proficiencies in Office
Professional Attributes
Ability to Simplify - We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges.
Commercial Sense - You don’t only want to win ; you hate to lose . You’re always seeking for opportunities to expand your business and create more savings, while over delivering your targets.
Analytical - We’re a very data driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution with your analytical mindset.
Result driven - You don’t only focus on your own results, but always do what’s best for the company.
What we offer you / You deserve
An ambitious employer; we only want to the best for you;
A fast career track like only few other companies can match;
A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market);
Permanent contract; for we believe in doing big bets on people;
Reimbursement travel expenses;
Always room for new ideas; if you have an excellent idea, please let us know and we can set it in action!

Location(s)
Amsterdam

Job Title: Key Account Manager Indeps & New Business
Job Description:
Voor onze Luxe divisie zijn we op zoek naar een Key Account Manager die verantwoordelijk wordt voor het zelfstandige kanaal van Parfumerieën. De functie behelst enerzijds een offline benadering van de zelfstandige parfumerieën en de regionale ketens (o.a. Mooi), maar anderzijds ook de online platformen die binnen dit kanaal vallen. In deze rol geef je leiding aan 2 Business Partners die die beiden verantwoordelijk zijn voor een deel van het klanten portfolio. Daarnaast ben jij zelf de lead in de benadering voor de regionale hoofdkantoren en mogelijke new business (met een online focus).
Als Key Account Manager richt je je op de ontwikkeling van het merkportfolio van L’Oréal Luxe in Nederland. Je ontwikkelt hierop een visie en beleid, met als doel de zichtbaarheid en het resultaat van onze merken te vergroten, enerzijds offline in de parfumerieën en anderzijds zorgdragen voor een verdere online acceleratie.
In je rol ben je samen met het team van Business Partners het aanspreekpunt naar onze klant. Je stelt mede het budget op en bent verantwoordelijk voor de invulling en het behalen van de resultaten. Je werkt nauw samen met de klanten en ontwikkelt een goede relatie. Een functie waarin visie, strategie en praktijk bij elkaar komen.
In bullet points:
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten en voor de executie van het strategisch businessplan, hiervoor werk je nauw samen met de Business Partners en de E-commerce Accountmanager (voor de onlinespelers).
Bewaak commerciële processen om tot een goede forecast te komen en behaal de resultaten op Sell in, Sell out, marktaandeel en winst. Verzeker de uitvoering en monitor constant de ontwikkelingen op winkelniveau en sell out.
Handel als de expert op binnen het kanaal, ontwikkel een eigen visie en draag deze uit binnen de interne organisatie en in de ontwikkeling van de Business Partners in jouw team.
Leid de onderhandelingen met de retailer waarbij de nadruk ligt op toegevoegde waarde creëren in partnerships.
Het opzetten (new business) en uitbouwen van een sterke relatie met het Category Management team en de andere stakeholders van de Retailer; en daarnaast werk je nauw samen met de andere afdelingen binnen de divisie (Retail team, Marketing, Digital, Educatie, Finance en Supply Chain).
Profiel:
De ideale kandidaat voor deze functie is ondernemend, pragmatisch en flexibel. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de onderhandelingen met je klanten dus commerciële en analytische ervaring zijn een must. Je werkt nauw samen met de rest van het commercieel team dus bent een ware teamplayer. Verder zijn uitstekende sociale vaardigheden van belang voor het opbouwen van sterke klantrelaties en voor het opbouwen van een intern netwerk.
Must – haves:
Een afgeronde opleiding op Master niveau
Minimaal 5 jaar commerciële ervaring in Account Management, Trade Marketing of Category Management
Ondernemend, pro-actief, daadkrachtig & analytisch
Goede onderhandelingsvaardigheden
Communicatief sterk en goed in het opstarten, ontwikkelen en uitbouwen van relaties
Ervaring met online retailers
Ervaring en/of affiniteit met retail vanuit een professionele, merk gedreven omgeving
Leidinggevende ervaring is een pre
Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels

Wat bieden wij?
Als je bij L’Oréal start, krijg je vanaf de eerste dag een grote mate van eigen verantwoordelijkheid. Om je te ontwikkelen, bieden wij een introductieprogramma en een individueel trainingsprogramma aan. Trainingen kunnen zowel lokaal zijn als op het wereldwijde hoofdkantoor in Parijs. Een verrijkende ervaring waar je internationale peers zult ontmoeten.
En verder vind je bij ons:
Een inspirerende werkomgeving met ambitieuze collega’s;
Een gezond carrièreperspectief met goede ontwikkel- en doorgroeimogelijkheden;
Een competitief salaris wat bij goede prestaties op jaarlijkse basis wordt bijgesteld;
Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals o.a. een 13e maand, winstdeling, korting op ziektekosten en een gunstige pensioenregeling;
Korting op L’Oréal producten en bij strategische partners, zoals o.a. kappersketen Rob Peetoom;
Leuke extra’s zoals diverse sportieve bedrijfsactiviteiten.

Tot slot is een grote meerwaarde van werken binnen L’Oréal, dat je met zoveel verschillende mensen en functies gaat samenwerken. Dit biedt jou de kans om jouw kennis over verschillende stakeholders te verbreden. Je zal samenwerken met collega’s uit vakgebieden als Sales, Marketing, Digital, Supply Chain en Finance.

Solliciteren:
Denk je dat jij klaar bent voor deze uitdaging en voldoe je aan de genoemde voorwaarden?
Solliciteer dan snel!

Diversiteit in recruitment
Bij L’Oréal maken wij geen onderscheid in geslacht, etniciteit of leeftijd:

“A diversified workforce in every function and on all levels strengthens our creativity and our understanding of consumers and it enables us to develop and market products that are relevant“.
(Jean-Paul Agon, CEO van L’Oréal)

Would you like to put to practice what you’ve learned at university? Do you want to experience hands-on what your dream job is actually like? For our Global Market Sales Department we are looking for a proactive, eager and ambitious intern who will operate as part of front office team and have opportunity to learn first-hand to service HNW (high net worth) clients and Investment companies. As a GMS intern you will learn about financial products (Bonds, Equities, FX, Forwards and Swaps), KYC (know your client) principles, Mifid II regulation. There is a pleasant working atmosphere where there is room for personal development and where initiative is valued.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Participate in helping Relationship Managers and KYC team with regard to new prospect client customer files in terms of AML,KYC,CDD standards
Assist in automatic inputting of trade deals executed by account officers such as equity and money markets. Help reconciliation of daily trades with treasury services department and complete end of day reports.
Provide support to Relationship Managers in regards to documents requested by our clients such as statements and portfolio reports.
Participating in monthly Investment Committee meetings and provide operations help to the dedicated RM.


Skills/Qualifications:
Following a Bachelor or Master level degree focusing on Finance, Economics, Business administration
Interest in financial investment products such as FX, Fixed Income and Equities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Turkish is a must


Key competencies required:
Structured and logical thinking
Result oriented and open to self-development


About us:
GarantiBank International NV (“GBI”) is a mid-sized European bank established in Amsterdam, the Netherlands since 1990 and serves to corporate and institutional and retail clientele. GBI is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Turkiye Garanti Bankasi A.S. (Garanti) and has presence in Germany, Switzerland and Turkey. Our ultimate parent is BBVA.

Offer:
It is a fulltime internship for a period of minimum 6 months with a possibility to extend with financial remuneration.
Starting date ASAP. Please note you must be enrolled in a study program in order to qualify for this position! Please do not apply for the internship role if you have already graduated.

Interested?
Please apply via the link or send us your motivation letter and CV in English to ieschbach@garantibank.eu

Bedrijfsprofiel

Familiebedrijf, al 5 generaties. Amerikaanse oorsprong. Fabrikant van vloerverzorgingsproducten. Sterk in slimme en innovatieve oplossingen. Mooie combinatie van traditie, innovatie en passie. Marktleider in Amerika. Challenger in Europa. Al 5 jaar zeer hard groeiend. Nog veel potentieel. Premium prijs positionering. Distributie via elektronica zaken en DHZ. Online al een sterke positie. Brick & mortar. Willen ook richting hypermarkten. Focus in Europa op Duitsland, Frankrijk, Engeland, Italië en Amazon. Samenwerking met distributeurs.

Bedrijfscultuur

Hard groeiend, snel veranderende omgeving, grote ambities. Internationaal team, veel verschillende nationaliteiten.

De rol van international shopper trade marketeer

Je bent als international shopper trade marketeer verantwoordelijk voor de key landen (Duitsland, UK, Frankrijk, Italië) en key account Amazon. Je rapporteert aan de head of international trade marketing. Het gaat om een nieuwe rol ter uitbreiding van het team.
Je identificeert omni-channel business kansen; je maakt analyses van markten, kanalen, klanten en shoppers.
Je ontwikkelt een channel & category management plan, per land
Je stuurt category management projecten bij key klanten in de EU aan, en werkt nauw samen met lokale partners.
Shopper journey: je zorgt ervoor dat de shopper experience optimaal is voor alle touchpoints.
Je ontwikkelt shopper activation campagnes en POS materiaal, zowel on- als offline.
Je ontwikkelt schappenplannen en optimaliseert het assortiment
Je maakt samen met de distributeurs de jaarlijkse distributeurs plannen, incl de nieuwe introducties.
Je voert de regionale en lokale retail & activatie plannen ook zelf uit (vb promo kalenders, instore events, trade shows etc).
Je doet onderzoek en werkt vb met data (GfK).
Functie eisen

Je hebt 3-5 jaar trade marketing/ category management ervaring bij een A-merk in de FMCG markt. HBO/ WO opgeleid. Je spreekt vloeiend Engels. Je bent iemand die graag zaken wil verbeteren en niet bang is voor verandering. Je neemt graag de lead bij projecten. Je bent goed in het analyseren van problemen en je bent creatief. Je bent besluitvaardig, positief en volhardend bij het bereiken van de doelen.

Job Title: Stage: Marketing internship at Lowlander Botanical Beer - Amsterdam
Job Description:
Are you passionate about beer, food and drinks? Do you have a hands-on mentality and the natural ability to get shit done? And do you want to be part of the adventurous journey to put Lowlander Beer on the map for great tasting beer? Then you might be the enthusiastic intern we are looking for!

Inspired by the trade and brewing history of the Lowlanders, Lowlander broadens the horizons of beer.Lowlander Beer is the first beer to brew with botanicals to give extra flavour and character to our beers. Since the launch 4 years ago we have been successful in getting listed in over 2500 sites across Europe and beyond. As one of the fastest growing beers in the Netherlands Lowlander has been listed in the top 100 of Food & Beverage Innovators, known for our disruptive design and activations.

** Werkzaamheden **

As a project owner you oversee and drive the planning of our website launch, and support in collecting/ creating copy & visual content.
You are the first point of content on our online channels and engage with fans & followers.
You prepare our next photoshoot by creating a brief, collecting all props and assist on the set.
You brainstorm with the team on new beers, food pairings, activations and other innovative ideas.
You update the content calendar.
You create and print the menu for our next Botanical Brewkitchen pop up dinner.
As the project owner you co-create our newest bar display / event apparel / retail fridge; from first idea to sourcing and implementation.
For our next PR stunt you support in setting up the longest kopstoot bar of the Lowlands.
You answer all kinds of customer inquiries from all over the world, both by mail, telephone and through social media.

** Gewenste profiel **

A Bachelor education in the direction of communication, marketing, business studies, leisure/ hospitality.
You have and independent and pro-active attitude (and are not afraid of making mistakes).
You have an eye for detail and good organisational skills.
You have a smart, practical brain that gets shit done.
You have a passion for beer, food or cocktails (or all of those).
You have the desire to be part of a young, passionate crew that puts Lowlander Botanicals Beers on the map as a unique Dutch beer brand.
You have the possibility to join us fulltime for at least 4 months (preferably no graduation assignment or research).

** Wat bieden wij **

A competitive intern salary.
A central Amsterdam working location.
A chance to be part of something new and exciting, building a company & brand from the ground up.
Unlimited Lowlander Beer (well at least after working hours!)
Working with a young, passionate and smart crew of people. Read more about the Lowlander culture here.
Real responsibility – what you do with it is your decision but we provide the opportunity to really learn something.

Job Title: Marketing Communications Manager Philips Sound Europe
Job Description:
About Tpv Technology
TPV Technology is an internationally-renowned PC monitor, TV and Digital Signage Displays manufacturer. TPV serves as an original design manufacturer for some of the best-known TV , PC and Digital Signage Displays brands in the industry and distributes its products worldwide under its own brands AOC and Envision. In addition, the company designs, produces and sells Philips-branded monitors, TV's and AVA products, Digital Signage Displays and mobile phones through a license agreement with Philips via its subsidiaries TP Vision and MMD. As an example, the company brings high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. TPV believes in creating products that touch the human senses and are within reach of all consumers in the markets they operate in. As a leader in the hotel industry, their hospitality TV division serves most the world's major international and national hotel groups, as well as individual hotels, hospitals, cruises and other professional facilities.

About Tp Vision
TP Vision is a consumer electronics key player in the world of audio visual digital entertainment. TP Vision concentrates on developing, manufacturing and marketing Philips branded TV sets (Europe, Russia, Middle East, South America, India and selected countries in Asia-Pacific) and audio products (all around the Globe). We do this by combining the innovative Philips brand heritage with our design expertise, operational excellence, flexibility and speed of TPV Technology. With these combined strengths, we bring high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. We believe in creating products that offer a superior audio and visual experience for consumers. With Philips TVs, TP Vision is a global leader in the hospitality market. TP Vision is the exclusive brand licensee of Philips TVs for the above listed countries and, on the global stage for the Philips audio products.TP Vision employs close to 2,000 people in several locations around the globe and is 100% owned by TPV, one of the world’s leading monitor and LCD TV manufacturers, selling and marketing Philips branded TVs in China. TPV has been able to drive its growth over the years by leveraging its economies of scale and core competencies in R&D, manufacturing, logistic efficiency and quality.

Responsibility
Branding:

Establish Brand Identity platform for Philips Sound in coordination with key stakeholders in accordance with business needs and future product roadmap

Ensure that the Philips brand and identity is adhered to in all communication channels. Oversee accuracy of marketing materials and provide formal sign off if necessary

Marketing campaigns:

Develop a marketing activation strategy for newly to launch propositions, based on our insights and positioning

Drive and oversee the annual promotional calendar of your category
Brief and oversee the work of internal stakeholders and external agencies, such as designers, production agencies and printers, who will deliver much of the content/deliverables

Marketing assets:

Creation of EU wide assets and engaging content in accordance with European marketing plan, including on-line / e-tail

Drive toolkit implementation across Europe within defined marketing processes, KPIs and follow up with key stakeholders


Purpose Of The Position
As our Marketing Communications Manager Sound Europe, you will focus on market launch of Philips Consumer Sound products in a project-leading role concerning creation and delivery of 360 campaigns for on-line, ecommerce, in store and press presentations.

The role is positioned within the European Marketing & Communications team, based in Amsterdam.

You are Reporting to the Head of Marketing Communications and Brand activation (TV and Sound category) and will be working in cooperation with amongst others the Consumer Marketing manager Sound, Marcom team, Online team, Trade Marketing team, Ecommerce, PR/Event team and agencies

What Do We Offer You
An interesting, dynamic, challenging, and fast-moving international working environment
Joining a team minded and inspiring marketing & communications team
Ownership of projects; freedom to develop communication materials and make decisions for your own project resulting in being proud of own creation
Opportunity to further develop and strengthen broad skills, knowledge, and network
Competitive reward package


Education And Related Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Communication
Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in Marketing/Communications in a regional /multi country organisation set up
Excellent project management skills and the ability to successfully manage multiple projects running at the same time
Experience working with agencies on corporate level
Experience with consumer electronics industry, lifestyle brand or relevant durable retail products
Proven experience in managing creative projects; delivery of 360 campaigns, assets, copy, deliverables across various communication channels on time
Critical thinking and strong problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal, communication and internal and external stakeholder management skills developed within multicultural, dynamic and commercial organizations
Native or bi-lingual level command of English, German or French
Entrepreneurial drive for growth, ambitious, pro-active, high drive for getting-things-done
Flexibility to occasionally travel (10%) for key events such as IFA consumer electronics fair and key customer events (minimum 2 times a year)


More Info
Do you want to know more or are you ready to apply (English CV and short motivation to be included), please contact: Sandra Lintel (Recruiter) via info@careersattpvision.com

Acquisition as a result of this job posting is not appreciated.

Urban Nature Culture is looking for experienced independent sales agents or distributors to represent Urban Nature Culture worldwide.

ING Diversified Lending Netherlands offers an intern opportunity in Amsterdam within our Reporting, Monitoring & Lending Analytics Team (‘RMLA’) Team
Are you a data & finance fan, eager to explore your banking skills and ready to put your knowledge into practice? Then we are looking for you.
Together with two colleagues you will be supporting the Diversified Lending department from our home base in Amsterdam, and during Corona, working from home, however in close cooperation with colleagues through Skype & Microsoft Teams. We offer you plenty of room to grow, great networking possibilities and an international work environment.
Who are we?
The Diversified Lending department services the largest Dutch multinationals as well as subsidiaries of the foreign multinationals. We offer various banking products, including Overdrafts, Revolving Credit Facilities, Payment & Cash management and Trade Facilities. Our department consists of highly motivated professionals that work across four different teams: Industrials, Retail & Services, Internationals, and RMLA.
What will you do?
As Intern you:
Participate in day-to-day operations, e.g. analysis of companies’ key figures, creation of internal ratings and reports, processing of relevant standardized credit cases, portfolio and data quality monitoring.
Prepare portfolio reports and loan templates (for Diversified Lending NL) and be the contact person for this towards external and internal partners, e.g. inquiries from ING Risk Controlling, international ING colleagues, customer representatives, auditors, internal and external auditors.
Experience the importance of regulatory changes impact Banking, and help coordinate various projects for Diversified Lending NL in order to remain data and regulatory compliant.
Support and service large Dutch and International clients.
Learn about internal Lending procedures and finance processes by collaborating with colleagues from various departments.
Who are we looking for?
You are an MBO or HBO student in the field of economics/finance/international business management.
You have knowledge of Excel and an eye for detail.
You love to collaborate; are a team player.
You have great communication skills in English [and Dutch], both verbal and written.
You are independent, ambitious and result-driven.
You are pro-active in finding creative solutions.
What do we offer?
A 36 hours internship for approx. six months starting the 1st of April 2021 (based in Amsterdam).
Flexibility for your studies as we deem you should be able to fully focus on this when need be.
Internship allowance and travel compensation.
Innovative colleagues who strive for the best.
Personal and professional growth, many opportunities to develop yourself further.
A dynamic international work environment.
The chance to get to know ING in an informal manner.
Interested?
Click on Apply to submit your motivation letter and resume in English. You can also contact Daisy Wagemaker on +31 6 15038731 for more information.

Reporting to the Management, the Marketing Project Manager will implement the strategic vision of the brand and as such lead the Marketing and Communication process, the Marketing Assistant and a team of freelancers (photographers, graphic design, editors) to meet the revenue and growth objectives of the company. Profile


Experience in the women’s apparel branch
All-round Marketeer
Hands-on mentality

About our organisation
The Sandwich brand was launched in 1981 and has been a relevant player in the accessible fashion market ever since. Sandwich is known for its timelessness designs and quality. Sandwich has a loyal clientele with 1.000 selling point across Europa, Canada, England and the Far East. Its headquarters is situated in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. www.sandwich.eu

7+ years of relevant experience in product & marketing management, product development, strategy
MBA from a leading university
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills in both Dutch and English. Native level Dutch is required.

Looking for an opportunity to move fast and make a big impact?
Amazon Prime serves over 150 million members across 18 countries and is at the heart of Amazon’s explosive growth. With a range of benefits across shipping, video, music, reading, gaming and more, Prime offers its members the best of shopping and entertainment. We are building to convert customers to be life-long Prime members.

The Amazon Benelux Prime Member Marketing team is looking for a seasoned Senior Marketing Manager to own the strategy and execution of member acquisition through effective marketing across onsite, offsite and paid marketing channels. You will have an understanding of marketing tools and systems on both a strategic and an executional level. As a Senior Marketing Manager, you will be focused on assessing marketing capabilities, prioritizing new strategies to test with, running experiments and preliminary marketing campaigns through these channels, and scaling up successful strategies. You will own relationships with our marquee partners and jointly drive go-to-market plans. You will own high-profile goals and influence other teams to embrace the value of acquiring and engaging new Prime members. Most importantly, you will bring an enthusiasm for marketing and a desire to make an impact on the business.

The ideal candidate will be metrics-driven with strong ownership and focus. You will need to be able to prioritize effectively in a fast-moving environment, and communicate clearly and persuasively. You are able to drive excellence within the programs you own, with your colleagues in marketing and product management, and with colleagues across the Amazon organization, including retail, digital, and other partner teams. You will be at the center of exciting marketing programs that span across teams, and act as a single-threaded owner on multiple projects.

Ben jij die stagiair die commercieel wil knallen in een dynamische en innovatieve e-commerce omgeving? Dan is het natuurlijk gaaf als je dit kunt doen bij één van de leukste en snelst groeiende pure players van Nederland. Onze dagelijkse business? Persoonlijke verrassingen verkopen waar mensen heel blij van worden. Ben je getriggerd?
Kom dan vanaf januari/februari 2021 als stagiair(e) werken bij Greetz op de commerciële afdeling in het Trading team. Je helpt ons bij het dagelijks managen van de website. Denk hierbij onder andere aan het aanpassen van de homepage en actie gerelateerde contentpagina’s. Is de content up-to-date? Is het assortiment relevant? Zijn er nieuwe ontwikkelingen in de markt? Zijn er verbeteringen door te voeren na het analyseren van het klikgedrag? Jij mag hierover meedenken!


Je werkt in een hecht team, bestaande uit een Content Manager, Retail Shop Manager en Head of Trading, die verantwoordelijk is voor de Retail Campaigning van Greetz. Daarnaast kom je veel in contact met andere afdelingen binnen de organisatie zoals Design & Brand, Team Gifts en Team Cards.


Aan het einde van deze meewerkstage heb je inzicht gekregen in processen die te maken hebben met e-commerce: van design tot (online) campaigning.


Wat ga je doen?

Trade campagnes doorvoeren in het Content Management Systeem.
Opzetten van nieuwe contentpagina’s.
Het aandragen en opsporen van tekortkomingen in het assortiment.
Support leveren bij het opstellen en analyseren van rapportages.
Dagelijks management van de webshop waarbij je zorg draagt voor een correcte vertoning van alle content en opvallendheden hierin signaleert.
Cross sell analyseren en optimaliseren.
Algemene ondersteuning leveren bij projecten die binnen het team spelen, zoals het uitrollen van het merchandising systeem, kansen in de markt ontdekken etc.

We bieden een stagevergoeding van €350,- voor een fulltime stage.

Je bent aangekomen in de voorlaatste fase van je opleiding op HBO/WO-niveau in de richting Marketing, Communicatie, Commerciële Economie of een andere gerelateerde studie.
Minimaal 6 maanden 4 dagen per week beschikbaar.
Affiniteit met retail & e-commerce is een pré.
Mensen omschrijven jou vaak als iemand die creatief, attent en resultaatgericht is.
Je kan zowel zelfstandig als in een team werken.
Je bent commercieel: actualiteiten, inhakers, de laatste trends – jij volgt alles op de voet, zowel online als offline.
Iemand een glimlach bezorgen vind je het mooiste dat er is ;-)

Goed om te weten is dat het kantoorpersoneel van Greetz nog steeds volledig thuis werkt, hoe dat er volgend jaar uit komt te zien weten wij uiteraard ook nog niet. De sollicitaties vinden in ieder geval online plaats.

Solliciteren

As a Kraft Heinz intern you’ll be the owner of your own projects!
Kick-start your career with leadership exposure and a chance to prove yourself.
Over ons
For 150 years, Kraft Heinz has produced some of the world's most beloved products. We are one of the largest global food and beverage companies, with a portfolio that is a diverse mix of iconic and emerging brands. As the guardians of these brands and the creators of innovative products, we're dedicated to the sustainable health of our people and our planet.

The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the world's largest food and beverage companies. We manufacture and market food and beverage products across the globe, including condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, and other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 iconic brands.

We combine the rich heritage of the Kraft Foods Group and H.J. Heinz Co. with the dynamism and energy of a start-up to bring transformative ideas and products to the table.
Waarom bij ons werken
We're committed to making life delicious for our people, our consumers, and our communities worldwide. Being one of the world's leading food and beverage companies is a privilege and a huge responsibility. We walk in our purpose by living our values, which make up our common language, define our shared culture, and reflect the company we're working to become each day.

Here at Kraft Heinz, we demand diversity. We're committed to creating an inclusive environment for our employees, our partners, our customers, and our consumers, knowing that diverse backgrounds and perspectives make us a stronger, more interesting and more innovative company.
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden
Account Management AH Internship:

Supporting key account managers in collecting and analyzing information on prices and promotions and providing input for account plans. Providing customers with promotions of Kraft Heinz products. Foodservice and Trade Internship:

Supporting key account managers in collecting and analyzing information regarding the Kraft Heinz products in the Foodservice industry. Taking responsibility for promotional analyzes, shelf analyzes, and product analyzes as input for the account plans. Creating and collaborating on category plans for one of Kraft Heinz's leading brands.
Field Sales Foodservice Internship (Location: Amsterdam or Antwerp):

Supporting marketing activities, including organizing trade fairs such as the Horecava, Gastvrij Rotterdam, and other Trade Fairs. Instore activation at the wholesale trade in cooperation with the Rayon Managers. Take responsibility for starting, executing, and evaluating customer-oriented projects for hotels, restaurants, hospitals, healthcare institutions, caterers, etc. Supporting in the collection and analysis of information regarding customer segmentation/classification/reports. Support Field Sales Coordinator and Field Sales Manager in daily activities. Set up monthly presentations for Field Sales meetings. Possibility to ride with Rayon Management to gain insight into the market. Field Sales Retail Internship (Location: Amsterdam or Antwerp):

Contribute to the development of retail floor POS (Point of Sale) materials. Actively contribute to the translation of marketing plans into shop floor activation in collaboration with Sales and Marketing. Making analyzes and reports of the commercial activities on the shop floor. Provide input to the Field Sales Coordinator and Field Sales manager for internal meetings and presentations. Maintaining and maintaining close contact with the store account managers.
Profiel
Communication skills: At Kraft Heinz, you’ll easily be exposed to senior management, no matter your level. Therefore, it is important you have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Confident and self-motivated: You have a strong confident work ethic and a sense of confidentiality and responsibility. Curiosity, positivity & enthusiasm: You’re curious, positive, and enthusiastic. People know you as the driver of the team. Ability to Simplify: We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges. Team player: You’re a team player, which means you’re sometimes a leader, sometimes a follower but always working towards the same common goal together with your teammates. Project management skills: Time management has no secrets for you. You’re organized, structured, and have a keen eye for attention to detail. You have proven ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment. Ownership Skills: Think and act like the owners of our business, make tough choices, and treat every dollar as if it is our own. A self-starter mindset, with the ability to work independently when required, interpret and exercise professional judgment, and solve problems creatively.
Aanbod
Like any other company, Kraft Heinz has been affected by the regulations surrounding COVID-19. Currently, the Amsterdam office is closed to all 500+ employees to guarantee their safety. This decision is reevaluated frequently to see when it is safe for all employees to return to the office.

Kraft Heinz has adapted well to the COVID-19 restrictions and there is an online-onboarding day as well as an online hand-over period. You will receive the full allowance and will continue to work from home fulltime by a company provided laptop, as well as a reimbursement to enhance your work from home environment.

Job description

G-Star strives to be the most hardcore denim brand in the world. To achieve this, we are looking for hardcore thinkers and do-ers, who dare to create the future of premium and purposeful denim with us.

We are looking for people with big dreams, while keeping their feet on the ground. Those who are not afraid to push the limits, because we believe there are no limits in what denim can do.

Are you up for the challenge?
Are you the perfect fit for our team?
Are you a bit of a rebellious spirit?
Then we would love to hear from you!

Are you an all-round project manager with experience in Retail or Fashion? Then you should join the G-star family. Together we will build engaging global marketing campaigns and produce exciting brand activations to attract new consumers and engage with our beloved current customers.

As our new E-commerce Coordinator Outlet & App, you will be coordinating the daily management and maintenance from a product merchandise and marketing communication point of view for three of our revenue channels for G-Star in line with the corporate communication calendar:
Online Outlet – App – CRM
You’ll act as a full member of the global G-Star E-Commerce team, with a dedicated focus to grow our online Outlet, whilst supporting your team members working on coordinating localized initiatives for our emerging channel, the G-Star Raw App. Especially on the latter, you work closely together with the Global E-commerce team managing our g-star.com.
You will support the Webshop Manager Outlet & App with the day-to-day management of the online Outlet to deliver the digital strategy and to provide a local experience to our customers. This includes maintaining a consistent brand identity and improve the customer journey on the site, but of course also the alignment with CRM to engage our customers and establish our online presence.
Our App is one of our fastest growing channels and we want you to help us take this to the next level.
Next to executing and aligning our global digital marketing strategies, you will be responsible for supporting our Content and Trade teams to make our App the most engaging platform for our consumers.
As an E-commerce expert in the making, you are familiar with working in an CMS and keen to optimize the current workflows and come up with ideas to improve the App, website(s) and working processes.
In short, this is a very interesting opportunity for an eager medior in the ecommerce field!

Profile

What you bring to the table:

Ensure our Outlet website and app are showing the right and relevant products and contentPrepare, coordinate and execute promotions in a structured mannerPrepare and activate CRM actionsBring ideas to improve our Outlet website and app, its performance and moreover, the experience of our consumers

Qualifications:
Relevant experience in relevant Apparel, Fashion and/or Retail industry2-3 years of relevant e-commerce experience in Apparel, Fashion and/or Retail IndustrySolid experience in managing content of an e-commerce platform on a daily basis including stock and inventory managementAbility to generate e-commerce trends and performance reports with Google Analytics (or similar analytics tools)Ability to work independently as well as in an (international) team structureBachelor or Master degree in marketing, information technology or related science

What does G-Star bring to the table:

Beyond a competitive salary, working at G-Star brings many other perks and exciting opportunities: an awesome and diverse team that collaborates to change the game; a work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation; a clothing budget; a healthy, fresh and delicious lunch and even discounts in various fitness clubs and last but not least, a discount on a new bicycle.

What will happen next:

We will thoroughly review your CV (English is our corporate language, so please apply in English)When we hopefully find what we are looking for, we will call you for a chat and if it’s a good fit, we’ll plan our first interviewBecause we’re very curious how you’d survive a mission impossible, we ask you to prepare a real-life business case in a follow-up interviewWhen we’re ready to commit to each other, we’ll finalize the terms we’ve discussed and we’ll explain to you how to order your first pair of jeans from the G-Star employee store. Good luck!

Job Title: Enterprise Architect, Business Ventures, Group Digital
Job Description:
WHO YOU ARE


You have a passion for technology and innovation, it makes you appreciate the mix of actions and strategic thinking, turning architecture into practice. You have a product-centric mindset, are open to change and get energized working both independently and interdependently. You share and live the IKEA culture and values.

To be successful as Enterprise Architect you have working experience with on-premise Data Centre and multiple cloud vendors environment from an infrastructure perspective and how to optimize those assets. You have preferably worked in the areas of storage, compute, connectivity, monitoring and cloud enablement. We believe you have minimum of 5 years of experience from product and engineering organizations where you have had proven a responsibility for the architecture of a domain stretching across multiple technology capabilities and coexisting with legacy. You are experienced in cloud-native, event-driven development applying API First. You have worked with Open Source and automation in delivering software. In addition, we also believe you have deep understanding in Enterprise Architecture and how to keep an architecture together across areas in the Enterprise landscape within the retail business. Equally so how to modernize the existing legacy and put new infrastructure enablers in place that unlocks speed and flexibility.

We see that you have a strategic and holistic mindset being able to define the future state of the Enterprise architecture in an engineering organisation as well as:

Influence decisions at several levels of IKEA from sub-domain to Engineer
Drive architecture work for an area of the technology landscape coexisting legacy and digital products
Develop architectures for massive internet scale
Solve deep technical problems in a landscape transforming with several business models
Drive common purpose across diverse stakeholders
Set long term strategic direction and manage its trade-offs
Deep knowledge of Enterprise Architecture, omnichannel and retailing
Work outcome-led, across application and infrastructure architecture
Experience in agile development practices
Experience having worked with domain architecture in a product and engineering organisation
As a person you are a good collaborator, have great leadership skills leading architecture work by bringing a lot of people together. You pay attention to detail and actively acquire new knowledge, skills and champion new methods to improve performance in deliveries. You possess knowledge across a range of different technology stacks, ideally applied within a retail sector, and can change direction based on new ideas, approaches and strategies.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES


As an Enterprise Architect, you will develop the Enterprise architecture landscape across IKEA and be part of setting the course with sound engineering/architecture through principles and standards that enable guidance for the business area. By influencing decisions across multiple levels you make sure to set and drive the future architecture across both legacy and new products (at scale). Your personality allows you to balance common purpose amongst a diverse set of stakeholders to ensure reaching both short- and long term goals.

In this role you are:

leading a team of Technology Architects within the Business Relations domain
responsible to lead, drive and develop the strategic architecture across all architecture aspects of a domain ensuring it fits to the totality and enable teams to take full accountability for end-to-end delivery of the strategic outcomes
responsible for defining the coexistence of the digital products and legacy as well as what capabilities should be implemented where in the landscape from a domain perspective
leading and developing the strategic architecture perspective on prioritizations of domain work and its consequences of reaching the product and technology strategies
ensuring that domain and product optimisations are balanced against optimising for the overall IKEA Digital agenda
responsible to develop the architecture view of the domain product and technology roadmap to reach its outcomes
driving and developing the Enterprise Architecture practices and apply the architecture guardrails through the product and
engineering teams

representing the domain architecture in Enterprise Architecture
being part of the domain leadership team, drive its agenda and identify cross-domain dependencies in the development of its roadmap and prioritizations
driving, leading and addressing the big and hard problems that are Enterprise-wide and common across teams that need resolution to enable speed and flexibility for teams
participating in acquisition activities including technical guidance and assessments from a technology landscape perspective
continuously be updated and interested in innovations and how they can be applied to the domain and Enterprise to enable technology or practice leaps forward

ABOUT THIS WORK AREA


We set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fastmoving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace.

At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.

In our team we love puzzles and are always looking for ways to make things smarter, safer and more user-friendly. We all come from different backgrounds and together we enable efficient product development and production through innovative engineering. Of course we also make sure that our products live up to the highest standards of quality, design, function, price and sustainability.


QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


You might have questions regarding the role, the recruitment process or other practicalities please get in touch with Annette Björkquist-Åhstedt at Annette.bjorkquist-ahstedt@ikea.com or +46(0)76 636 79 79.

Warmly welcome with your application. We look forward to learning more about you!

Leading the future of luxury mobility
Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.
We are currently seeking a Director of Logistics, EMEA. This position requires an experienced professional with the ability to manage, improve and drive the inbound and outbound logistics process, whilst covering customs & trade regulatory environment in the regions. The successful candidate will have spent considerable time launching new plants and/or new products in an automotive manufacturing environment. This position requires partnership with Retail Sales, Service, Supply Chain, QA/QC, Manufacturing, Packaging, Engineering, Finance, and Regulatory Affairs to implement new processes and manage changes. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.
The Role:
Manage and develop the Regional logistics & customs team to ensure high level performance on transportation services of inbound/outbound shipments from internal/external suppliers
Identify build up and delivery locations within the region for finished vehicles shipped from North America
Assist the retail team in establishing the logistics network to support both sales and service
Assist in store and service center location selection to ensure seamless and damage free delivery of customer vehicles
Improve the logistics processes, service levels, quality, cost effectiveness and sustainability
Handle freight tenders in coordination with the regional/global transportation teams and indirect procurement stakeholders while staying aligned with the given budget
Cooperate with service providers at the ports of entry (handling agents, forwarding etc.)
Be the go-to person for customs and regulatory matters in the Region
Act as the internal subject matter expert for end-to-end supply chain reviews of the responsible business unit (incl. its regional representations and customers)
Ensure the latest professional and sustainable traffic/export knowledge to the team via trainings and coaching
Safeguard SOX compliance and update the related documentations and SOP's within the responsible business unit
Drive internal projects and take initiatives on value realization
Multicultural and diverse environment
Responsibility of EMEA logistics activities
Make decisions by assessing the situation to determine the importance, urgency and risks, and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of the organization.
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in any of the following areas: logistics, transportation, management, or distribution center management
1+ years of related automotive industry experience and LEAN manufacturing preferred
1+ years direct leadership experience
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with success in working across organizations at all levels.
High level of interpersonal skills to work effectively with others.
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects, effective project planning in terms of resources, strategies, cost, and time with ability to meet project timelines.
Profound knowledge of the international transportation (air/ocean/truck) and its regulatory environment (IATA, IMO, ADR)
Proven knowledge of Transport Management Systems and sound SAP exposure
Experience in managing complex trade and customs rules and regulations (AEO, Known Shipper, Bonded Warehouse)
Customer-centric and solution-oriented individual, striving for operational excellence
Sound experience in project and stakeholder management
Proven leadership capabilities with strong interpersonal and communication skills
Analytical and conceptual mindset with a flexible, supportive and creative approach
Business level fluency in English required, other language knowledge is a plus
Strong computer proficiency in MS Office applications
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred in Supply Chain, Transportation, Logistics, or related field. An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience may be considered
LEAN, GK, or Six Sigma Certifications a plus
Be part of something amazing
Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

Imagine yourself working in an international team, providing innovative, top-notch legal advice to clients who are the leaders of today and tomorrow in their sector and working seamlessly together across teams and offices. This is Clifford Chance.
As a single, fully integrated global partnership, we pride ourselves on our approachable, collaborative and innovative way of working.

Our Amsterdam office has been providing clients with the high-quality advice and legal insight for almost half a century. We combine the Firm's global standards with our in-depth expertise and network in the Dutch market and abroad. We always strive to exceed the expectations of our clients, which include major financial institutions, financial investors (which includes private equity and infrastructure investors), corporates from all sectors (including major tech companies), governments, regulators, trade bodies and non-profit organisations.


On a daily basis we focus on innovative ways of working to best support our clients and their businesses. In 2020 we have been awarded the prestigious Gouden Zandloper Innovation Award.

Quality of service and professionalism are highly valued, as are pro-active attitude and teamwork. We value work ethic, respect and good communication to get the best results for our clients and to ensure we create a welcoming and safe work environment for all our colleagues.

Who you will work with
Our M&A practice advises our clients, who include some of the world's leading companies and investors, on the full range of transactions from complex multi-billion-euro cross-border acquisitions and divestments, whether public or private and including unsolicited takeover approaches and defence strategies, through to strategic joint ventures and corporate governance advice.


Our Corporate lawyers have a global outlook, coupled with experience of a variety of work in multiple jurisdictions, producing the quality of expertise required for major, complex cross border work.
Our team includes experts in competition law, funds and investment management, insurance, private equity, infrastructure, technology and public policy, and we are closely integrated with our market-leading finance and capital markets practices.

What you will be responsible for
Due to the continued growth and success of our Corporate group, we are currently seeking a talented lawyer to join our Amsterdam office. As an associate in our M&A team, you will be working on some of the world's largest and most complex M&A transactions. Our lawyers provide a seamless integrated service across our network of offices and across different areas of expertise including public takeovers, private M&A, private equity transactions, joint ventures, restructurings, rights issues & secondary issues and advisory work.
You will provide legal and commercial expertise predominantly on complex public or private M&A transactions and joint venture arrangements as well as ECM and corporate advisory work, across a wide range of sectors including TMT, financial services, CG&R (commercial goods & retail), healthcare, industrials, and real estate.
You will be working as part of cross-border and multidisciplinary teams.
You will be developing relationships with clients and actively engaging in business development and thought leadership initiatives and seeking out opportunities for new work as you grow not only your legal but also entrepreneurial skill set.
You will be drafting complex legal documents clearly and concisely, creating solutions using legal knowledge and commercial judgement to advise and support leading multi-national clients.
Your career experience so far
You will have a solid background in corporate work, probably gained at a firm with a highly regarded profile. We are looking for associates who are able to think outside the box to create bespoke solutions to meet our clients' business objectives.
You will have had proven M&A experience of advising international clients on complex deals. You will be expected to demonstrate M&A experience and experience in organising and managing transactions.


In short you bring:
5-7 years of relevant work experience;
excellent academic history;
an M&A track record; experience in the TMT sector would be a plus;
a real desire to work on top-tier international deals and grow in a global law firm;
intellectual curiosity,
commercial and business awareness;
hands-on mentality but with the ability to see the bigger picture;
good communication and negotiation skills;
proven team player skills.

It is crucial that you can demonstrate an appetite for business development, client relationship management and thought leadership.
A Dutch law qualification is preferred however not required.

How we will support you
From your first day with us, you will have varied opportunities to continuously grow and develop your skills and knowledge. You will work in a dynamic, multicultural environment and in a fun team of energetic professionals. You'll get the opportunity to develop your legal and business skills by following tailored (international) trainings and courses with our Clifford Chance Academy.
You will be working for a firm and team with more tier one rankings than any other law firm.
You will be working with a broad range of clients and the firm's other teams and practice areas, not only in Amsterdam, but across the globe.
You will have exposure to work which often involves complex matters that frequently headline in the financial and business press, and also work involving emerging markets and technologies.
You will have extensive client contact both as part of your daily working routine but will also have the opportunity to develop client contacts through a wide range of opportunities including organising seminars for our key clients, or providing bespoke client training.
You will develop an unbeatable multi-disciplinary skill set as well as client facing skills whilst working with some of the best-known market leaders in their respective practice areas.
We will provide the opportunity for you to develop as a recognised practitioner in the field.
The role comes with a competitive salary & benefits package and attractive working conditions.

To find out more
Interested? Please contact Nina Rolsma, Recruitment Manager, via nina.rolsma@cliffordchance.com.
If you are an intermediary, please do not contact us.

Equal opportunities
At Clifford Chance we understand that our true asset is our people. We believe that each and every one of us should experience equality of opportunity and an equality of experience here. We are always working to develop and deliver the best and most innovative approaches to make that happen. Inclusion is good for our team and their families, our firm and society.
We are therefore committed to treating all employees and job applicants fairly and equally regardless of their gender, gender identity and expression, marital or civil partnership status, colour, national or ethnic origin, social or economic background, disability, religious belief, sexual orientation, or age. This applies to recruitment and selection, terms and conditions of employment including pay, promotion, training, transfer and every other aspect of employment.

The firm will regularly review its procedures and selection criteria to ensure that individuals are selected, promoted and otherwise treated according to their relevant individual abilities and merits.
We have a number of initiatives and networks that support our aspiration to be the Global Law Firm of choice.
