For our Amsterdam office we are looking for a Senior Product Designer. As a Senior Product Designer, you can digest insights into impactful designs to ensure we are developing the right solution to the right challenge. You will be responsible for translating client goals into actionable design solutions, establishing the conceptual and stylistic direction for design team.

WHO WE ARE

REGGS is an interdisciplinary design studio based in Amsterdam with hubs in Groningen, Zurich and Berlin. We develop effective and innovative total design solutions, aiming to create positive changes in how people live, learn, work and play.

We service a wide range of clients, varying from national & international brand owners, retail and technology suppliers in the field of consumer products, food & beverage, medical equipment, mobility, games and High Tech.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

DESIGN SOLUTIONS

Proven success in translating the client’s brief into clear insights and effective design
Excess project expectations, re-frame initial problems and scrutinize project assumptions while showing sensitivity to the client’s needs.
Passion for creating beautiful and meaningful experiences.
Communication
Verbally convey ideas and design concepts to internal team members and clients, articulating and defending rationale behind designs.
Demonstrate engaging presentation and storytelling skills.
Provide constructive feedback and design critiques that are honest, direct, actionable and effective.
Be a team-player.

LEADERSHIP

With our clients: Be a trusted expert, a collaborative partner and a seamless extension of the client’s team.
Engage the design team to keep them inspired, motivated and challenged throughout the projects.
Take ownership of projects, working without close supervision, while balancing multiple concurrent projects.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in ID/Product Design
5+ years of industrial design experience (with at least 1-2 years leading ID teams and projects) preferably in fast-moving, high-volume consumer electronics or consumer goods companies.
Demonstrated mastery of 2D and 3D tools of the trade (Solidworks, Keyshot, Adobe CS, PowerPoint/Keynote etc.).
Excellent in sketching.
An incurable curiosity and a passion to dive into opportunities.
Experience in translating client challenges into tangible design.
Inspirer who can bring young team members to a next level.
Excellent communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work within interdisciplinary teams.
Based in the Netherlands or willing to relocate.
Ability to efficiently present ideas elegantly and compellingly (visual and verbal) at every stage of development, from brainstorm sketches to CAD and photorealistic renderings.
Expert understanding of product form language, ergonomics, user-centered design, design for manufacturability, materials and processes, and product interaction.
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, with strong initiative and follow through.
Work under tight deadline pressure and adapt quickly and amicably to changes in project, scope and schedule.
Fluent in written and spoken English.


What else to expect?
You can enjoy a fresh tasty lunch and weekly beer-fridge Fridays, as well as regular socials. Last but least, we offer flexible work hours and a few extra Reggie days on top of the 24 paid holidays.

Dreaming of becoming a REGGIE
Send your CV and motivation to studio@reggs.com, questions: call +31(0)204626565 and ask for Claartje.

Waarom wil jij hier werken?
Vind jij het leuk om als web analist online customer journeys te optimaliseren op basis van web analytics?
Haal jij voldoening uit meten, analyseren, inrichten, monitoren, kansen spotten en inzicht bieden?
Bezit jij een sterke mening, visie, analytisch vermogen en daadkracht om als sparringpartner op te treden?
Lees dan de vacature van Web Analist bij een gaaf A-merk in de retail in de regio Amsterdam!

Functieomschrijving

Als Web Analist is het jouw doel de optimale customer journey samen te stellen. Dit realiseer je door het bieden van inzichten middels analyses (dashboarding), het meten van resultaten en (commerciële) verbeteringen aan te dragen. Waarbij je altijd jouw kritische blik weet in te zetten. Conversie is voor jou altijd key!

Jouw taken gedurende een werkdag kunnen variëren uit onderstaande:
Bespreken van de stappen die zijn gezet voor een project met het multidisciplinair team
Verbeteren van landingspagina's, platformen i.s.m. trade partners (Picnic, Bol.com, CoolBlue, Mediamarkt e.d.), de webshop en vanzelfsprekend de website
Aansturen op meetbare werkprocessen en -structuur
Analyseren en identificeren van trends op basis van de Customer Journey
Opstellen van performance reports en dashboards
Aanbevelingen doen en kansen zien op basis van jouw analyses.
De gehele dag ligt bij alles wat je doet de focus op conversieoptimalisatie en daarmee maximaal resultaat. Als Webanalist weet je het belang van goed stakeholdermanagement. In deze functie is het belangrijk dat je goede contacten onderhoudt met het management, IT en het MarCom team.
Wat wij uniek vinden aan deze rol is dat je komt te werken in een 'doe-cultuur'. Dat betekent dat er ruimte is om ideeën uit te voeren, te experimenteren en dat je echt een verschil kan maken voor klanten. Jouw doel: webanalyse naar een hoger niveau tillen. Een mooie uitdaging!

Organisatiecultuur

Vooruitstrevend, dynamisch en gedreven zijn kernwaarden die deze A-speler typeren. Er werken gepassioneerde mensen met liefde voor de producten waarbij ook de beleving een krachtig onderdeel betreft. De organisatie geeft veel autonomie aan haar medewerkers, oftewel vrijheid en daarmee ook verantwoordelijkheid. Veelzeggend is het motto: "Thuis werken mag, maar we zien je graag op kantoor".
Natuurlijk dienen er ook resultaten te worden geboekt. Dit doe je met het multidisciplinair team, waarbinnen jij de expert zal zijn op het gebied van het webanalyses. Uiteindelijk spar je met de Performance Marketing Manager en E-commerce Manager om een optimale Customer Journey en resultaat te boeken.

Wie ben jij?

Jij herkent jouw werkstijl in de woorden: structureel, fact-based en resultaatgericht. Met dit profiel ben jij een perfect fit binnen het multidisciplinair team en de organisatiecultuur waar ondernemerschap wordt gestimuleerd, creatieve oplossingen worden omarmd. Jij bent iemand die maar een doel voor ogen heeft en dat is om de (online) bezoeker de optimale customer journey te bieden.

Jij herkent qua persoon in de onderstaande woorden:
Ambitieus: je voelt je een ondernemer binnen het bedrijf
Data-gedreven: je baseert jouw keuzes op data-gedreven inzichten
Resultaatgericht: je leeft op cijfers, analyses en weet dit te transformeren naar (commerciële) resultaten
Communicatief: je beweegt je vrij en met overtuiging binnen een organisatie en weet draagvlak te creëren
Daarnaast breng jij de volgende ervaring met je mee:
Hbo of WO afgeronde opleiding
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in web analyse (en tools als Google en/of Adobe Analytics, Tag Manager, Optimize, Hotjar) en/of conversieoptimalisatie
Ruime ervaring met A/B testen, data visualisatie en databases (BI / dasboarding, DMP en Big Query is een plus)
Wat biedt deze baan als Web Analist jou nog meer?
Een prima salaris (afhankelijk van ervaring)
Een goede bonusregeling
Pensioen
28 vakantiedagen
100% reiskostenvergoeding
Werken in een jong en multidisciplinair team
De kans om de lijnen uit te zetten op het gebied van web analyse
Enthousiast?

Dan ontvang ik graag je cv en een korte omschrijving van wat je aanspreekt in de vacature (via het sollicitatieformulier op deze pagina).
Als de vacature goed aansluit op jouw profiel, nodig ik je graag uit voor een videogesprek. Dan kijken we of de bedrijfscultuur en functie-inhoud goed aansluiten op jouw wensen en verwachtingen. Zo gaan we samen op zoek naar jouw ideale next step.
Ik kijk uit naar je sollicitatie! Ik ben te bereiken via mail: Jasper@weknowpeople.nl

Job Summary

As project manager at UXUS your role will be to manage the client’s projects, pitches and RFP’s so that our interdisciplinary and international teams successfully deliver, on time, on budget and to the highest quality to the UXUS clients.
You will be responsible for planning all projects and managing them from concept through to completion, including immersion workshops, conceptual design, Design Development and Intent drawings, Design guidelines and service rituals among others. You will often handle more than one project at a time from various clients and industries. In order to be successful in this role you must have demonstrated experience in managing, the creative process and the creative professionals such as design strategists, retail and hospitality designers, 3D visualizers and architects. You will coordinate all necessary resources to ensure that all agreed services are delivered in the agreed timeframes and that at all times they meet the clients’ briefing. Having an understanding of customer journeys, consumer behaviour pre and post journey will be an additional asset.

This role reports into the Client Services Director.
This is a full time position ( 40 hours /week) and the assignment is for a determined period of time until 15 September 2021.
Ideal start date January/ February 2021.
Job Responsibilities
Manage global retail, hospitality, corporate and brand identity projects and clients
Work closely with our Design team to present outlined design concepts, design development and detailing, production, implementation, and construction information
Manage scheduling, budgets, staffing, project set-up with sub-consultants, vendors and contractors
Create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements
Prepare all supporting communications/reporting documentation for effective project management
Prepare and monitor fee proposals, cost plans, and project milestones
Manage day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope
Ensure project documents are complete, current and stored appropriately
Prepare for internal reviews and quality assurance procedures
Consult and liaise closely with clients, design and 3rd party project management teams
Manage outside consultants and trades throughout all project phases
Identify resources needed and assign individual responsibilities
Track and report team hours and expenses on a weekly basis
Determine appropriate revenue recognition, ensuring timely and accurate invoicing, and monitoring receivables for project.
Follow up with suppliers/clients, when necessary, regarding unpaid invoices
Ensure all project phases are delivered on time and within budget
Requirements
3 - 5 years of project Management experience within Design and Design Strategy is essential
Minimum 5 years of international experience in the field of retail and/or hospitality and an understanding of the overall design process: from conceptualization to execution
Proven track record in managing projects that include creative design
Excellent command of English language (our company language) written and spoken.
Professional degree (Master or Bachelor) in Architecture or Interior Design is an advantage
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment within tight deadlines
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment, in 2D and 3D
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with Clients, Design and Project management team
Excellent multi-tasking abilities
Excellent communicator; able to bridge lines of communication at all levels and ability to demonstrate diplomacy and collaboration
Excellent command of English language (our company language) written and spoken. Knowledge of Chinese language is a big advantage
Demonstrated intercultural awareness and ability to interact with a diverse team within UXUS and within our clients’ network
Technical
Ability to review, analyse, and make recommendations regarding designs, planning, and specifications
Ability to supervise and plan the work of team members
Ability to interpret and carry out complex oral and written instructions with regard to architectural drawings and specifications
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel & PowerPoint
Experience with Software programs such as Asana, Instagantt, AutoCAD, In Design, Photoshop, Bluebeam, Revu are a plus
Benefits
Monthly health insurance contribution
8% holiday allowance
25 vacation days per calendar year on a full - time basis
Company Mobile Phone
Company Laptop
Competitive remuneration
The opportunity to join a visionary and cutting edge international design agency based in Amsterdam.

How to apply

Please submit your CV and motivation letter in English Language
Given the current COVID 19 developments, first preference will be given to candidates who live in the Amsterdam or nearby vicinity and in any case already in possession of a valid work permit for the Netherlands.
Incomplete applications will not be considered.

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets.
About the team:
The First Party Advertising technology team (iCAS) is looking for a Backend Engineer to strengthen the team. We are building an internally used advertising engine combined with seller tools, to deliver shopping listings to the multiple platforms we have within the eBay Classifieds Group. some of our complexities is the high traffic and volume demand, high uptime, handling click-fraud and optimising the listings being shown
We do this through a technology stack mainly running through Go-lang based microservices, with eventing on Kafka, reporting on Clickhouse and Datastorage on MySQL. We run these services through Nomad on our own private cloud, and we handle the dev-ops activities such as deployment (Github, Jenkins), uptime (lots of 9s), monitoring (Prometheus, Pagerduty, Grafana) and maintenance as well. Our frontend is based on NodeJS and Knockout. This stack is in constant evolution and flux to support growth as well as our own efficiency
Some numbers:
Up to 10K events per sec per service.
System handling up to 9000 searches per second.
Over 10 million live Listings
Serving the biggest classifieds sites in CA, DE, NL and BE
End-to-end ownership of the seller's journey, from the shop around the corner to big retail brands
Your role
Your role in the team is to develop and maintain our microservices backend and infrastructure. Our teams focus on multiple aspects of our product, such as the Seller Experience (API/Frontend/Reporting), Playout (Search, Ranking and Event Processing) and Platform (Data, Security, Compliance, Pipelines).
We expect from you:
Experience (or a deep interest) in Go
BS/BA level of thinking and cooperation
Experience in a distributed, scalable, high-throughput and highly available systems
Experience with Backend system design, API, Data storage and Networking
Basic understanding and working proficiency with Linux and Cloud services
4+ years of work experience in the field of backend engineering
Willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques. Good leadership and communication skills.
Participate in the on-call rotation together with the rest of engineering (we run what we build)
A can-do attitude (sarcasm is allowed) and drive to solve problems for our partners and customers
What we offer
Driven and passionate colleagues/team
Technical and personal growth opportunities
Office in Amsterdam, close to Amstel Station
An agile and evolving development process, focussed on efficiently delivering value
An occasional celebration
An english-speaking environment
Other benefits detailed below
Summary
If you are a good practical (Go based) backend engineer with an interest in classifieds, high-performance, infrastructure and helping our sellers, come work for us! You won't regret it!
Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/
Covid-19
People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.
We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.
eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.
For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:
Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets.
About the team:
The First Party Advertising technology team (iCAS) is looking for a Lead Frontend Engineer to strengthen the team. We are building an internally used advertising engine combined with seller tools, to deliver shopping listings to the multiple platforms we have within the eBay Classifieds Group. some of our complexities is the high traffic and volume demand, high uptime, handling click-fraud and optimising the listings being shown.
We do this through a diverse technology stack. On the frontend we run a multi-tenant and multilingual client-server application, based on KnockoutJS, Sass and the latest ECMA SCRIPT (client); and Node.js, ExpressJs, Pug (server). On the backend we are mainly running Go-lang based microservices, with eventing on Kafka, reporting on Clickhouse and Datastorage on MySQL. We run these services through Nomad on our own private cloud, and we handle the dev-ops activities such as deployment (Github, Jenkins), uptime (lot's of 9s), monitoring (Prometheus, Pagerduty, Grafana) and maintenance as well. This stack is in constant evolution and flux to support growth as well as our own efficiency
Some numbers:
Up to 10K events per sec per service.
System handling up to 5000 searches per second.
Over 10 million live Listings
Serving the biggest classifieds sites in CA, DE, NL and BE
End-to-end ownership of the seller's journey, from the shop around the corner to big retail brands
Your role
Your role in the team is to develop and maintain on our multi-tenant frontend (client and server), collaborating closely with UX, Product and Backend. As a lead, we expect you to drive vision and strategy on the future of our frontend technical stack, together with the other frontend devs and system architects
We expect from you:
Experience (or a deep interest) in Go
BS/BA level of thinking and cooperation
Deep understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript;
Familiarity with vanilla JavaScript, popular frameworks (React, Angular, Vue), responsive design, semantic markup, front-end architectures, and performance;
Basic understanding and working proficiency with NodeJS, Linux and Cloud
4+ years of work experience in the field of (frontend) software engineering
Teach others and drive adoption of technology improvements. Good leadership and communication skills.
Participate in the on-call rotation together with the rest of engineering (we run what we build)
A can-do attitude (sarcasm is allowed) and drive to solve problems for our partners and customers
What we offer
Driven and passionate colleagues/team
Technical and personal growth opportunities
Office in Amsterdam, close to Amstel Station
An agile and evolving development process, focussed on efficiently delivering value
An occasional celebration
An english-speaking environment
Other benefits detailed below
Summary
If you are a good practical lead frontend engineer with an interest in classifieds, high-performance, infrastructure and helping our sellers, come work for us! You won't regret it!
Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. Job Title: Product Owner – Store Systems (Planning, Warehouse & Inventory Management, POS)
Job Description:
WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU


We believe you share our IKEA values and that you are excited to join us in our journey to become the world’s leading omnichannel home furnishing retailer. You enjoy a real challenge, in an environment where everything is changing. We want you to join our journey to become a fully digital busines.

Our ideal product owner has managed complex products or large-scale platforms and is obsessed with solving for user needs
They are very technical, able to put themselves in the shoes of both our developers and end users, but also have an extreme attention to detail and user experiences.
They operate well in close partnership with their engineering teams, as well as drive initially ambiguously defined projects across the broader company.They have a passion for working agile and can think abstractly to incorporate taking in wider elements than their own area or product.
They thrive in navigating complex organisations, with multiple stakeholders in many countries
We are looking for a background or strong interest in managing Retail environments and creating platforms that form a core part of a Retail Operations chain, serving millions of IKEA customers every day.


A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US


Are you a passionate customer-focused product owner, who gets a kick out of creating, building and deploying products rapidly that make a meaningful difference?

We are looking for individuals who can become a trusted partner for technical and business focused stakeholders. We have a huge vision to deliver and we are looking for someone who can come into the role, establish themselves rapidly and start building new products to augment and replace multiple processes & systems.


Your Will:

Have responsibility over a large part of our in-store operations system estate, which is undergoing a sizable strategic change.
Maximize the business results and customer value resulting from the development and deployment of digital products by making trade-off decisions as neededSupport the Product Manager in developing the product roadmap
Ensure you have a good understanding of the product roadmap and vision as defined by the Product Manager to inform the creation and prioritization of the backlogActively manage the digital product backlog including clearly expressing product backlog items and prioritizing items based on business goals and optimization of work in the agile team
Involvement in sprint planning meetings to help provide clarity and elaborate features and user stories to help the team better understand the requirements and how success will be measuredDefine and deliver acceptance criteria and the ‘Definition of Done’ working collaboratively with the rest of the team
Work in-depth with our customers to understand and qualify their needs and requirements, ensuring they are included and integrated into the product as needed
Act as a subject matter expert for other Product teams, providing insight, context and additional information as needed to help understanding of what is required of the systems and capabilities.Working collaboratively with other Product Owners & Managers across INGKA Digital to refine the backlog and identify cross dependencies
Work cross-functionally to ensure that the agile team has what it needs and remove blockers that prevent the agile team to maximize the delivery of digital products
Work across initiatives within IKEA Group, contributing to a successful combined digital product deployments
We’re looking for candidates with the following background:

Strong Stakeholder Managers, whom have experience working in complex and/or international organisationsProven Product Owner experience, owning developing and deploying software products in an agile environmentApproaches product management from a view of the customer/user and is motivated by the chance to improve the experiences of our customersExperience of Retail either eCommerce/Physical or in Supply Chain/Fulfillment activities is not essential but a big plusExperience of POS, Warehouse Management, Inventory Management & Supply Chain Management systems is also a big plus
Has experience launching digital products across multiple countries with high stakeholder influence and multi-national complexitiesExperience with Agile Product Management Tools & Processes (JIRA, MIRO, Confluence, Roadmunk etc)Experience of working with iterative, agile product development and deployment teams, including key events and objects.
Ability to build strong and meaningful interpersonal relationships. Enabling you to collaborate with and advise stakeholders. Experience within a large multi-national organization is desired.Fluency in English is a must
This role is for an indefinite contract and is located in Amsterdam.


TOGETHER AS A TEAM


At IKEA we believe in people and that we are always better together. Within Group Digital we set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast-moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace. At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.


QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


You might have some questions about the position of Digital Rollout and Planning Leader or the recruitment process and that's a good thing! If you have job specific questions please contact lee.everitt@ingka.ikea.com

If you have questions regarding the recruitment process or other practicalities, please get in touch with Catharina Platoff recruiter at catharina.platoff1@ingka.com

We are looking forward to receiving your application and will review candidates continuously, so please submit your application as soon as possible.




We like to kindly ask you to expect some delays in response to your application, due to the Christmas and New Year Holidays

Job Title: Senior Business Development Manager - Climate Neutral...
Job Description:
South Pole is an energetic, global company offering comprehensive sustainability solutions and services. With offices spanning all six continents, we strive to create a sustainable society and economy that positively impacts our climate, ecosystems and developing communities. With our solutions we inspire and enable our customers to create value from sustainability-related activities.
Our Sales & Business Development team works hand in hand with our clients to help them identify the right products and solutions to address their sustainability challenges. Whether they are corporate clients or public institutions, whether they are looking to offset their carbon emissions or to engage in a comprehensive sustainability journey, we have a solution that will generate a lasting impact and take them a step further in their social ambitions. If you are a smart, ambitious and dynamic sustainability professional with a strong passion to make a real difference in the fight against climate change, the below position may be right for you!

Job summary:
The Senior Business Development Manager for Climate Neutral Applications is responsible together with the regional business development teams to source new customers and business contacts in the e-commerce, B2C platforms and retail industry. In addition, the Senior Business Development Manager – Climate Neural Applications, will be responsible to demonstrate the integration of our climate action, drive sales, and maintain strong customer relations.
Main tasks & responsibilities:

Responsible to create new business opportunities to grow South Pole’s business in the Climate Neutral Applications practice
Understand client needs and identify business opportunities. Be the advocate to the customer towards the internal stakeholders
Lead virtual teams of sales and consultants to find and close new business and implement the customer solution
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in sales, marketing and delivery team to define the go-to-market strategy
Collaborate with the marketing team to define customer segments, develop target lists and run campaigns
Engage with the global key account management team to leverage existing pool of South Pole clients for Climate Neutral Applications leads.
Develop compelling offers and proposals together with our product experts and consultants
Responsible to conclude commercial agreements with clients and business partners
Represent South Pole in client meetings, at conferences and trade shows Identify market trends and provide inputs for product & service development
Instill pride in the South Pole brand, inspire & motivate team members

Requirements:

A university degree, ideally at Masters level
At least 10 years of proven business development and sales experience
Solid business development and sales experience with a track record in meeting and exceeding sales targets
Strong understanding of software systems architecture to design the best solution to integrate climate action with our e-commerce and software customers
Understanding of the business drivers behind corporate climate actions and initiatives (e.g. SBT, RE100, carbon neutrality) and the ability to formulate a business case for sourcing renewable energy would come as an advantage
Entrepreneurial mindset, sense of responsibility and willingness to take initiative
Strong drive for results, action-oriented, with self-direction and sense of urgency
Ability to challenge the status quo and think out of the box
Critical thinking and decision-making skills within strong business and commercial acumen
Ability to successfully navigate complexity and effectively deal with ambiguity
Experienced working in small interdisciplinary teams, ideally within an international and multicultural context
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Advanced skills in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Holder of a valid work permit is a must

What we offer:

At South Pole, we care about our employees as much as we care about the planet. South Pole is not just an employer, we are a Team. South Pole does not just offer people a job, we offer you a career. By joining our team, you will find strong purpose and deep meaning in everything you do. You will have the chance to make a real difference for our clients and for the planet, working alongside a passionate team of like-minded colleagues, while building your knowledge/skills and developing your career in a fun, dynamic, international and fast-growing organisation.
We’re a planet of 7.5 billion unique and different people. We all have a contribution to make; South Pole is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status or disability. Our recruitment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

Job Title: Interim opdracht: (Senior) advocaat-medewerker Corporate & Commercial Litigation
Job Description:
Werken bij
Advocaat
Interim opdracht: (Senior) advocaat-medewerker Corporate & Commercial Litigation
Interim opdracht: (Senior) advocaat-medewerker Corporate & Commercial Litigation
Voor ons Amsterdamse kantoor zijn wij vanaf de maand mei voor de duur van in ieder geval vijf maanden (inclusief overdracht) op zoek naar een ervaren advocaat op het gebied van Corporate & Commercial Litigation voor het opvangen van een zwangerschapsverlof. Gedurende deze periode maak je deel uit van de sectie Commercial & International Trade: een dynamische gecombineerde contracten- en geschillenpraktijk op het gebied van nationale en internationale handel.
Jouw nieuwe werkomgeving
Het werk binnen Commercial & International Trade is niet alleen inhoudelijk uitdagend maar ook dynamisch. De sectie staat hoog aangeschreven op het gebied van manufacturing, supply chain & retail. Aan de ene kant contractenwerk en strategisch advies. Aan de andere kant geschillen oplossen, (beslag)procedures en arbitrages voeren tussen ondernemingen (en soms ook binnen ondernemingen zelf). Het zwaartepunt zal gedurende deze opdracht liggen bij geschillenbeslechting. Als sectie zijn wij voor onze cliënten een belangrijke sparringspartner over belangrijke onderdelen van hun bedrijfsvoering zoals inkoop, verkoop, logistiek, opslag, transport en bepaalde aspecten van compliance, zoals product safety, etikettering en verpakkingen, product recall, douane en (financiële) sancties. Daarnaast adviseren en procederen wij bij aandeelhoudersgeschillen, bedrijfs- en bestuurdersaansprakelijkheidskwesties en vraagstukken op het gebied van corporate governance.

Het team Commercial & International Trade is actief in alle sectoren van de markt maar focust zich vooral op fashion & retail, hospitality, travel & leisure en health care. Wij werken nauw samen met andere teams binnen Kennedy Van der Laan, zoals Corporate/M&A, Arbeids- & Medezeggenschapsrecht, Vastgoed & Bouw en IT & Technologie.
Kennedy Van der Laan als opdrachtgever
Kennedy Van der Laan is een onafhankelijk Nederlands advocatenkantoor met 200 medewerkers, waarvan ruim 100 advocaten. Vanuit onze kantoren in Amsterdam en Eindhoven, werken wij wereldwijd voor een breed scala aan cliënten, van startups tot multinationals van naam en faam. Al vanaf de oprichting waren de oprichters vastbesloten om niet ingewikkeld te doen over advocatuur. Vooral dichtbij je cliënten staan, zo helder en kernachtig mogelijk zijn in alle adviezen en werk leveren dat in ruimere zin van betekenis kan zijn voor de samenleving: zo werken wij nog steeds. Het heeft een open, vriendelijke en informele cultuur gecreëerd, waarin hard gewerkt wordt op topniveau, maar tegelijkertijd veel aandacht is voor een gezonde balans tussen leven en werk. Om bij ons te passen hoef je op niemand te lijken. Sterker nog, dat is zelfs een pré.
Onze tijdelijke collega
Als advocaat a.i. binnen de sectie Commercial & International Trade procedeer, adviseer en onderhandel je op hoog niveau, maar wel op een praktische en directe manier. Omdat onze cliënten veel waarde hechten aan onze solide expertise vragen wij van jou een proactieve en dienstverlenende instelling. Daarnaast:

heb je ruime ervaring op het gebied van geschillenbeslechting en contracteren. Ervaring die je hebt opgedaan binnen een toonaangevende en internationaal opererende praktijk;
voel jij je snel thuis binnen een tijdelijke werkomgeving;
ben je commercieel ingesteld met aandacht voor de cliënt;
ben je beschikbaar vanaf begin mei voor de duur van minimaal vijf maanden voor 32 of 40 uur per week;
beschik je over een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Beheersing van het Duits, Frans en/of Spaans is een pré.
Enthousiast geworden?
Voor meer informatie over deze interim opdracht kun je contact opnemen met Max Pieter, corporate recruiter. Bij concrete interesse ontvangen wij graag op korte termijn jouw cv, een indicatie van jouw uurtarief en een korte persoonsbeschrijving.

Acquisitie vanuit intermediairs wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
Solliciteer direct

Introduction
We are looking for an experienced Solution Architect to join Action’s IT department in our head office in North Holland. In this new role you will become an integral part of the IT team and will be involved in a wide spectrum of projects related to HR tools and systems that are key for the future of our international business. We are looking for an expert in the IT HR domain, someone capable of organizing requirements and setting up solutions for example the applications SuccessFactors and Kronos.
Do you have at least 3 years’ experience in a similar role? Do you have deep knowledge of HR systems and platforms technically, functionally and architecturally? Do you know how to manage expectations, releases and projects while bringing stability and efficiently to the whole IT HR domain? Then we want to know more about you!
This is your daily action
On a daily basis, the solution architect ensures the creation and approval of the functional and technical design of a software solution ensuring that the solution is build, implemented and maintained according to this design. She / He manages the full lifecycle of the solution in line with requirements from both business and IT and aligned with the overall IT strategy keeping balance between costs, functionality, maintenance requirements and impact on existing and new applications. In this role you will contribute in ongoing and new projects, building up and guiding the tasks of the current demands while orienting the solutions to the future needs of the business guaranteeing compliance with enterprise architecture.

In this role you are part of the Technology & IT department, you report to the IT manager BizTech of the area. The Solution Architect aligns with the business stakeholders within the business domain(s), solutions architects within the other IT units, Project Managers within IT Project & Portfolio and solution suppliers/implementation partners whenever appropriate.
Meet your team
Action provides a positive workplace with a highly committed, cost-conscious, and customer-oriented, culturally diverse population. We like to work as a team; we live up to our company values with a simplicity mindset in all we do. Our Technology & IT department adds value with centralized teams for Enterprise Architecture, IT Project & Portfolio Management, Development & Operations, and multiple Business Technology (BizTech) teams.
Keeping up with the challenges and expansion objectives at Action requires the best talent. Do you want to work on challenging projects within the dynamic world of retail with state-of-the-art technology? Take Action!
Curious about your new team manager? Elma Vader can’t wait to work with you!
This is you
You are a self-confident and driven professional, a team player with broad and developed communication skills on enterprise level; You can balance trade-offs for short term and long-term strategies; You have an eye for detail but always keep in mind the bigger picture;
You are pragmatic and able to take leadership on your field. You enjoy a demanding environment and have a passion for HR applications.
Furthermore:
At least 5 years of experience in the field of IT
Extensive knowledge of IT HR applications
Knowledge and experience in best-practice techniques to produce designs of (complex) systems, including requirements discovery and analysis, formulation of solution context, solution alternatives and their assessments, technology selection
Extensive technical breath through experience in the IT industry, including application development and maintenance supporting complex SAP application environments
Proven track record working in solutions architecture
Experience with methods like Agile Scrum, ASL, BiSL, BPM, Archimate, COBIT
What we offer
Contract of 1 year with extension to permanent. On a full time basis of 38h a week
Annual bonus between 5% - 10% / Annual bonusses on personal and/or business goals
24 paid vacation days
The option to participate within a collective health insurance scheme
15% staff discount on Action merchandise
Extensive education and training at our own Action Academy
Full time job of 38h a week. Flexible and remote working hours in alignment with the team and direct manager
Working for a dynamic, international organization with lots of opportunities to grow
Interested?
Are you ready to take Action? Apply now!

Our recruiter will review your application and will get back to you asap.

We’ll invite you for a second interview to discuss your assessment and you will meet with perhaps one of your future colleagues.
Are we still a great match? Then we’ll make you an offer you can’t refuse!

Architect BI & Data Analytics
(38 Hours per week)
Action continues with its amazing expansion plans. We are already active in 8 countries and we have strong plans to boost our international presence. One of our key priorities is to develop and implement a strong Business Intelligence Strategy; for that reason we are Hiring a BI Architect for our BI & Analytics organization, within the Technology Department.
Do you have deep knowledge of the IT industry for BI & Data Analytics architecture? Are you able to work effectively with colleagues, suppliers and other stakeholders, to achieve common targets under time pressure? Do you have an eye for detail without losing the bigger picture? Then please keep on reading!
This is your daily action
As a BI & Data Analytics Architect you will report to the Manager BI & Data Analytics and have a dotted reporting line to the Enterprise Architect. You will closely work with BI&DA Business Consultants, BI Developers and the business stakeholders of all departments within Action and keep track on the alignment/integration between the BI&DA platform and various other processes and platforms.

You will alert where improvements in existing functionality can be realized to support the business processes and you are involved in alignment sessions with our suppliers and Product Owner(s). Where necessary you will assist in complicated incident resolution where this touches upon functionality of the BI & Data Analytics domain. As a Architect BI & Data Analytics you will make sure that implementation of functionality is aligned with IT policies on development and standardization, within the BI & Analytics domain and within the overall Enterprise Architecture.

High Impact role

keen interests in Digital Assets

Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) has a client base of approximately 3,000. In the Netherlands, we serve clients with revenues exceeding EUR 250 million. In Northwest Europe (France, Germany, United Kingdom and Belgium), we serve clients in a variety of sectors with revenues exceeding EUR 100 million. We are globally active in 13 countries. We are sector-led, offering a wide range of services and products in global markets and lending and have specialized departments in Clearing and Trade & Commodity Finance.
Structured Finance & Portfolio Management (SF&PM) is the Lending product unit of CIB. All Lending products and expertise are clustered in SF&PM, with the exception of the specialties Trade & Commodity Finance and Clearing. SF&PM is responsible for the structuring of a variety of lending products for all sectors and segments. These activities are executed in the following departments: Lending, Structured Finance Origination, Central Portfolio Management, Infrastructure & Fund Management, and PE activities.
Lending provides (structured) lending products to new and existing large corporate clients domestically and internationally. Lending can be split into (i) Corporate Lending Europe, (ii) Lending NR/GTL including APAC and US and (iii) Specialised Lending. Corporate Lending Europe consists of specific Sector Teams including (i) Food, Retail, TMT, Leisure and Business Services (ii) Industries, Automotive, Logistics EU, Utilities, Construction and Real Estate, and the multi sector Execution Team.
In close collaboration with other product-teams of SF&PM and Risk Management, Lending is responsible for resolving complex tailor-made and bilateral- and syndicated financing issues of clients and is the ‘first-line of defence’ in the assessment credit risk based on (credit) experience and specific client- and sector knowledge. After obtaining credit risk approval from Risk Management, Lending negotiates the credit documentation with the client. In addition, Lending is responsible for monitoring the existing portfolio of (debt) transactions and the execution of imminent deals, including coordination with external advisors (legal, technical, insurance, markets).

Your job
Within Lending, two types of teams can be distinguished: (i) Sector Teams and (ii) the Execution Team. As a Lender in the Execution Team you will work closely with Lenders in the Sector Teams on a flexible and pre-dominantly sector agnostic basis. Collectively all Lenders have a shared responsibility for the credit relationship and management of the portfolio of European clients within SF & PM. This includes the structuring of complex tailor-made and bilateral financing solutions, advising, selling various lending products to new- and existing clients also in close collaboration with Client Coverage, Structured Finance, Global Markets, Risk Management etc.
As a Associate in the Execution Team you will work in close cooperation with Sector Lenders and your Execution Team members in managing the portfolio of Corporate Lending Europe. You can be part of Client Service Teams (CST) which are multiple product teams that are managed by the coverage banker to tackle client questions and develop commercial propositions. Together with Lenders from the Sector Lending teams, you will be involved in the origination and execution of deals including pitching to clients, writing credit applications, structuring transactions, reviewing and negotiating credit documentation, and coordination with external advisors (legal, technical, insurance, markets). In addition, the function includes the monitoring of the existing portfolio of (debt) transactions and contribution to internal projects in the areas of process optimization and innovation of the credit chain, regulatory developments and requests, sector deep dives, risk management projects, and organisation wide initiatives.

Working environment
You will be working with ~25 professionals working within Corporate Lending Europe covering ~250 clients. We work closely together ensuring that our portfolio has a balanced credit profile and grows in a sustainable way. We ensure our clients are serviced optimally within set internal/external parameters. Part of your job is to coach and develop Team members including trainees and interns.
You shall be working in Amsterdam. We work in an open floor space on the Gustav Mahlerlaan, where we have all stakeholders in our vicinity (Coverage, Risk, Products, Sustainability etc).
Your profile
We are looking for an finance specialist with former client facing, risk management experience, or credit structuring experience. Check your profile:
Educated university level.
Up to 3 years of experience in a client facing or risk management type of role.
Strong knowledge of international credit process (incl. credit application/processing/ monitoring).
Strong knowledge of specific market(s) and general credit market in which he/she is active.
Solid knowledge of ICT applications which support the commercial process.
Solid knowledge and experience of project /stakeholder management processes.
Good understanding of bilateral loans and documentation, average understanding of syndicated loan
Experienced with medium- to high intensity clients and prospects, preferably with (international) large corporates and/or international clients.
Basic knowledge of financial statements/tax/legal/documentation/insurance/technical.
Excellent in speaking, writing and reading of English and preferably control multiple other languages.
We are offering
The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits
A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
An annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on the function
A solid pension plan.
Interested?
Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible. To find out more, contact Bob Vogelzang, e-mail: bob.vogelzang@nl.abnamro.com. We very much look forward meeting you.

KARL LAGERFELD COMPANY PROFILE

At Karl Lagerfeld, we are driven by Karl’s mantra: “Embrace the present and invent the future”

The House of KARL LAGERFELD shares the creative vision and design aesthetic of its iconic founder, Karl Lagerfeld. Always contemporary and forward-looking. We are the only fashion house that carries Karl’s name at its doorbell and we’re thriving to live up to this responsibility in everything we do, every day with lots of joy and passion.
Our headquarters in Paris and in Amsterdam are home to a very diverse and driven Karl family from more than 25 countries creating meaningful stories and product concepts that connect to Karl’s world and iconic attributes.
Women’s ready to wear, bags, small leather goods and underwear are managed directly from our Amsterdam HQ other categories including men’s wear, footwear, fragrances, eyewear and more are developed together with best in class license partners.
We connect with our consumers at multiple levels – online and offline hand in hand. We thrive to maximize consumer engagement via more than 200 KL stores worldwide, our premium wholesale partners and our strong digital footprint, spearheaded by our KARL.COM flagship store which reaches 96 countries. With digital channels representing already more than 30% of our overall full price business.
We are a dynamic, fast growing and inclusive company built on professionalism and strong values. Across all areas of our business, at KARL LAGERFELD we commit working toward highest standards of sustainability and integrity. In 2019, KARL LAGERFELD joined as a founding member the Fashion Pact, a global sustainability initiative seeking to transform the fashion industry through objectives in three areas: climate, biodiversity and ocean protection.
JOB SUMMARY / PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

Provide support in day to day tasks within the Retail Department.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE:

Communication: Development of weekly store communications
Reporting, analysis and presentations: Prepare weekly and monthly reports, analysis and presentations in relation to trade, ranking, tax free, commercial activities
Customer Relationship Management: Collect and analyze CRM data
Packaging: Responsible for stock management and development of packaging
Support the Retail department with ad-hoc activities & projects
Store openings: Support the operational preparations of new store openings
Seminars: Support the organization of the bi-annual Store Manager Seminar and other in-season meetings & trainings
Customer Care: Daily follow up and tracking of Retail Customer Care
Administration: Support the Retail Managers with maintaining a structured documentation of key documents
Support Store Managers in operational and administrative tasks
MAIN RELATIONSHIPS:

Karl Lagerfeld Stores

SKILLS, EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

From 3rd year of Bachelors studies in Management and International business
Language: fluent in English, both verbal and written French or German is a plus
Numerical skills
Familiar with MS Office

PROFILE:

Able to work independently as well as in a team
Able to work in an international work environment
Interest & passion for the fashion industry
Flexibility, adaptability and a positive "can-do" attitude are a must
Ability to prioritize and multitask

Ben jij in je element als spin-in-het-web tussen marketing en sales? Heb jij relevante marketing ervaring en kun jij onze merkwaarden doorvertalen naar de winkelvloer van onze dealer? Heb je bovenal een proactieve, ondernemende houding en wil je aan de slag in een leuk team binnen een dynamische, jonge organisatie? Dan is Allshoes Safety Footwear op zoek naar jou!

Vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Amsterdam bouwt de TM aan de merken van Allshoes op retailniveau, o.a. door het doorvertalen van onze merkwaarden naar de winkelvloer van onze dealers. Innovatie is een belangrijk onderdeel van de Allshoes marktbewerking. Van de TM wordt verwacht dat alle benodigdheden ter ondersteuning van deze innovaties ontwikkeld worden. Hiermee zorg je ervoor dat de vertaalslag naar onze B2B klanten gemaakt wordt. Verder ondersteunt de TM ons sales team bij het managen van digitale salesfunnels, met name om nieuwe partners buiten Nederland aan ons te binden. Daarmee draag je bij aan het sales doel om deze prospects uit te bouwen naar klanten.
De taken en verantwoordelijkheden van de Trade Marketeer:
- Jij bent een rots in de branding voor de marketing- en salesafdeling. Met deze collega's werk jij nauw samen om de behoeftes van onze klant in beeld te brengen;Jij zorgt ervoor dat relevante Point-Of-Sale materiaal beschikbaar is. Jij weet waar onze klanten behoefte aan hebben en je maakt hiervan de vertaling van onze merken naar materialen. Deze regel jij van a tot z. Het ondersteunende reclame materiaal wordt nationaal én internationaal gebruikt. Je bent hierbij verantwoordelijk voor de vormgeving en productie van vrijwel iedere uiting en houdt deze up-to-date. Je werkt hiervoor samen met ons reclamebureau;Jij stelt B2B sales materialen op ter ondersteuning van lanceringen (digitaal dan wel geprint), waaronder de doorvertaling van het Allshoes businessplan naar een salesplan presentatie;Jij ondersteunt onze business development managers middels het managen van digitale automated sales funnels;Jij zorgt samen met de Marketing Communicatie Manager voor B2B digitale nieuwsbrieven;Jij optimaliseert onze B2B webshop, op basis van interne & externe input;Jij zorgt ervoor dat klanten altijd digitale productinformatie ter beschikking hebben;Jij zorgt voor afhandeling van ad-hoc verzoeken van klanten m.b.t. marketing materialen en advertenties.
Wat verwachten wij van jou?
Wij zijn vooral op zoek naar een teamplayer met de juiste mentaliteit en drive die past bij onze cultuur. De onderstaande punten helpen jou om van deze nieuwe TM-rol een succes te maken:Een afgeronde hbo studie in de richting van marketing/communicatie;Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse én Engelse taal, in woord en geschrift;Beginnende relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol. Dit mag ook aan bureauzijde geweest zijn;Affiniteit met merkartikelen en ervaring met concept selling;Aantoonbare ervaring in het opstellen van sales materialen en klant presentaties;Soft skills: proactief, ondernemend, interpersoonlijke vaardigheden, analytisch, open mind-set, conceptmatig sterk en creatief;Jouw manier van werken sluit goed aan bij de kernwaarden van Allshoes: teamgeest, volharding en durf;Ervaring met Photoshop en InDesign is een pré.
Meer informatie over Allshoes
Allshoes – onderdeel van multinational Bunzl – is een van de grootste spelers in de Benelux als het gaat om veiligheidsschoenen. Schoenen waarbij veiligheid en de laatste modetrends hand in hand gingen en nog steeds gaan. Wij bedienen zowel de B2C als de B2B markt.
Allshoes zit momenteel midden in een transformatie van een klassieke groothandel naar een ondernemende marketing-, sales- en data-gedreven organisatie. Onze strategie is om vol in te zetten op de pijlers innovatie, internationalisatie, klantgerichtheid en het zijn van een Great Place to Work. Ook willen wij graag vooruitstrevend zijn op het gebied van duurzaamheid en hebben we de ambitie om in 2025 volledig circulair te zijn. Daarnaast heeft Allshoes een prachtig nieuw kantoor in de Houthavens te Amsterdam, dat uitkijkt op het IJ.
Onze ambitie is echter nog groter; wij willen met Allshoes verder groeien op de Europese markt van veiligheidsschoenen. Hier richt onze strategie voor de komende jaren zich dan ook op; samen veroveren we eerst Europa en dan daarna de rest van de wereld, paar voor paar. Ga jij als nieuwe Trade Marketeer samen met ons deze grenzen verleggen?
Meer informatie over Marketing & Sales
Marketing is verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van campagnes, media beleid, b2c e-commerce en product ontwikkeling. Daarnaast is het team voortdurend in de weer met het optimaliseren van onze digitale saleskanalen, met behulp van inzichten uit data, en het digitaal onderhouden van relaties met voornamelijk ZZP eindgebruikers.
Sales is verantwoordelijk voor alle commerciële activiteiten rondom het behoud en uitbouwen van de reeds sterke positie in de diverse kanalen. Deze klanten worden via diverse kanalen bewerkt; e-commerce, retail, groothandel, dealers en direct. Binnen deze kanalen wordt samengewerkt met puur technische partners en met specialisten op het gebied van persoonlijke beschermingsmiddelen (PBM).
Wat staat er voor jou tegenover?
Als Trade Marketeer bij Allshoes krijg jij een goed salaris. Naast je salaris werk je ook met een bonusprogramma dat opgebouwd is uit bedrijfsdoelstellingen en jouw persoonlijke doelstellingen. Wanneer je fulltime werkt, krijg jij van ons 26 vakantiedagen om heerlijk op te laden. Je bouwt pensioen op via LifeSight. Jaarlijks mag je zelfs 3 (betaalde) werkdagen besteden aan duurzaam vrijwilligerswerk. Uiteraard is er voldoende mogelijkheid om je te ontwikkelen. Jouw nieuwe collega’s werken met plezier en zijn trots op elkaar en de resultaten die we samen behalen. We hebben iedere dag een gezamenlijke lunch en zorgen voor voldoende fruit op kantoor, zodat jij gezond je dag doorkomt! We organiseren vele leuke (sportieve) uitjes en activiteiten en natuurlijk de vrijdagmiddagborrels.
Is dit jouw baan?
Ben jij enthousiast geworden en denk je dat je goed in ons team past? We ontvangen graag je cv, maar belangrijker nog, een korte motivatie waarin je jouw toegevoegde waarde uiteenzet!
Heb je vragen? Neem dan contact op met Sophie Heering (Talent Manager Allshoes) via 06-22870967.

New Markets Lead, EMEA
The Role
The EMEA New Market Leader owns the expansion roadmap and its successful implementation across all new markets in EMEA. He/ She collaborates with relevant teams and stakeholders across the entire project value chain from planning to realization on the ground for all projects related to expansion into new markets. Key stakeholders are real estate, market leaders and various HQ-functions to make sure we are staying on track to plan and proactively following up on our expansion plans. This role requires a strong leader that is familiar with business operations, has acute attention to detail, executes at a high caliber, and successfully drives projects through to completion. The EMEA New Market Lead is a member of the EMEA Leadership Team. .
Responsibilities:
Define the growth strategy and market entry plan for new markets in EMEA
Lead the necessary research and analysis required to create holistic business plans for new market entries. Including risk/opportunity analysis, Financial analysis, end to end requirements gathering, and timeline definition.
Lead the search and negotiation to open new markets and “un-chartered” territories – consolidating, aligning and driving the various stakeholders and parties that contribute to a market opening and ensuring its success
Coordinate the launch efforts for new markets across the various supporting functions ensuring all aspects of launch are managed in a timely manner, including website readiness, tax/trade, entity creation, communications, product readiness, homologation, Sales operations, Financing products
Work closely with Retail Development and Charging teams to ensure the necessary infrastructure is in place to support new market entries.
Where necessary, develop and nurture partnerships with third parties
Support in hiring first Tesla team members in new markets
Work with various teams to coordinate input of critical supplementary teams such as EHS, Security (physical security on site), HR (for workplace experience) and other to ensure our expansion efforts are supported and our physical footprint his healthy.
Work directly with key stakeholders to develop and execute against each new market’s growth plans. Be the conduit of information for all supporting functions involved in launching new markets.
Collaborate closely and build strong relationships with corresponding teams, contributors and stakeholders in other regions.

RequirementsStrategic thinkerSolid management experience, including managing Managers, hiring and developing high-performing teamsAble to influence at all levels internally and externally to drive decision making
Ability to deal with change and ambiguity, thriving in a fast-paced/ high-intensity environmentInnovation / re-writing the rules, challenging status quo,Demonstrated success in setting goals and priorities and driving for resultsHands-on approachExcellent analytical and communication skillsRelentless energy, and a strong drive for excellenceFlexibility in travel as required in roleFluent in EnglishPassion for Tesla’s mission to accelerate the transition to sustainable transportationAny additional European language is a plus.

Job Title: Sales Support Manager EU | TP Vision
Job Description:
About Tpv Technology
TPV Technology is an internationally-renowned PC monitor, TV and Digital Signage Displays manufacturer. TPV serves as an original design manufacturer for some of the best-known TV , PC and Digital Signage Displays brands in the industry and distributes its products worldwide under its own brands AOC and Envision. In addition, the company designs, produces and sells Philips-branded monitors, TV's and AVA products, Digital Signage Displays and mobile phones through a license agreement with Philips via its subsidiaries TP Vision and MMD. As an example, the company brings high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. TPV believes in creating products that touch the human senses and are within reach of all consumers in the markets they operate in. As a leader in the hotel industry, their hospitality TV division serves most the world's major international and national hotel groups, as well as individual hotels, hospitals, cruises and other professional facilities.

About Tp Vision
TP Vision is a consumer electronics key player in the world of audio visual digital entertainment. TP Vision concentrates on developing, manufacturing and marketing Philips branded TV sets (Europe, Russia, Middle East, South America, India and selected countries in Asia-Pacific) and audio products (all around the Globe). We do this by combining the innovative Philips brand heritage with our design expertise, operational excellence, flexibility and speed of TPV Technology. With these combined strengths, we bring high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. We believe in creating products that offer a superior audio and visual experience for consumers. With Philips TVs, TP Vision is a global leader in the hospitality market. TP Vision is the exclusive brand licensee of Philips TVs for the above listed countries and, on the global stage for the Philips audio products.TP Vision employs close to 2,000 people in several locations around the globe and is 100% owned by TPV, one of the world’s leading monitor and LCD TV manufacturers, selling and marketing Philips branded TVs in China. TPV has been able to drive its growth over the years by leveraging its economies of scale and core competencies in R&D, manufacturing, logistic efficiency and quality.

Scope
Amsterdam (The Netherlands) – The Sales Support Manager is part of the European Sales Support Team. The Sales Support Manager is responsible for Europe and will report directly to the Head of Global Sales Support. For this role the Sales Support Manager is the linking pin between customer needs and operations and responsible to manage the CX for all products. In this role the Sales Support Manager has a good knowledge of all the products and knows how to translate the problems that occurs, to the back end of customer service. The Sales Support Manager will focus on improving customer service on diverse projects, makes sure that the service policies are up to par and reports/communicates on diverse levels of the organisation.

Responsibility
Co-develop Consumer Care Policies and new service scenarios and responsible for the implementation and alignment with the respective CS teams
To execute country/SO Service policies which support the global consumer care ways of working
To provide leadership and expertise to support the country/SO team in executing Marketing strategies, i.e., warranty policies, return policies, concession policies, service scenarios, etc. and align with the respective BE teams for implementation and execution
Contact window for Sales team for escalations, coordinate with CS teams for customer solution, communicate and update Sales
To maintain and distribute warranty policy documentation for the respective business and markets


What Do We Offer You
Fulltime position and competitive rewards , based in Amsterdam
An interesting, dynamic, challenging, and fast-moving international working environment
Opportunity to grow true business sense


Education And Related Experience
Min. 8 years business experience (consumer care experience is preferred)
Academic / Higher Business School or via experience
Knowledge of Consumer Care (or related areas) processes
Insight and knowledge of Market developments
Trade & Retail knowledge
Knowledge of Net Promoter Score Management


More Info
If you enjoy working with knowledgeable, success oriented people, for a company that both challenges and respects its professionals, and you've got what it takes to be a great Sales Support Manager, then apply today. Please contact Chelsea Nguyen (Corporate Recruiter) at Chelsea.nguyen@tpv-tech.com (please include your CV and a short motivation).
