About Our Client
Multinational FMCG Company
Job Description
As International Trade Marketing Manager, you will be part of the global Sales & Trade Marketing team. This role focuses on driving profitable growth in the categories. You will be providing central support in building local trade marketing related capabilities and solutions - via development of content, trainings, workshops and participation in local projects. Also you will be the center of excellence and point of reference for global Trade Marketing. In addition you will support the Operating Companies on specific needs or projects which can be part of a long-term or short-term development need (category/shelf management, commercial booster projects, channel or customer projects, etc.). You are also responsible to provide support to local teams on function-related questions, sharing of best practices and participating in regional conferences or visits with the objective of building commercial capabilities. Your responsibilities will include: Category Vision & Category Development
Evolve and roll out of the global Category Vision and category strategies into Operating Companies. Closely collaborate with Group Marketing teams to define segment growth drivers and strategies based on market clusters
Support category teams (Group/Operating Companies) in category knowledge from shopper and retail angle
Detect Trade Marketing support and development needs for local entities. Support local teams in capability development roadmap. You will develop a Category Management Training and learning agenda
Development of global channel and support development of local channel visions. Develop insights to support different channel visions
Evolve global Touchpoint vision to secure category and brand confrontation
Business Intelligence / Channel and Shopper Insights
Develop channel knowledge and detect key trends. Use intel resources such as Kantar Retail. Create facts to support development of different channel visions
Development of category analytics/tools to support local Trade Marketing teams with analytics and in defining optimal category strategies
Develop global category-led insights and support Group Category/Marketing teams and local Operating Companies in category knowledge, opportunities and trends
Shopper Research: identify and coordinate international shopper research projects. Align priorities and secure resources in Operating Companies; be the contact point for shopper research in alignment with Group CMI team. Secure business relevance of shopper research. Participation in local research projects and aggregation of local learnings into global toolkits and playbooks. Sharing learnings regularly throughout global community
Support global launches with KPI's, tracking, measurement and best practice development
Revenue Management
Develop Global Revenue Management agenda together with regional/global stakeholders
Drive and Develop our Pack Price Architecture Playbook. Lead in global roll out of playbook into local markets
Develop ROI mindset and solutions in Trade and Shopper Marketing. Support both global as well as local Shopper Marketing teams
Shopper Marketing
Support major global/regional Shopper Marketing initiatives (activations, seasonal, touchpoint development)
Develop and share learnings
Cooperate with Brand Teams on major global launches (selling stories, trade kits, KPI's)
Sharing & Community Management
Best Practice Sharing: develop a strong sharing culture for the benefit of Operating companies
Participate in developing the global community and facilitating their exchange
Development and organization of webinars, workshops and conferences
Fast moving consumer goods (food)
Dynamic marketing role with global scope
The Successful Applicant
For this position we are looking for someone who has a holistic experience in Trade/Customer Marketing. You are practical and pragmatic, understand the business and at the same time are able to conceptualize in order to provide a global view and to help markets with concepts for growth. The ideal candidate has:
MA/MBA Degree (preferably Business Management or Marketing Management)
8+ years of commercial experience demonstrated in Trade marketing, Sales or Category Development
Experience in Project Management
Qualitative and quantitative Research experience (Consumer/shopper) and Analytical Experience (e.g. Nielsen, IRI, GfK)
What's on Offer
Good monetary compensation

Are you the Merchandising talent that is flexible, collaborative, has a clear understanding of the consumer needs and an eye for product, and loves to drive a smooth process? If so then we might have the right opportunity for you! We are looking for an Associate Merchandiser who is immediately available to support us during this maternity leave (3 - 5 months temporary contract).


What does the role involve?


As the Associate Merchandiser, you will drive the process from line adoption down to in-season trade. The goal of the function is to serve our members in the NIKE Direct channels across EMEA with an amazing product assortment, available where they shop, at the right time. The priority of your work therefor will be to build and land a seasonal, member-led assortment framework. Starting point will be the Digital platform, yet encompassing the physical doors in the NIKE fleet with a specific focus on key cities as well as our new retail formats that are being developed to lead a premium marketplace.


Core accountabilities


You will drive the strongest possible product assortment to serve our members. For this we expect you to build a clear vision and understanding of our consumer mindsets plus our membership strategy and to land a detailed product assortment with strong focus on innovation, flow, price architecture, seasonality and productivity whilst managing our long term franchises. Your work will become the starting point for the wholesale marketplace units to draft of from. You will leverage our Direct channel results and consumer insights to identify opportunities to adapt business in season, trading the business in close collaboration with cross functional partners, as well as inform future line plans and product adoption.




Waar ga je werken?
Why do I want to work here?

Although the current situation is a full work from home situation, the NIKE EHQ is based on an inspiring campus in Hilversum. A dynamic, energizing place to work that reflects the values and spirit of the brand. Colleagues from all over the world and located in and amongst numerous parks, cycling lanes and running tracks. Furthermore, this package includes:

25 vacation days if you work 40 hours per week a full year
Commuting allowance EUR 0.19 cent per km/max of EUR 6 net per day
8.33% holiday allowance
After 26 work weeks participation in pension plan
Free access to the online learning platform Adecco Academy
Free access to NIKE online training Club app and work outs via Zoom


Wat vragen wij?
This is why the role is a great match for me:


Bachelor's Degree in Business or similar
Excellent communications skills (written and verbal) and fluent in English
At least 2 years total experience in (retail) merchandising and/or product creation demonstrating a high level of product, retail and merchandising acumen
Product aesthetic acumen; experience translating observations of trends, color, materials, and fashion into compelling product and assortment recommendations
Strong team player and ability to work with peers and cross functional partners
Ability to deliver results against tight and complex timelines with competing priorities
Strong business orientation, analytical mindset and retail math
Effectively communicate and influence others
You have a problem solving and self-starter attitude


Sounds great, how do I apply?
Apply now via nike@adecco.nl or if you need more information about the team, the company, the role; feel free to give Terri a call at + 31 (0) 6 824 81 980. She will be more than happy to support!

Job Title: Store Manager - Amsterdam, The Netherlands - Maternity Cover FTC
Job Description:
Store Manager - Amsterdam, The Netherlands - Maternity Cover FTC
Amsterdam
THE ALLSAINTS TEAM
Here at AllSaints we are proud to be a customer centric global team. Our vision is to make the coolest clothes to evoke emotion for our customers, worldwide.
Everything about our style and creativity is curated in-house, from store design and construction to our brand image, digital presence and clothing design. We are truly an agile business: we work at pace and take responsibility for making a difference.
We are a brand embarking on a very exciting plan and we are seeking new members of the team who want to contribute to this.
THE ROLE
The Store Manager is an important role within our retail operations. You are responsible for the overall accountability of the success of our store. You will own the in store customer journey, the financial targets and delivery of business critical updates into the stores which are designed to drive sales.
You’ll be spending the majority of your time on our busy shop floors, creating fun environments, while engaging team members and customers alike with your positive influence and energy. Upskilling and equipping team members with the available tools to succeed through clear communications and interaction will be key to delivering sales targets.
Our stores are fast paced and constantly moving forward, and as store manager you’ll need lots of energy, passion and tenacity to deliver brand expectations.
WHAT WILL I BE DOING?
You will equip and incentivise your team with the latest product knowledge, brand strategies and people updates empowering them to deliver a great in-store experience
You hold responsibility for the development of your team. By hosting annual appraisals for all team members, you will recognise and highlight achievements as well as identify areas of improvement, setting the objectives for each individual’s needs
Effectively plan and deliver monthly floor sets, promoting our new collections and driving sales across all product categories.
You will lead floor walks, occasionally at director level, with full understanding of your business, KPI performance and with reasoning behind any commercial decision
With support from your District Manager and the relationships built with brand support, you own all areas of your business. From customer experience, stockroom operations and HR policies to payroll, profit protection, health & safety and recruitment - this is your show!
One management team - you set the expectations, occasionally stepping into other roles to upskill and present on the spot feedback to drive the business forward
With the support of our reporting technologies, you walk our shop floors on a daily basis 'through the eyes of our customers', maximising on all trade opportunities, identifying and reacting to risks at the earliest stage with pace
Responsible for ensuring your management and Stylist teams adhere to wardrobe and grooming guidelines and operational excellence - you are a model store, showcasing achievements and the pride of team through our Google platforms
Awareness and handling of all employee related matters in store, you will work alongside your HR advisor to resolve issues in a timely and effective manner

WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?
You are customer and team centric and will have excellent people management skills; You strive to get the best from your

Job description

G-Star strives to be the most hardcore denim brand in the world. To achieve this, we are looking for hardcore thinkers and do-ers, who dare to create the future of premium and purposeful denim with us.

We are looking for people with big dreams, while keeping their feet on the ground. Those who are not afraid to push the limits, because we believe there are no limits in what denim can do.
Are you up for the challenge?
Are you the perfect fit for our team?
Are you a bit of a rebellious spirit?
Then we would love to hear from you!

Tasks and Responsibilities

Trading
As our Trade Director you will be responsible for all digital platforms (.Com, Outlet, App). We are looking for a candidate with a relentless drive to improve healthy sales and customer experience. Who is able to forecast and drive all online KPI’s, performance trends and volumes. You will optimise and forecast sales, promotions, sell through and conversion targets across all platforms and markets and onsite search to improve customer experience and conversion. Support the formulation of the online range based on historic and forecasted category and site performance. You will be closely working with the digital merchandiser to deliver a commercial buying process and continually liaise with global sales teams to optimise stock position for digital. You will work with UX and analytics/insights team to revise and constantly improve the customer journey, conversion funnel from category view to product page and basket checkout. You will develop strong collaborative relationships across the ecommerce, insights, marketing, creative and wider merchandising team. Create and manage the execution of the digital trading calendar. Improve full price and limit discount driven initiatives.
Online Visual Merchandising
The Trade Director drives improvements of the visual merchandising strategy, ensuring that product listings are on brand, optimized for sales and ahead of the competition. You will use analysis and data to evaluate impact of any visual merchandising changes and continually drive improvements. Continuously improve visual merchandising – identify new activity that will support trading of the site.

Customer
You will deliver a customer centric strategy. Improve all customer touch points across service, site experience, offers, technology, product, visual merchandising display and communications. Support the customer identification strategy (customer purchase journey across all platforms and channels. Drive conversion / optimisation tactics from and into the CDP. Work with retail / wholesale teams to provide best Stylist service advice to consumers.
Systems and Reporting
Using Tableau, analytics or other tools, ensure business and performance knowledge across the teams. Create actionable reporting and easy to consume performance analysis across sales, product, customer journey, customer behaviour, platforms, markets, trading activity and testing activity.

Profile

What you bring to the table:

Extensive experience in a multi-channel digital trading team driving change and growthStrong analytical, problem-solving, project and change management and expertiseCommercially and customer focussed with an understanding of the nuances of an entrepreneurial brandHave demonstrative knowledge of online buying behaviours with proven experience of delivering online customer experience improvementExpert excel skillsExperience with Tableau or using similar insights tools preferredExcellent forecasting and planning skillsStrong cross-functional leadership skills with partnership experience across functional teamsStrong team player with clear and concise communication styleResilient – experience of managing rapid change and growthUnderstanding of target demographic consumer behaviourExcellent command of consumer analytics mining tools and analysing results (Omniture, GA, DC Storm, CRM, CDP sources etc.)Advanced understanding of digital marketing strategies including brand campaigns, paid social media, display advertising, search activity CRM and SEOStrong seasonal planning and campaign launch planningHands on trading, marketing and promotion experience within a retail environment (preferably fashion or retail)

What does G-Star bring to the table:

Beyond a competitive salary, working at G-Star brings many other perks and exciting opportunities: an awesome and diverse team that collaborates to change the game; a work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation; a clothing budget; a healthy, fresh and delicious lunch and even discounts in various fitness clubs and last but not least, a discount on a new bicycle.

What will happen next:

We will thoroughly review your CV (English is our corporate language, so please apply in English)When we hopefully find what we are looking for, we will call you for a chat and if it’s a good fit, we’ll plan our first interviewBecause we’re very curious how you’d survive a mission impossible, we ask you to prepare a real-life business case in a follow-up interviewWhen we’re ready to commit to each other, we’ll finalize the terms we’ve discussed and we’ll explain to you how to order your first pair of jeans from the G-Star employee store. Good luck!

High-growth startup looking for a creative design internto help build the future of B2B Commerce.In short (TL;DR)Orderchamp is reimagining wholesale by bringing independent retailers and brands together in a digital marketplace;Using machine learning to match retailers with suppliers; data, recommendations, social interaction, etc.;Talented team and extremely ambitious growth plansWe take design serious. Quality is our landmark.Transformed a former restaurant into an office space. Obviously, the bar is still standing and open on Friday’s (true story)!About usThe retail landscape is rapidly changing. We believe that independent stores can differentiate themselves from the masses by creating a curated product offering. Reinforced by the ‘maker revolution’, there are more brands than ever before. However, there remains many inefficiencies with the current wholesale model, making it difficult for brands to find the right sales channels, and for retailers to discover unique products. We want to enable creators and shop owners from around the world to come together and build upon one another's success.We make wholesale better. On a daily basis, we find unique brands and use machine learning to connect them with the right retailers. We take the guesswork out of the equation by unlocking the power of data for all. Leveraging our social platform to create interactions between both parties, our mission translates two-fold: 1) retailers can easily discover and purchase distinctive and high quality products in smaller quantities and; 2) brands can quickly do business with new buyers in new regions. With our vision to provide unique merchandise for every store, we seek to help both retailers and brands grow their business.Entrepreneurship and commerce is in our DNA; that is why we set out to build this product for our customers. Many of our team members were responsible for the success of SaaS ecommerce platform, SEOshop, which was acquired by Lightspeed before recently going public (TSX: LSPD). Orderchamp is based on the newest technology, is funded by top-tier investors, delivers on an ambitious roadmap, and is supported by a talented team.What are we looking for?Orderchamp is seeking a Design intern to join our team in Amsterdam. We are looking for a pro-active and versatile student, that can express their creativity in different ways. You'll be part of our marketing team working closely with both our specialists that are building the most beautiful campaigns together with you!In this role you'll be working closely together with our Head of Marketing and Product Designer. Both will coach you with regards to design, branding and other key aspects of a successful campaign. We want to make sure that our campaigns look flawless and inspiring. You will help design banners, imagery and make help our digital marketing ads look even more shiny! There can be also ad hoc offline activities, like flyers and design work for trade shows. We're looking for someone that get's stuff done and likes to interact with different departments to work with them. It can be that you'll help customers with their banners, HR with employment branding and work on our product to make it stand out!Requirements: You are a passionate student in design/multimedia;The usual: Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, etc., etc. (more is better)Excellent communication skills;Great time management skills;Interest in ecommerce, retail and B2B;Fluent in Dutch & English.This is you: You enjoy working in a young startup;You do not get upset quickly and you see problems as a challenge;You have an affinity with brands & products;You are creative and can work perfectly autonomously;You have a hands-on mentality. So tackle immediately!We offer: Internship remuneration;A real ambitious, fun and inspiring work surrounding (see above);A spacious office in the heart of Amsterdam (Leidseplein), incl. N64/Switch/PS1;Room for ownership and initiative within a fast-growing start-up organization;Weekly drinks in Amsterdam. We celebrate our success!Contractduur 4 maandenJob Types: Full-time, Internship

Job Title: International Key Account Manager eCommerce (online accounts)
Job Description:
About Our Client
Fashion company with premium lingerie brands

Job Description
As the International Key Account Manager eCommerce (Online accounts) you will be reporting into the Head of Wholesales
Your responsibilities will be to:
Develop the E-Commerce Strategy and growth plan for the online retailers / digital accounts
Partner with the local KAM on the development of an account specific business plan and digital activation plan to achieve the overall growth plan
Align the strategic busines plans including brand and content optimization, data sharing, landing page planning and to ensure the local implementation
Develop relationships with Key European Market places and to provide sales service to our retail partners working with Market places
Be the E-Commerce Channel expert and digital advisor for our partners
Create sales opportunities by analyzing data, website content and competitors
Identify and lead new business opportunities within E-Commerce/digital accounts
Identify and follow relevant KPI's, track the necessary data and manage the weekly follow-up against the targets
Provide recommendations to drive shopper experience and market share, by utilizing data, keyword search and customer insights
Monitor and improve brand distribution, representation and discoverability
Engage and collaborate with multifunctional teams (marketing, trade marketing, B2B, sales, operations,…) to drive the execution of the business strategy
Support and coach the sales teams in digitalization
Partner with supply chain and the customers to ensure sales forecasting, product availability and customer service levels

Fashion Company with Premium Lingerie Brands
Key Account Manager - Online Accounts
The Successful Applicant
Your profile
You have a Master's degree (ex. Commercial Engineering, Business, Economics, Marketing) with a passion for fashion
You have minimum 5 years of relevant Sales/KAM experience and you are experienced in working with Market places/ online accounts
You have an advanced knowledge of web analytics, and knowledge of creative web design, site functionality, usability and marketing
You are fluent in English, knowledge of Dutch is a plus
You have a commercial mind and are driven by sales results
You are a team player, a people person and real relation builder
You are a skilled negotiator with great communication and presentation skills
You are strong in analytics and you think solutions

What's on Offer
Working for Van de Velde means working for a value driven, international, innovative company in fashion industry, with beautiful premium brands that truly make a difference in women's lives
You will work together with an international team of passionate, professional, warm, customer- and result oriented colleagues
A competitive compensation and benefits package
You will get the opportunity to learn, develop and grow

About PVH Corp.
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world.
We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good.
Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric intimates brand. True&Co. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
About Calvin Klein
Calvin Klein is a global lifestyle brand built on iconic essentials and powered by bold, progressive ideals.
The Calvin Klein brands — CK Calvin Klein, Calvin Klein, Calvin Klein Jeans, Calvin Klein Underwear and Calvin Klein Performance — provide us with the opportunity to market products both domestically and internationally at various price points, through multiple distribution channels and to different consumer groups. The Calvin Klein brands are also licensed for a range of products, including fragrance, women's apparel, footwear, eyewear, watches and jewelry in various regions. Global retail sales of products sold under the Calvin Klein brands were approximately $9.4 billion in 2019.
The tiered-brand strategy was established for Calvin Klein to provide a focused, consistent approach to global brand growth and development that preserves the brand's prestige and image. Each of the Calvin Klein brands occupies a distinct marketing identity and position.We believe that Calvin Klein is well positioned over the next few years to establish itself as the world’s favorite brand. With the North Star of "Defying the boundaries of self-expression" guiding its design, marketing and consumer engagement initiatives, we believe that Calvin Klein will convert its investments into ongoing commercial success
The Team:
The Trim Development team supports the division, vendors and suppliers of Calvin Klein with all strategic sourcing, vendor management and quality assurance activities.
Within Calvin Klein, the trim team in the division works closely with the following departments: Brand Marketing, Business Process Development, Corporate Responsibility, and Central Operations. In addition, there is alignment with the Sourcing departments of CK North America and PVH Corp, both situated in New York. The Trim team works with all product divisions meet regularly to achieve leverage and synergies.
Main external communication is with direct suppliers and counterparts in Hong-Kong.
The Position:
The Trim developer is responsible for the trim development from idea (created by design) until final product. The trim article is developed within the nominated supplier matrix, aligning with the brand’s aesthetic, quality and corporate responsibility standards. The key objective in this role is to manage this development process and the cross-function collaboration with design and production.
Key Responsibilities:
SOURCING- 20%
The onshore Trim Developer is responsible to work with Trim Lead to interpret the seasonal design brief in the trim space, with focus on the essential and essential + branding trims. The developer attends trade shows and hosts matrix trim suppliers at the Amsterdam HQ.
Create and present sourcing boards to design & merchandise for seasonal development, sharing trend, newness and innovation.
Partner with offshore Trim Developer to receive sourcing images/samples from the Asia-based suppliers.
Maintain the core trim wall and seasonal trim boards for design’s working.
Manage the development timeline up to sample delivery
Sourcing new trims/finishes/shapes from trade shows, supplier visits, market research and concept design briefings
Advising design on these new developments
Developing new trims from technical drawing/ original sample inspiration, created by design team
Commenting/advising suppliers on development
Salesman Sample forecasts
Bulk forecasts
Trim price negotiation
Delivery & Minimum negotiation
Track & chase suppliers for sample delivery info
Manage seasonal trim files and keep physical trim library up to date
Manage the updates of the digital trim library in the PLM system, share out updates to relevant parties
Provide QA department overview bulk approved trims that need to be tested at 3rd party lab. Follow up with supplier to solve in non-compliant cases
DEVELOPMENT & PRODUCTION- 60%
Setups new trims in PLM system with all mandatory data, adhering to seasonal calendar deadlines and indirectly managing the designers’ output.
Initial risk assessment of potential quality or production issues based on substrate and/or application.
Development boards created for use in Sketch review, sorted by good/better/best price targets. Identify any gaps and cancellations and communicate to the supplier/offshore.
Utilize PLM to send trim forecasts to suppliers for SMS, used by suppliers to ensure proper raw materials are in stock for SMS trims making.
Monitor SMS direct developed trim delivery and communicate any delays.
Renegotiate trim prices based on merchant forecast quantity.
Manage all denim product trim developments directly, including wash & wear trials.
Set up and follow up of the seasonal 3D trim tracker, ensuring all selected core trims are requested and digitized within the seasonal timeframe
Quality check of the 3D trim file and upload/data check of the 3D trim file to the Design Hub
Keep PLM records of trims available in Design hub up to date
Sharing a weekly update with the 3D trim tracker status (pivot table) with the divisional 3D leads
Analyze garment level Pre-Buys from buying & planning to ensure new trim items used on these styles have expedited comments & approval to ensure production maintained.
All sample lines in the PLM vendor request (VR) made “approved” or “cancelled” before bulk comments deadline.
Follow-up any bulk trim testing failures with QA team.
Production visits to suppliers to create relationship, upskill technical knowledge and informed of capabilities (travel required EU, India Sub-Continent & Asia.)
PROJECTS- 20%
Onshore trim developer will work on several projects each year, both in the division and in x-divisional project group with other trim associates from PVH Europe.
Trim Specialist (ongoing)- the trim developer will be assigned a specific trim subtype that they will be the specialist of. The KPIs for this project are supplier management, being a subject matter expert for this trim subtype, and administrative functions (PLM info, corporate communication, etc.) related to their specific supplier grid.
The Ideal Candidate:
PLM Centric: the main system to generate all the material/style/product and production information.
Microsoft office.
Adobe Illustrator.
Browzwear/Vstitcher
Excellent communication skills. Be able to drive conversations with Suppliers, Buying offices, Design and Development/Production.
Education: higher textile education (Mr. Koetsier, Fashion and textile technology, TMO or similar).
Minimum 4-6 year working experience in development/sourcing/production.
Used to working under pressure with deadlines.
What You Can Expect from Us:
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities
Please include a cover letter with your application. We would love to know why this is THE role for you!

PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.
#LI-GP1

Job Title: Product Owner – Store Systems (Planning, Warehouse & Inventory Management, POS)
Job Description:
WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU


We believe you share our IKEA values and that you are excited to join us in our journey to become the world’s leading omnichannel home furnishing retailer. You enjoy a real challenge, in an environment where everything is changing. We want you to join our journey to become a fully digital busines.

Our ideal product owner has managed complex products or large-scale platforms and is obsessed with solving for user needs
They are very technical, able to put themselves in the shoes of both our developers and end users, but also have an extreme attention to detail and user experiences.
They operate well in close partnership with their engineering teams, as well as drive initially ambiguously defined projects across the broader company.They have a passion for working agile and can think abstractly to incorporate taking in wider elements than their own area or product.
They thrive in navigating complex organisations, with multiple stakeholders in many countries
We are looking for a background or strong interest in managing Retail environments and creating platforms that form a core part of a Retail Operations chain, serving millions of IKEA customers every day.


A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US


Are you a passionate customer-focused product owner, who gets a kick out of creating, building and deploying products rapidly that make a meaningful difference?

We are looking for individuals who can become a trusted partner for technical and business focused stakeholders. We have a huge vision to deliver and we are looking for someone who can come into the role, establish themselves rapidly and start building new products to augment and replace multiple processes & systems.


Your Will:

Have responsibility over a large part of our in-store operations system estate, which is undergoing a sizable strategic change.
Maximize the business results and customer value resulting from the development and deployment of digital products by making trade-off decisions as neededSupport the Product Manager in developing the product roadmap
Ensure you have a good understanding of the product roadmap and vision as defined by the Product Manager to inform the creation and prioritization of the backlogActively manage the digital product backlog including clearly expressing product backlog items and prioritizing items based on business goals and optimization of work in the agile team
Involvement in sprint planning meetings to help provide clarity and elaborate features and user stories to help the team better understand the requirements and how success will be measuredDefine and deliver acceptance criteria and the ‘Definition of Done’ working collaboratively with the rest of the team
Work in-depth with our customers to understand and qualify their needs and requirements, ensuring they are included and integrated into the product as needed
Act as a subject matter expert for other Product teams, providing insight, context and additional information as needed to help understanding of what is required of the systems and capabilities.Working collaboratively with other Product Owners & Managers across INGKA Digital to refine the backlog and identify cross dependencies
Work cross-functionally to ensure that the agile team has what it needs and remove blockers that prevent the agile team to maximize the delivery of digital products
Work across initiatives within IKEA Group, contributing to a successful combined digital product deployments
We’re looking for candidates with the following background:

Strong Stakeholder Managers, whom have experience working in complex and/or international organisationsProven Product Owner experience, owning developing and deploying software products in an agile environmentApproaches product management from a view of the customer/user and is motivated by the chance to improve the experiences of our customersExperience of Retail either eCommerce/Physical or in Supply Chain/Fulfillment activities is not essential but a big plusExperience of POS, Warehouse Management, Inventory Management & Supply Chain Management systems is also a big plus
Has experience launching digital products across multiple countries with high stakeholder influence and multi-national complexitiesExperience with Agile Product Management Tools & Processes (JIRA, MIRO, Confluence, Roadmunk etc)Experience of working with iterative, agile product development and deployment teams, including key events and objects.
Ability to build strong and meaningful interpersonal relationships. Enabling you to collaborate with and advise stakeholders. Experience within a large multi-national organization is desired.Fluency in English is a must
This role is for an indefinite contract and is located in Amsterdam.


TOGETHER AS A TEAM


At IKEA we believe in people and that we are always better together. Within Group Digital we set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast-moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace. At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.


QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


You might have some questions about the position of Digital Rollout and Planning Leader or the recruitment process and that's a good thing! If you have job specific questions please contact lee.everitt@ingka.ikea.com

If you have questions regarding the recruitment process or other practicalities, please get in touch with Catharina Platoff recruiter at catharina.platoff1@ingka.com

We are looking forward to receiving your application and will review candidates continuously, so please submit your application as soon as possible.




We like to kindly ask you to expect some delays in response to your application, due to the Christmas and New Year Holidays

Product Owner Web
(Fulltime 38h)
For our growing team in Zwaagdijk-Oost (only a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam!) we are looking for a passionate and experienced Product Owner Web. Do you want to work for a successful international retailer? Action is currently in a very exciting phase with great digital growth, so join our team!
Meet your Team
As Product Owner Consumer Web you will be part of our Customer Experience & Insights team. At Customer Experience & Insights it’s all about our ‘digital customer touchpoints’ and how we can extract relevant data in order to further drive ROPO (Research Online, Purchase Offline) and increase turnover in our stores. Our Product Owners, UX, SEO, CRO, Loyalty Marketing specialists and Data Analysts work together agilely to map and influence the customer journey using tailormade content. Through our website, newsletter, social channels and soon also the Action Consumer Apps, we are building an omnichannel customer experience platform that will impact the entire Action organization. Do you want to work at the forefront of digital marketing at a rapidly expanding, internationally successful enterprise? Get into the digital Action!
This is your daily action
As a Product Owner Web you are responsible for carrying out a customer centered roadmap for our Action website. You will be involved in initiating, coordinating and implementing cross channel related initiatives. Your skills provide you with a helicopter view, commercial mindset and customer centered focus. You handle all different stakeholder demands that cross your path. You combine their wishes and ideas and guard the realization of new functionalities. You are able to handle any challenge and to translate the wishes of the stakeholders into executable user stories, which you will prioritize in the product backlog. You will make essential trade-offs in each sprint and guard the Agile mindset within the development teams.
In this role you will work closely with the other Product Owners headed by a Lead Product Owner. Besides that, you will work in an immediate collaboration with an external development agency which is located in Amsterdam.
As Product Owner Web you will be responsible for:
Prioritizing user stories based on customer need, insights of the business and requirements on development
Transparently communicating and managing the Web roadmap in close cooperation with internal and external stakeholders
Managing costs, time (progress) and scope of the Web development (including approving the completed functionalities and making the required trade-offs) to maximize budget effectiveness
Estimating required time, costs, and impact of implementing stories from the backlog
In collaboration with the Agile Coach you’ll be coordinating and facilitating sprint/release planning meetings, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, retrospectives and demos
Fostering and coaching the team for adoption of Agile tools and practices
Coordinating progress of the outsourced IT team and vendors

This is you
You combine a pro-active, innovative and positive attitude with a customer centered focus and commercial mindset. You abilitize strong people management, product leadership skills and with your analytical, pragmatic and can-do mentality you get things done in the right way. You understand how to drive a high impacted customer experience. You are an effective communicator, comfortable in aligning and working closely together with your key stakeholders from the Digital and Marketing departments within Action. With your Agile mindset you are able and willing to constantly adapt to changing realities.
Beside that we require:
Completed Bachelor or Master degree, preferably in Marketing, Communications or Technical Business Management with a strong and demonstrable IT component.
3-5 years of experience as a Product Owner, preferably within an omnichannel retail environment
Proven track record in (native apps) product development
Professional Scrum Product Owner I certified
Fluent in written and spoken Dutch and English
What we offer
We open stores internationally on a weekly basis. The rapid growth makes Action a successful organization and requires the organization to continuously adapt. It is expected that the department will expand further, so that there are plenty of opportunities for growth. In addition, the expansion of Action brings challenges in the online field. With an enterprising and proactive attitude, you can contribute to the further professionalization of our Digital department. Beside this we offer you:
Market-based salary based on a 38-hour working week
Pension
A laptop and a telephone
15% staff discount on your purchases from Action
24 holiday days and the option to buy 5 extra days a year (based on 38 hours)
Furthermore, Action was crowned best retailer of the year in 2019 and achieved this through the revolutionary way in which we expand and continue to focus on our customers. Our marketing is all about understanding the motivation and needs of our customers and our desire to keep surprising them.
Personal growth
The Action Academy offers various training modules with which you can further develop. Programs in areas such as leadership, communication, Excel and project management are offered in-house. In addition, external development and / or training opportunities are negotiable.
Interested?
Are you ready to take Action? Apply now!
Curious what’s next?
Our recruiter will review your application and will get back to you asap.
We’ll invite you for a first job interview.
We’d like to get to know you better. Depending on the position, we might ask you to take an online assessment.
We’ll invite you for a second interview to discuss your assessment and you will meet with perhaps one of your future colleagues.
Are we still a great match? Then we’ll make you an offer you can’t refuse!

ABOUT TEMENOS
We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.
We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.
Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!


THE ROLE
The Senior Consultant is responsible for providing high level support and expertise in one or more implementation areas of the product throughout the stages of TEMENOS products implementation projects. The Senior Consultant focuses especially on more complex issues, and provides guidance and coaching to less experienced Consultants.
The Senior Consultant is capable of working with clients or partners in leading the implementation of a specific product as part of the overall project delivery. Able to handle day to day challenges and owning the resolution of issues as they arise. The Senior Consultant will have a detailed level knowledge on a minimum of one particular product area, whilst also displaying similar awareness of industry and market trends/behaviours. A strong information sharing contribution to their aligned Centre of Excellence and input on Product and Process Improvement is also expected.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Focus on more complex functional problems, generally without day-to-day supervision or direction.

Provide guidance and advice to less experienced consultants in case of complex functional issues during the implementation and client relationships development.

Has strong proficiency in the tools, systems, procedures that are used to accomplish the job.

Demonstrate strong Stakeholder Management Skills with all contacts.

Successfully implement respective Product specialism.

Take a lead role in ensuring the contribution of others adds value.

Coordinate with the TEMENOS maintenance groups to ensure that the product problems identified are understood and resolved.

The Senior Business Consultant is expected to specialize in Internal, Domestic and International payments processes. Specific knowledge of the following: SWIFT, PSD2, SEPA / SEPA faster payments/SEPA DD, Domestic Clearing, CAMT / MT messages, ISO 20022.

Analyze client business requirements and relate them to TEMENOS products capability.

Identify and validate any gaps together with proposals for their resolution (e.g. workarounds or changes in processes) and ensure any solutions proposed are realistic and within the agreed scope of the project.

Define and validate customization needs for TEMENOS products as per agreed business definitions.

Writing of specifications, if and when needed, for local development and ensure Technical Consultants have a clear understanding of these specifications.

Prepare and perform the configuration of TEMENOS products through the definition of static and semi-static data for the installation of the core system.

Prepare and perform the functional testing to support User Acceptance Testing.

Review client organization, processes and workflows and propose of a ‘post-picture’ to maximize the benefit from TEMENOS’ products.

Make recommendations on best banking practices to the Project Manager and alert him on practices that might damage the client’s business or contradict legal requirements, before recognition as a problem by the client.

Conduct parts or all of the User training in a subject, which includes design, customization and update of Training Materials and Handouts.

Perform such other duties, functions and services, consistent with status or vocational ability, as may from time to time be required.

The role requires substantial travel – normally on client site Monday to Friday and back at weekends, however there may be periods where they will be expected to extend the periods away from home with TOIL given to compensate.


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Professional with a minimum of five years of experience in Finance or in banking software consultancy.

Must be fluent in English – verbal and written. Additional language skills would be of benefit.

Good understanding of financial and banking processes around one or more of the following: Payments Credits, Accounting, Treasury, MI, Asset Management,
Securities, Private Wealth Management, Trade Finance, Retail and Corporate Banking.

IT oriented: knowledge of a banking software applications, excellent knowledge in PowerPoint, Excel as well as other MS Office environment applications.

Temenos portfolio with expert knowledge in one specific product.

Strong awareness of Industry and market developments, good overall company knowledge.

Fully understand and be able to deploy the TEMENOS Implementation Methodology.

This job involves complex activities demanding considerable co-ordination to effectively achieve the jobs end results.

Awareness of other jobs in the project team is necessary as the job activities either influence or are influenced by these.


WHY TEMENOS

You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day.

You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best.

You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises.

You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity.

You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients.

You will experience what we call – Temenosity!
We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Marketing Analytics, Group Digital, Ingka Group
Job Description:
WHO YOU ARE


We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join us in developing new revolutionizing ways for IKEA to interact with our customers. We are using cutting edge methodologies within cross-functional teams, to improve customer experience – from marketing to customer support.

Our diverse team within Data & Analytics is growing even more and we would love to talk with you, if you recognize yourself in some of the following:

consider data to be the starting point for solving (almost) any business problem
enjoy figuring out how to use your extensive knowledge of SQL and code to derive insights from large datasets in order to solve real-life, fast-paced business problems
have an extensive background in analytics, computer science, engineering or equivalent (at least MS or equivalent)
loves to visualize data through advanced BI-tools and to tell compelling data stories to senior non-technical stakeholders
able to work with a balanced trade-off between care and speed, and understands that rapid insights may come at an initial cost of rigorousness
have extensive experience working in some of the areas of: customer analytics, personalization, recommender systems, marketing, promotional effectiveness or insight analytics. (ideally in a retail setting)
are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships with senior peers and loves sharing knowledge with more junior Data Analysts

after understanding a business problem, you are passionate about applying Data & Analytics to try and solve them
are a curious problem solver who wants to keep learning!
This is our wish list! If you don’t recognize yourself in all these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We like to think long-term and invest in people’s development together with us.

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values!


You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING DAY TO DAY


IKEA is taking huge steps in its digital transformation and our Data Analysts are working in cross-functional teams, building intelligent systems for data-driven business decisions. For example, we are developing models, dashboards and tools to answer questions like:

which marketing activities are effective and relevant?
can we predict individual customers’ interest and behavior?
how can we build a global visualization tool to measure the incremental impact of our loyalty program?
how do we build a global marketing framework for automating accurate predictions in real-time, while at the same time personalizing inspirational content and communicating to the customer in the right channel at the right time?
how can we design loyalty club member rewards to nurture a sustainable customer relationship?
can we quickly derive insights on why some customer segments respond particularly well to a marketing campaign?
how much should and will we be selling of each article over time and which commercial levers should we pull to influence this?
Perhaps you have your own questions to ask? Our goal is to create a better everyday life for the many people by creating a unique partnership with each customer. To do so, we want to give customers the most beneficial offer for them, exactly when they need it, and support them throughout their journey with IKEA in the best way possible.


OUR TEAM WITHIN IKEA


You will work in Data & Analytics together with other Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Stewards and Data Architects. Together you will be joining cross-functional teams consisting of colleagues from Technology, Product, Design, that designs, implements and deploys products that help to solve these kinds of problems. It will be a mix of product insights, data visualization and writing code – as well as talking with product owners and business stakeholders.

IKEA has long been a global leader in home furnishing. We are proud of our vision to improve the everyday life of the many people. But our industry is quickly changing and we need to adapt to stay competitive.

As part of IKEA’s journey to strengthen our digital capabilities, we are building a Data & Analytics function. This team is working on problems across the company, ranging from customer modeling, pricing, online shopping, visual intelligence to logistics optimization.

We can offer you:

Work on some very interesting problems as described above, and you are encouraged to spot new opportunities or to collaborate with Data & Analytics colleagues in other specialist teams
Opportunities to have global impact with your work
Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform and we use a lot of open source tools across the board
Hardware and OS of your choice
A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with outstanding experience across all aspects of Data & Analytics)
Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning)
Flexible and friendly working environment

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!


Does this sound like your next challenge? IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global workplace. And as the world’s leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.


If you have questions regarding the recruitment process please reach out to our recruiter Annette Björkquist-Åhstedt at annette.bjorkquist-ahstedt@ingka.com.


Please apply with your application in English. Note that we can’t process any applications through email. Thank you!

Je evalueert en optimaliseert key account marketingprogramma'sje bent (mede-)verantwoordelijk voor de organisatie van de collectiepresentaties (B2B) die vier keer per jaar worden gehouden.je bent (mede-)verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling, coördinatie en uitrol van diverse beurzenWij zoeken iemand met: een afgeronde HBO marketing, communicatie, modecommercie en/of mediaopleidingminimaal vijf jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functieervaring binnen een Retail gestuurde organisatieervaring met het werken binnen teamskennis van de Nederlandse – en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Duits is een préeen grote affiniteit met mode en een originele en eigen visieeen positief ingestelde, flexibele en stressbestendige persoonlijkheideen accurate houding en sterke communicatieve en organisatorische vaardighedenzowel teamspirit als zelfstandigheideen enthousiast, leergierig, gedreven en doelgerichte instellingbeschikbaarheid van 40 uur p.w.Wat bieden we jou?uitdagende en afwisselende werkzaamhedeneen dynamische werkomgevingeen uitdagende baan bij een groeiende Retail- en WholesaleorganisatieDaarnaast bieden we: reiskostenvergoedingpersoneelskorting8% vakantiegeldgoede pensioenregeling25 vakantiedagen per jaar (bij een fulltime dienstverband)Soort dienstverband: Bepaalde tijd, Onbepaalde tijdAanvullende betalingen:VakantiegeldArbeidsvoorwaarden:PensioenPersoneelskortingReiskostenvergoedingWerkschema:ma-vr

Job Title: International Key Account Manager eCommerce (online accounts)
Job Description:
About Our Client
Fashion company with premium lingerie brands

Job Description
As the International Key Account Manager eCommerce (Online accounts) you will be reporting into the Head of Wholesales
Your responsibilities will be to:
Develop the E-Commerce Strategy and growth plan for the online retailers / digital accounts
Partner with the local KAM on the development of an account specific business plan and digital activation plan to achieve the overall growth plan
Align the strategic busines plans including brand and content optimization, data sharing, landing page planning and to ensure the local implementation
Develop relationships with Key European Market places and to provide sales service to our retail partners working with Market places
Be the E-Commerce Channel expert and digital advisor for our partners
Create sales opportunities by analyzing data, website content and competitors
Identify and lead new business opportunities within E-Commerce/digital accounts
Identify and follow relevant KPI's, track the necessary data and manage the weekly follow-up against the targets
Provide recommendations to drive shopper experience and market share, by utilizing data, keyword search and customer insights
Monitor and improve brand distribution, representation and discoverability
Engage and collaborate with multifunctional teams (marketing, trade marketing, B2B, sales, operations,…) to drive the execution of the business strategy
Support and coach the sales teams in digitalization
Partner with supply chain and the customers to ensure sales forecasting, product availability and customer service levels

Fashion Company with Premium Lingerie Brands
Key Account Manager - Online Accounts
The Successful Applicant
Your profile
You have a Master's degree (ex. Commercial Engineering, Business, Economics, Marketing) with a passion for fashion
You have minimum 5 years of relevant Sales/KAM experience and you are experienced in working with Market places/ online accounts
You have an advanced knowledge of web analytics, and knowledge of creative web design, site functionality, usability and marketing
You are fluent in English, knowledge of Dutch is a plus
You have a commercial mind and are driven by sales results
You are a team player, a people person and real relation builder
You are a skilled negotiator with great communication and presentation skills
You are strong in analytics and you think solutions

What's on Offer
Working for Van de Velde means working for a value driven, international, innovative company in fashion industry, with beautiful premium brands that truly make a difference in women's lives
You will work together with an international team of passionate, professional, warm, customer- and result oriented colleagues
A competitive compensation and benefits package
You will get the opportunity to learn, develop and grow

If you need a visa sponsor, and you are good we will consider to be your sponsor.We are Maya Gold Trading, an organic trading company based in Amsterdam. Our core business is bulk organic ingredient trading & private label solutions. However, we are passionate about our brand Maya Gold Organic, we want to push the brand more. What does that mean? The daily bread of the firm is to import large quantities of sugar, seeds, oils from Asia and to sell them in large quantities (for cheap! And often with 30 days credit terms) to food manufacturers and traders in Europe. The butter of our business is the private label (contract manufacturing, white labelling) which means we receive an art file from a supermarket or brand and we will produce 5000 to 20000 units finished for retail with their brand. We produce they sell. We must continue to do this while also growing our own label Maya Gold Organic which has over 40 products in the range. Lately we launched a vegan chocolate spread similar to Nutella but healthier and tastier. We also recently launched an organic CBD oil with a fantastic profit margin.We are re-launching our web-shop www.mayagoldorganic and we soon will engage clients directly and will be able to post our products to their home. Our Instagram account will also get more attention on the future in line with our online strategy. You will help us to post and to engage clients.Our range of raw materials include organic all things coconut, agave, vegan proteins, superfoods, hemp, cacao, CBD and moreYou will be part of our international sales team and you will be pro-actively reaching out to companies in our targeted markets in Europe to discover their potential needs. you must first qualify the lead. Is this potential client worth it? Does it fit the bill? You shall lead score from our own data base, trade show directories, google and with your great product knowledge, quick and accurate administrative skills, and your proactive, customer oriented attitude, you know how to connect with customers, and how to make potential customers excited about our portfolio. successful in this role, and you will be an important moving peace in an already successful sales team, which you can learn from every day. Ideally, within 3-6 months, you will be ready to become an Account Manager and handle the full sales process yourself.Your Tasks: Contact targeted account lists in specific areas in Europe (maintain and build a good customer relationship, reply to customer questions, send updates about delivery times and stock status to back office)Managing everything concerning order processing (process incoming orders, ensure delivery of new product samples and sales material, etc.)Ensure correct logistics planning and correct invoicing of the delivered ordersReach out these targeted accounts pro-actively via phone, email and socialDocument everything in our * CRM BASEWorking hours run from 9am to 6pm with a 1 hr break in the middle of the dayWork is carried out in the office Hoogte Kadijk 143F1 unless you are working from home due to pandemic work seating placementThe requirements: HBO (higher professional education) mentalityPersistence in contacting and lead scoringLong Term mentality, you will see results but not as fast as anyone hopes, ce la vie.Strong mental attitude / strong analytical skills (can you see the whole and the relationship of each part to the other)Minimum of 2-3 years of relevant work experienceSales mindsetCustomer oriented with advanced communication skillsKnowledge of / experience with Exact online software is considered a plusGood verbal and written communication skills in both Dutch and English (other languages are also appreciated)Ability to communicate in a clear way, to work in a team and the desire to learnExperience in B2B cold callingStress resistantWe offer: -The salary is below normal for our firm due to the pandemic and we know this. Job Title: Service Employee at Jack’s Casino Oostzaan
Job Description:
Do you easily conjure a smile on the faces of your guests?
﻿Liever in het Nederlands solliciteren? Solliciteer dan op de functie van Casinomedewerker!
De functie
As a real pro in hospitality, you absolutely enjoy pleasing your guests. Today you have a morning shift; early out of bed. Fortunately, you get a free evening in return!
Together with your colleagues, you prepare everything for opening the casino. Often, familiar faces are already waiting for the casino to open; of course, you recognise them immediately. You welcome new guests and take them around the casino while informing them about our games.
During the entire day, you and your colleagues take care of our guests and make sure they will have everything they need. In the meantime, you make sure that everything looks tip-top. Most important is that you pamper your guests and treat them like real VIPs. This means that you tell them everything about the ins and outs of their game and about our drives, and that you know how to chat in a friendly manner with them.
If someone wins something, that of course calls for a celebration and that’s what you do! But also if someone is not so lucky at that moment, you know what to say and how you can best consol him. As a Casino Assistant, you can really make the difference, resulting in both new and existing guests wanting to come back to our casino.
The day just flies by! Tomorrow you will attend a training session about how you deal with difficult situations. No one day is the same at Jack’s Casino!
If you want to take a peek into the kitchen and see what the day looks like for a catering employee, then take a look!
Het profiel
For the function of service employee we expect:
Experience in the catering, leisure and retail sectors, but mainly a passion for working with people
Hospitality-orientation to be your second nature
Good communication skills
Stress-resistance
A representative look
Flexible employability due to alternating shifts (during the week and in the weekends at various hours)
Furthermore, it is important that you are at least 21 years old (DEKRA criteria).
De organisatie
Jack’s Casino Oostzaan is part of JVH gaming & entertainment, a market leader in land-based casinos in the Netherlands. We currently operate more than 85 casinos throughout the Netherlands under the trade names of Jack’s Casino, Flash Casino’s and Flamingo Casino. Every brand has its own character.
Safety and care for our guests are top priorities; you will be trained to be able to supervise safe and responsible play behaviour. We also provide training courses in hospitality, knowledge about slot machines. Explanations of our games are all part of our standard.
JVH gaming & entertainment is ambitious and wants to grow, and that is also what we expect of you! It is our mission to make each of our casinos the casino in its specific region. By working together in an open, sincere and respectful manner, we offer our guests top service and amaze them time and again. We do this in a joint effort. If this appeals to you, then we will be pleased to welcome you as a new colleague.
Het aanbod
From us you can expect:
A good salary suitable for the function (even if you are younger than 22, you simply receive the salary of an adult!)
Holidays: 25 (but do return to work )
Holiday allowance to ensure you a wonderful holiday
Bonus scheme
Prospect of a permanent contract
Travel allowance @ 019 cent per kilometre
Flexible work hours
Overtime in free time or money
Good pension scheme
Non-contributory occupational disability insurance
Development possibilities
Trainings & workshops for self-development
Extra allowance for holidays and night shifts
A super nice team where outings and get-togethers for drinks is standard
Company uniform to make you look good
Meer informatie
Apply now and become one of our colleagues! You are welcome!
If you have questions about this vacancy, feel free to call one of our Recruiters via +31 (0)73 6273620. You can also send your questions via WhatsApp (+31 (0)6 12146842) or simply come by one of our casino. If you want to stay informed about our new vacancies, then follow us on Facebook!
No recruitment agencies please!

About Our Client
Multinational FMCG Company
Job Description
As International Trade Marketing Manager, you will be part of the global Sales & Trade Marketing team. This role focuses on driving profitable growth in the categories. You will be providing central support in building local trade marketing related capabilities and solutions - via development of content, trainings, workshops and participation in local projects. Also you will be the center of excellence and point of reference for global Trade Marketing. In addition you will support the Operating Companies on specific needs or projects which can be part of a long-term or short-term development need (category/shelf management, commercial booster projects, channel or customer projects, etc.). You are also responsible to provide support to local teams on function-related questions, sharing of best practices and participating in regional conferences or visits with the objective of building commercial capabilities. Your responsibilities will include: Category Vision & Category Development
Evolve and roll out of the global Category Vision and category strategies into Operating Companies. Closely collaborate with Group Marketing teams to define segment growth drivers and strategies based on market clusters
Support category teams (Group/Operating Companies) in category knowledge from shopper and retail angle
Detect Trade Marketing support and development needs for local entities. Support local teams in capability development roadmap. You will develop a Category Management Training and learning agenda
Development of global channel and support development of local channel visions. Develop insights to support different channel visions
Evolve global Touchpoint vision to secure category and brand confrontation
Business Intelligence / Channel and Shopper Insights
Develop channel knowledge and detect key trends. Use intel resources such as Kantar Retail. Create facts to support development of different channel visions
Development of category analytics/tools to support local Trade Marketing teams with analytics and in defining optimal category strategies
Develop global category-led insights and support Group Category/Marketing teams and local Operating Companies in category knowledge, opportunities and trends
Shopper Research: identify and coordinate international shopper research projects. Align priorities and secure resources in Operating Companies; be the contact point for shopper research in alignment with Group CMI team. Secure business relevance of shopper research. Participation in local research projects and aggregation of local learnings into global toolkits and playbooks. Sharing learnings regularly throughout global community
Support global launches with KPI's, tracking, measurement and best practice development
Revenue Management
Develop Global Revenue Management agenda together with regional/global stakeholders
Drive and Develop our Pack Price Architecture Playbook. Lead in global roll out of playbook into local markets
Develop ROI mindset and solutions in Trade and Shopper Marketing. Support both global as well as local Shopper Marketing teams
Shopper Marketing
Support major global/regional Shopper Marketing initiatives (activations, seasonal, touchpoint development)
Develop and share learnings
Cooperate with Brand Teams on major global launches (selling stories, trade kits, KPI's)
Sharing & Community Management
Best Practice Sharing: develop a strong sharing culture for the benefit of Operating companies
Participate in developing the global community and facilitating their exchange
Development and organization of webinars, workshops and conferences
Fast moving consumer goods (food)
Dynamic marketing role with global scope
The Successful Applicant
For this position we are looking for someone who has a holistic experience in Trade/Customer Marketing. You are practical and pragmatic, understand the business and at the same time are able to conceptualize in order to provide a global view and to help markets with concepts for growth. The ideal candidate has:
MA/MBA Degree (preferably Business Management or Marketing Management)
8+ years of commercial experience demonstrated in Trade marketing, Sales or Category Development
Experience in Project Management
Qualitative and quantitative Research experience (Consumer/shopper) and Analytical Experience (e.g. Nielsen, IRI, GfK)
What's on Offer
Good monetary compensation

Ga werken als Douane Declarant!
Voor één van de grootste onafhankelijke douanedienstverleners zijn wij op zoek naar ervaren douane declaranten. Bent u de kandidaat die wij zoeken? Solliciteer dan direct!

Wie is de opdrachtgever?
De organisatie biedt een one-stop shop voor douanezaken. De douane-experts helpen kleine, middelgrote en grote ondernemingen bij het zorgeloos internationaal zakendoen. Deze organisatie is lokaal aanwezig op belangrijke logistieke knooppunten in Nederland, Duitsland en België en sterk verbonden in een wereldwijd netwerk. In Nederland zijn ze gevestigd in: Voorschoten, Maastricht, Rotterdam, Schiphol en Oosterhout. De organisatie biedt hulp bij en is expert op het gebied van diverse logistieke vraagstukken, zoals de transport via de spoorwegen, lucht, water en autowegen. Zij zijn actief in de retail, automotive, voedsel, spoorwegen, luchtvaart en mobiele technologie.

Wat gaat u doen?
Als Customs & Trade officer houdt u zich bezig met douane gerelateerde werkzaamheden. U zorgt voor efficiënte afhandeling van import en export douanedocumentatie voor de klant. U dag bestaat onder andere uit.
Contact houden met de klant en douane.
Signaleren en opvolgen van meer complexe vraagstukken.
Het verwerken van alle voorkomende douaneaangiftes (in-, uit- en doorvoer, GDB en PD- cliënt).
Opmaken en afhandelen van douanedocumenten en overige administratieve documentatie.
Het rapporteren van douane technische problemen en aandragen van eventuele oplossingen.
Het opmaken, controleren en afboeken van facturatie.
U heeft ervaring als douane declarant;
U bent betrokken, accuraat, verantwoordelijk en resultaatgericht;
U heeft een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Duits is een pré;
U bent voor minimaal één dag in de week beschikbaar.

Senioren zijn belangrijk voor de arbeidsmarkt
Senioren worden door de vergrijzing steeds belangrijker voor de arbeidsmarkt. Gelukkig zijn er dan ook meer en meer 65-plussers die nog graag hun kennis en ervaring inzetten. Niet voor niets noemde de Raad voor Volksgezondheid en Samenleving gepensioneerden “het geschenk van de eeuw”.

Gaat u aan de slag als professional in de regio Schiphol?
Klik op de ‘solliciteer button’ of klik hier en schrijf u in. Beide doet u online, binnen enkele minuten. Zorg dat uw cv is voorzien van enkele referenten, inclusief contactgegevens. Voeg daarnaast ook een scan van uw diploma(’s) toe. Door middel van een referentie- en diplomacheck zorgen wij altijd voor de juiste professional op de juiste plek.
Wanneer uw profiel en arbeidswensen aansluiten op onze vacatures en eisen van onze opdrachtgevers, nemen wij telefonisch of per e-mail contact met u op.
Heeft u nog vragen over werken via 65plus? Bekijk dan zeker onze veelgestelde vragen (FAQ).

High-growth startup looking for a Bilingual Customer Service Rockstarto help build the future of B2B Commerce.In shortInnovative online B2B marketplace to bring brands and retailers together transforming wholesale commerce;Using machine learning to match retailers with suppliers; data, recommendations, social interaction, etc.;Talented team and extremely ambitious growth plansThe need for helping customers is in your veins. You stand for our clients' growth.Transformed a former restaurant into an office space. Obviously, the bar is still standing and open on Friday’s (true story)!About usOrderchamp is an online B2B marketplace that brings brands and retailers together to transform the wholesale experience. We believe that the buying model through trade-fairs, on-the-road sales reps and cash&carry centers is in need of a digital boost. Our aim is to provide cutting-edge technology to small and medium-sized business owners, previously available exclusively to large companies, to empower them to compete in a rapidly changing industry.We stand for quality. On a daily basis, we find new one-of-a-kind suppliers and use machine learning to connect them with retailers. We take the guesswork out of the equation by unlocking the power of data for all. Leveraging our social platform to create interactions between both parties, our mandate is two-fold: 1) retailers can easily discover distinctive and high quality products and; 2) brands can quickly do business with new sellers in new regions. We want manufacturers and shop owners from around the world to interact and do business with one another. Our vision: a hassle-free wholesale experience.Entrepreneurship and commerce runs through our veins; that’s why we are building this product for our customers. The majority of our team was responsible for SaaS ecommerce platform, SEOshop, which was acquired by Lightspeed before recently going public (TSX: LSPD). You live to help a customer, you breath to see opportunities for them and are pro-actively following up on this.
